review_text: A pleasant and helpful service provider. In this sector that's a rarity these days. Would highly recommend 5‚òÜ!
great company to work with, helpful and friendly staff! would highly recommend!!

One star is too generous for this ‚Äúcompany‚Äù. Each job takes an incredible amount of time to get started, if it ever gets started. It will have to become your part time job to chase them, frequently have to explain jobs/requests to them on their own overpriced portal or you‚Äôll be doing their work for them by contacting contractors directly to get updates, invoices, reports of works, resolve poor workmanship due to lack of direction by 91bc. For every job being quoted you‚Äôll have to be on site as contractors consistently have no idea why they are there or what they are quoting for, like us you‚Äôll receive quotes for things and the wrong work will be undertaken.  Property Managers are on a revolving door, you won‚Äôt ever be told your property manager has changed. Communication is poor, fragmented and incredibly frustrating. They frequently blame appointed contractors for issues. They have even given out my personal details to contractors without permission, which is a breach of data protection. Every interaction I am somehow shocked at how inept they are.

Roofers Alex and Jamie from 91bc are like a breath of fresh air. I‚Äôve had lots of problems with a leaking roof for years and various attempts have been made to fix it have not been successful. Alex and Jamie visited this morning, very polite and friendly, spent a lot of time inspected the roof space, repaired what they could then informed me of their assessment and intended repairs. With the heavy rain it is too dangerous to go out in the roof today so are planning to get a scaffold tower and detailed the repairs they will carry out next week (many slates needing replaced; glass in skylight needing replaced)I am so confident in what they reported and plan to do.I am delighted-at last 2 guys who know exactly what they are talking about and didn‚Äôt make me feel like I was exaggerating the problem. Thank you very Alex and Jamie, you were so polite and very helpful.Claire C

I owned a property in Edinburgh that I let. 91BC were the factors. My very good tenants reported a problem which I immediately reported to 91BC. During the next 6 months they lied to me(their client) they lied to my property agent, they lied to the tenants. Some work needed doing and 91BC did everything to avoid doing it. My tenants wanted to buy the property but,understandably wanted the situation resolved. So, to ensure I could sell my property I had to reduce the price of the property by ¬£720 in order for the tenants/purchasers to agree to buy. ¬£720 was a quote for doing the work that 91BC should have done. So, 91BC, pay me what you owe me. Next stop, Scottish Ombudsman. In the meantime, if you are thinking of renting or buying a property that is managed by this shambles, don‚Äôt. Ps! Almost forgot. 91BC sent my final invoice(which I paid) to the new owners claiming they owner it! Not only was this totally wrong, 91BC broke every Data Protection Act going! They revealed my mother‚Äôs address! She‚Äôs livid.

I have today needed the services of roofers in my property in Dennistoun- and was delighted with the two roofers who attended- Alex and Jamie . Both were there before I arrived, absolutely courteous and helpful- and true tradesmen . Highly recommended.

Absolutely appalling excuse of a factoring service. Massively inflated bills, threats of removal of owners belongings and consistent made up jobs to try and fund themselves money. When they're not pilfering their clients with monthly changing fees, and showing their embarrassing ineptitude such as not knowing what parts of a Street belong to which property ... they will tack on ridiculous commission and additional fees to cover their back of house changes and web updates. Avoid at all cost.

I was very lucky to have been a tenant with ELPM for almost four years and highly recommend them. They are by far the best letting agency I‚Äôve been with in Edinburgh! Communication has always been clear, all works done quickly and just such a joy to deal with them.

ELPM do absolutely everything to an exceptionally high standard!  Time and time again they have gone above and beyond!  Renting a house from ELPM is like moving into a property that is being lived in for the very first time!  An all round wonderful experience!!  Highly recommend!!!

Dishonest, disorganised, and spiteful people. Talk to three people, get three different answers, all of which are unreliable. Long story short, verbal agreements were disregarded after move out, leading to a deposit dispute. They are purposely waiting until each deadline of the dispute resolution just to cause inconvenience.

Further, they changed the flat from furnished to unfurnished after we moved out and they're trying to recover their own removal cost from our deposit by claiming things of ours were the issue (literally, coats in the hall and food in the refrigerator, and again, previously discussed). By agreement, I left well over a thousand pounds worth of furniture for the landlord. They were happy to receive it, but want to nickel and dime me over nonsense.

If you're unlucky enough to get stuck with this agency, do not trust them at all. Get absolutely everything in writing. Demand it. Don't trust their smiles and their "Don't worry about it, it's fine." They will conveniently forget about it when it comes time to get your money back.

Very disappointing, agreed to rent a cottage long term, after living in it for a month more and more unsanitary and shoddy cover-ups became obvious. The director of the company handling the property came to take a look and was rude, loud and clearly annoyed that I had dared to point out the problems. I have never experienced such unpleasant behaviour from a letting agent before and can only warn prospective clients to be aware of this. Definitely not to be recommended.

We have recently rented a property with ELPM and can highly recommend! One of the best experiences we have had with a rental agency. From finding our rental property to moving in, we have found them to be extremely helpful and informative. Fantastic communication and quick to respond to any issues, we feel very well supported as tenants. Special thanks to Emma who has been amazing throughout the process.

My partner and I own a property in the same block as the person who has previously slated Abacus, as as our late queen said, recollections may vary, we have nothing but praise for Abacus, having had ten years of the previous useless Factor, Abacus have been a breath of fresh air, proactive, positive and getting things done. I would suggest that the person who has sold their property to pay maintenance bills, A) you were aware of shared expenses when you bought the property, if not, speak to your solicitor or read your deeds. B) everyone else who owns a property in this block has paid their share, no question or blame C) if a property is bought with a heavy discount to allow for the required maintenance,  one would expect  the said owners cannot complain when the bill is due.
Abacus have managed our property professionally and always maintained excellent communication with the owners, we certainly have no complaints and know that this is the opinion of the majority of the owners.

I have never known such a horrible person as the person who works in this unprofessional organisation.. I‚Äôve had to sell my home because of money owed, because of my financial circumstances, and four days before I move she‚Äôs demanded even more money for a job, I didn‚Äôt even vote for, and won‚Äôt see completed . Luckily she‚Äôs resigned from the job, because other owners are taking her to a tribunal, what does that say about the firm ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

Jackie and her team provide a fantastic service.  We are based in a different country and everything runs smoothly and efficiently.  She is very proactive in ensuring the building is kept in a safe and pleasant condition.  With our previous property company I would have had at least one issue every month, that was never easily resolved.  Keep up the good work Abacus.

We used for residential cleaning services. People are really kind and lovely, but regularly want to reschedule, invoiced for more money and time than what was agreed, cleans were not of a good standard and unfortunately when kindly ending our agreement we did not get a response which was a shame.

We have used Abacus Property Factors for two years and always found their services to be carried out in an efficient, effective and economical manner. I would have no hesitation in recommending them. Jackie always communicates promptly.

After the other estate agent put me down, one of my friends advised me to put my property on market again by AB property estate agents.
Since beginning I received a professional service. They always respond quickly and have very good communications with both sides, they made my property sale process very smoothly and stress free.
I am very happy with their services and strongly recommend them.
Thanks Alex and Morgan

I can‚Äôt recommend AB Property enough. From my first initial contact with Morgan in the office, to Alex who came out to my property for a valuation, to Lesley in sales. Everyone made me feel so relaxed and at ease at something that can be so stressful! Their level of professionalism and research makes the difference. A great team all throughout. Not to mention I bought my property from them also, and again, they made it so easy and relaxed to deal with.

It's the 2nd time I used AB Property. 2 years ago I bought my first flat and now I sold it with them. I can't thank them enough for the smooth sale and the personalised care from the whole team during the process. Especially Bill was a big help for me in porting my mortgage and even corresponding with other agents to buy my new house. I can't recommend AB Property enough. It was a fantastic experience with them from start to finish.

Had my house sale completed this year and also my mums recently and everything from start to finish went smoothly with them both.
Everyone was very helpful and they kept in touch regularly.
Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend AB Property Consultants to anyone selling their home
Thanks for such a great service.

I'm a Private Landlord with a small letting portfolio. Over the last 16 years I've used various letting agents, most disappointed for various reasons.
I switched to AB Property Consultants 4 Years ago, and what an excellent company,  friendly efficient staff, great Marketing, and best photography I've experienced.
I'm happy to recommend them for buying, selling or for rental services.
Richard Wheeler.
Landlord.

Abbey Services recently supplied and fitted a new composite sink and mixer tap in my home. They removed the old sink and fitted the new one seamlessly and professionally and left the area spotless as though they had never been. The sink and tap are perfect - can‚Äôt fault the service or professionalism!

The team at Abbey Services did a fantastic job installing our media wall with integrated fire. Very professional & left our house tidy at the end of each shift. Thanks again for all your efforts üëçüèª

Called Abbey Services on Monday evening to quote for a wireless alarm to upgrade my existing alarm. Derek came over and priced a AJAX system that would be able to work through my phone and now can be alarmed remotely. I had agreed a price on Tuesday afternoon and was fitted before 13:00 on the WEDNESDAY! Ryan who came to do the installation of the alarm couldn't of been more professional.

All round great service and would use again without a doubt.

Have used Abbey Services now for 5 years.During that time I have had a boiler fitted and also smoke alarms fitted etc. I have also had plumbing work done in the bathroom. I have always found that their workmanship is to the highest standard. They are always reliable and are there when they say they will be. I would have no hesitation in recommending them for any job big or small

After struggling to find a reliable company to carry out some plumbing for me. I came across Abbey Services and I'm so glad I did. Yes, they are a bit more expensive than some but that reflects in the quality service. Everything from getting the quote to having the work carried out took less than a week.

The chap that arrived to do the work, who's name I have forgotten was in and out in no time having done one of the neatest bits of plumbing I've ever seen.

Derek, who dealt with my enquiry and emails was incredibly helpful and even allowed me to pay for the job on the day with when I had mentioned that paying up front made me feel a bit uneasy, however not a concern I'd have again in the future.

This company has truly earned the rating it has. If you're in any doubt and using them, then don't be. You won't be disappointed.

Fiona and Stuart were such a big help when we moved to our rental property, both wonderful people and have been very professional and kind. I would 100% recommend Abbey Forth! The move from my old house to the property we are in now was smooth and fast. Great customer service! Thank you both so much :)

Avoid at all costs. They do not pass vital information to potential buyers and their ‚Äúmarketing‚Äù is based images taken on an iphone. Tried to raise dissatisfaction and main points of complaint were ignored with response being a threat of legal action rather than an offer to discuss.
Absolutely would not recommend.

If it was possible, I'd have given Abbey Forth zero stars. Here's my experience with them:

The place I rented from Abbey Forth had not been cleaned when I moved in. It was in a disgusting state with several broken fixtures. I took many photos and informed them that, because I was having to clean my new flat, I wouldn't be paying for the place to be professionally cleaned when I moved out.

Throughout my year at the property, they were unprofessional and unhelpful when other problems arose: trying to charge me for boiler repairs (a boiler which was leaking on day 1), failing to resolve a drainage issue outside the kitchen door and, worst of all, falling to resolve an infestation of slugs in the kitchen - an obvious health hazard.

When I moved out, they unsurprisingly tried to deduct ¬£190 from my deposit for cleaning. I successfully disputed this charge with the deposit scheme, using the pictures and emails I'd sent them over the length of the tenancy. The deposit scheme found that, as the property was not cleaned to a good condition for the start of the tenancy, that I should only having to pay ¬£60

In summary: Abbey Forth is the worst estate agent I've ever used. Rude staff and a general ethos of trying to squeeze money out of tenants for as little effort as possible. Only sign up with them if you are desperate and have no other options. If this is the case, then please make sure you document everything for the inevitable struggle to get your deposit back

I wanted to share a positive review of Abbey Forth as new tenants. Stuart was very helpful assisting in securing a property for us to rent with two small dogs which can be difficult. He also organised with the landlord to ensure we had a washing machine  (previous tenant had taken this). We did have issues with getting the washing machine installed, not through fault of Abbey Forth but we were kept updated along with way whilst waiting for a plumber to come out. Think it‚Äôs important to share that our experience has been positive so far with the company!
First year was good, second year not as clear cut, had to follow up regarding rental payments etc. Quite stressful

Our building moved to Factors Direct a little over a year ago. Storms and pre-existing issues have caused lots of roof problems, but they‚Äôve been a constant help in sorting out repairs and getting agreement among owners for work to be done - all the stuff you don‚Äôt want to have to deal with personally. Consistently good communication. Happy with the service I‚Äôve received.

I am so happy our tenement switched to Factors Direct! They are a vast improvement on our previous factors. Their service is personal and they are quick to respond to requests and emails. I am delighted with the sub contractors they use for the garden and close and all the costs are reasonable too.

Used to be with Ross and Liddell in our old property moved to new house where factors direct were factors and we can honestly say they have been brilliant one phone call and the problem is fix within a few days with top quality tradesmen, we do highly recommend Factors Direct they do what they say

Changing factors , I was told, isn't easy.  Wrong - it was way harder.
But we had to .
The research and feedback produced only 1 result - Factors Direct.  It took some months to get the transfer done but FD were discreetly there every step of the way.
Two months in now and things are starting to click;
Gardeners properly instructed and a 2 year contract agreed
Electricity tariff for communal areas in apartment blocks being assessed (previous factor let it lapse onto highest tariff)
Buildings insurance for same extensively researched
Sensible application for minor repairs (previously : 2 light bulb replacement = ¬£300 " it was in our authorised limit.")

But the main thing is communication.  Communication is key.
So far, so very good
Factors direct have been excellent so far, really glad we made the switch to them this year, they were so helpful during this process as well. Recommended!

I‚Äôve been looking at the reviews just to see what they‚Äôre like online because I haven‚Äôt heard a good thing about them from anyone in the estate. We have all been talking a lot recently about them, and no one likes them and wants them gone. They rob you of your money with their overcharges. Everyone I‚Äôve told about my charges has said the same thing, they‚Äôre ridiculous. My friend has a new build and he pays a lot less to maintain their grounds. Another friend also pays a lot less, and I‚Äôm talking under ¬£100 with no huge balance. I seriously think they need to be investigated as a company because something is not right. Nearly ¬£4000 for grass cutting seems excessive especially when the job is not done correctly. They also bill you for gardening but the planting is awful. The gardeners were here yesterday and they done nothing which more than just me noticed.The buzzer systems on all flats also don‚Äôt work.

Avoid these crooks like the plague. Do not buy a property that they are factoring. I have attached some photos of the ground currently that have been neglected.

If I could give minus rating I would. Strachur Wharf as its poshly known has a problem with fly tipping at bin store on Strachur Grove. JG put up a camera at residents expense to deter this, spoke with Jordan who is development manager to be told camera is a "dummy" camera and there is nothing further they can do but to contact GCC as it is an environmental issue with leaving items at bin shelter. The residents here in houses pay for their own bulk uplift but are expected to contribute to the communal bin area which we are not "allowed" use as it's sole use is for flats it sits beside.
We pay a quarterly fee to have these clowns "manage" the development and what do we get in return ?? Very little to nothing, an appalling management service which should be avoided !!

I notified the factor about this problem three months ago!!! Water is entering the gas boiler and it is blocking! This morning it was full of water again and I have no heatingüò°üò°üò°Shame on this company!!! The bills are insanely high and we don't get any support! Where is our money going????P.S Your answer is inadequate to say the least! I can see a leak in the gutters and that's where the problem with my water heater comes from! It's impudent of you to write to me that the water heater is not your problemü§®üò°

Absolutely hopeless factors . I've lived at my property for 7 years now . Having to pull my bins through my house, due to other neighbours blocking access to the path with their own bins. Have asked for support from factors to ask if they can remove them . All nice on the phone but have done absolutely nothing to help . Nest time they try to over charge me for other neighbours bulk uplifts I know exactly where I'll be telling them to go . Over charging company with no support at all

I wish there was an option to give zero stars. Absolutely awful service from this company to the point I'm considering legal action. Refuse to complete communal repairs for areas not on your title deeds. They send generic responses when you challenge them on the information they supply that is incorrect. If you can, avoid this company at all costs. The reviews speak for themselves. I think they hope people will roll over and let things go if they ignore the issue long enough but unfortunately for them that won't be happening on this occasion.

I recently paid a ¬£50 reduced parking penalty charge despite holding a valid residents‚Äô permit purchased for two vehicles at a cost of ¬£150. Unfortunately, I forgot to update the vehicle registration number when changing cars. I appealed the PCN, explaining that this was a genuine administrative oversight rather than misuse of parking entitlement, but the appeal was rejected. While I understand the rules, I feel the decision lacked proportionality and discretion given that a valid permit was in place. I hope this feedback helps improve how similar cases are considered in the future.

So Aberdeen city council have commended there bullies who work for NES, on intimidating people by getting into faces and issuing fines as well as commending them on breaking the law, breaking Disability law and breaking the Human rights law, this commendation was given by Senior Compliance officer Daniel. Who also has lied by saying I‚Äôm not allowed to see the footage but on the government website it says I have every right to see it as it‚Äôs my GDPR.

This is the head office for Aberdeen city council, who are located in this beautiful building. The office is fully accessible to all individuals and can be easily travelled to by numerous bus services.  The staff do had fantastic job that many would not want to do.

Next to impossible to get hold of - website doesn't load even when trying on multiple browsers, so you can't do an online query. Then if you do eventually get in to make a query, it takes 90 days for a response, by which time it'll have been a waste of time contacting them. Or, you can sit on the phone for hours of your day to be cut off - and you can't even email them. Completely inaccessible.
Waiting 2 hours to report repair to be done. No enough staff or what?
It's a nice building, very attractive!

Its clear who completes the 'Reviews' here its the local council workers. There is no way these reviews are accurate. Years ago maybe but since covid getting to speak to a department has been horrific

Absolute shambles, visited on Friday 27th Sep to obtain a bus pass, arrived 14.15 and advised waiting time was 10-15 mins, fair enough, an hour later still waiting, staff advised me they had no idea how when I could be seen, maybe another hour? had to leave, couldn't wait another hour, or more, this application can not be done on line as I have to show documentation, plenty of staff on duty but just chatting amongst themselves and not about work! shocking service from city council who treat their citizens with contempt.
Great building, but nothing short of a circus inside.
Thank you for the excellent service given to me today by the gentleman on the door the lady on the phone and the lady from archives births deaths and marriages thank you üòä

While I ultimately went with a flat let out by a different agency, Aberdeen Property Leasing was absolutely fantastic in assisting me. Liam Coull in particular was exceptionally helpful and knowledgeable during our viewing, going above and beyond in answering questions not only about the property, but the surrounding area.

They didn‚Äôt publish my other review despite telling the truth. I suspect APL are taking down any bad reviews and only keeping up the good ones. Terrible letting agency, never took accountability for issues or held landlord accountable. Had to get an apology from a staff member who I won‚Äôt name because they will probably take down the review again.

Constant back and forth between them and then they needed to wait for landlord to respond before proceeding with repairs which often took weeks at a time. Anyway overall the experience was terrible. House was in awful condition when we received it. We called on the day because the carpet in the living room had a massive stain on it which looked like someone had died there. But when we moved out we got charged for this stain and they held onto our deposit for 3 months by purposely leaving there side of things til the last minute to drag it out in the hopes we‚Äôd give up. They also threatened us with ¬£3000 worth of repairs because the landlord was selling the properly but they were just trying to con us because he hadn‚Äôt up kept it during his ownership. We also said we wanted a long term tenancy and less than a year into it they sent us a notice of eviction. We actually spotted it was for sale when we moved in and we were promised the listing would be taken down but it wasn‚Äôt so they knew it was for sale the whole time but assured us it wasn‚Äôt and then when it was convenient they kicked us out as we complained to council about them a few times. Anyway. Terrible letting agency. Avoid.

It has been 2 weeks now since moving into our new home via the Aberdeen property leasing and the experience couldn't be any smoother. From the quick response to questions and concerns by the lead consultant (Liam), to timely flow of information and simplicity of instructions and steps given, we loved the experience every step of the way.
Thank you so much, you are an amazing team, keep doing what you do best.

We have had a fantastic experience letting our house through Aberdeen Property Leasing. Going through the process for the first time was daunting but Stuart ensured it was as easy as possible and supported us throughout, answering our many questions and offering his honest advice. Would highly recommend! Thanks so much APL!

Excellent service, this is my first time renting out a property and they kept me right along the way and explained every question I had. Would definitely recommended for property management. A special mention for Liam who has been my main point of contact , going above his usual duties just to try and keep things simple and streamlined for me, excellent member of the team to have.
if I could give zero stars I would. receptionist was lovely though.
Pathetic
Absolutely awful. Countless emails, MP contacts them, phone calls and they ignore the lot. Solar panels still not connected after two years of decorating the roof. Lawyer time.

Aberdeenshire council are useless.  Bins never emptied around Fyvie, in any weather. Demanding residents to wash everything,  fold everything nicely, carry bins right to the truck to main roads, don't recycle 9 out of 10 usually recycling items, and they still not gonna empty your bins.
Fairly easy to get parked at if you need to go there.
Great, easy to find large car park.
Not open to the public at this office.
Very helpful

Rude and condescending emails, no deposit back, attempted to get hundreds of pounds in 'damage' in addition to the deposit, and after one email they apologised and just took the deposit - would have unnecessarily lost out on a lot of money had we not cleared this up with them. Slight damage from dogs was nowhere near the quote and deposit taken - scammers.

Great company, because they concentrate in the ellon and surrounding area you get the best tenants, rates and most important of all: your property never stays empty for long one a tenant moves on! üòÅüëç
Excellent communication from staff, always happy to help when needed. Quick at getting any repairs sorted when an issue was raised. Always polite and respectful when doing inspections

Angie's exceptional service at Aberdeenshire Leasing made a significant difference during my search for a new home. Her willingness to assist beyond regular working hours, combined with her in-depth knowledge of the local property market and her warm and approachable manner, turned what could have been a complex process into a straightforward and enjoyable one. Angela's commitment to her clients truly shines through. Many thanks again Angie! Lee.T

Too many things to mention about the Terrible service from Angie and the staff at Aberdeenshire Leasing.
Initially all is good and very attentive. The moment an issue in the property arises you are treated like you are a naughty child , all this company is interested in is money and the landlord.. and certainly do not care about the tenants. If I could rate zero stars I would as renting from this letting agent Angie Homes Aberdeenshire leasing has been the most awful experience my family and I have ever experienced in all of our lives. She dismisses issues that she finds challenging and conveniently forgets things she mentioned , and if the truth were told by Angie at the very beginning of our viewing we would have never moved! As based on these lies that was said to us in order for us to rent we would not have moved. Please be aware of this agent as they will never be on the tenant side. None of the work that needed fixing was not completed.
Date of experience: 07 August 2023

Was on the phone this morning with a woman from Aberdeenshire Council. I won‚Äôt name names, although I would love to! I felt judged the whole time and her attitude was extremely rude, disrespectful, aggressive and very unprofessional. I felt like I was there for a verbal confrontation rather then to try get help. Due to recently moving this was the first time in years I‚Äôd had to contact Aberdeenshire Council and to be honest this experience had made me feel I can‚Äôt rely on them or trust them. If this woman‚Äôs attitude is just her then ASC need to really look into things and if they think that it‚Äôs acceptable for there staff to be like this then they all need better training. Just hope the next time I need help/advise I‚Äôm put on to someone much much better and who actually knows how to work with people. Very disappointed. Also when I tried to defend myself the woman was very very rude and put the phone down on me!

(This was a woman from the Inverurie Aberdeenshire Council)

Been chasing the council for months over repairs! I've got about 6 different repairs I've reported, ranging from leaking windows, mouldy flooring (due to a leak under sink) and now a faulty back door. Tried to report it as an emergency (clearly a fire hazard) and was told to climb out the window if a fire breaks out!? With my two young children? Not to mention my youngest has autism! how on earth would I manage that!!! You need to sort out your priorities!!
Very bad service works very slow and when you ask them something she never knows notingh
Waste of time don't go to them
The waiting times for them to answer a call is ridiculous

Absolute jokers. Good luck getting through on the phone or getting a prompt response via e-mail. Sent me an invoice out of thin air 8 months after I had moved out of my property having settled my account with them at the time of moving out. I challenged this as their own terms and conditions even state that all accounts will be run no later than 3 months following the sale of a property, i was ignored to begin with and then sent a debt notice with further charges threatned to which i went back again because I was actively trying to engage regarding the matter but receiving no response so clearly nobody was communicating internally. I was then told my account was on hold and that someone would get back in touch. That was in June. Nobody has ever been back on touch so i assumed that they had realised the error and closed the case. WRONG, i have now received a debt notice adding further charges claiming I have been ignoring prior warnings!!! Unbelievable! Have attempted several times to call them, have emailed several times showing all the proof of what i have just mentioned and still no response. Avoid this company like the plague. They are ridiculously overpriced as it is, i paid by direct debit each month while i resided in my flat and would still be hit at least 3 times a year with extra charges of over ¬£200+. Crooks!!

Despite originally agreeing to pay approximately ¬£18 per month, I seem to regularly have to pay additional fees for the maintenance work that I am meant to be funding through my regular payments.

What‚Äôs going on here?

Whenever I phone the office the staff are nice enough, this does not however dispute the fact that I am overcharged for the service that I am receiving. The car park, bins area and corridors in the property never seem to be any different and don‚Äôt seem as if they‚Äôre kept on top of very well, so what exactly is it I am paying for?

Based on many of the other comments, the company seems to have an act for this.

NOT A GOOD COMPANY TO DEAL WITH.
They have a problem with sending out invoices,then hit you with late payment penalties for invoices that I have not received.
I have been trying to resolve this problem with them for 10 months without success.
Alex Lawson.
The Campus Hilton
Aberdeen.

1 year on.
NO INVOICES.
NO COMMUNICATION.
NO RESOLUTION.

I HAVE NOW RECEIVED NOTICE OF LEGAL PROCEEDINGS FOR NON PAYMENT OF CHARGES FOR LATE PAYMENT THAT I WAS ASSURED HAD BEEN REMOVED FROM MY ACCOUNT.
THIS COMPANY IS AN ABSOLUTE JOKE.

Really bad community. Avoid if you can.

PMC has been my property factor company for 10 years and I have been paying by direct debit all this time. A few weeks before Xmas I was sent notification that I had an outstanding balance of ¬£250,  this is despite my direct debit coming off as normal and they taking above the normal amount twice In the last 8 months. Wrote emails and left voicemail messages to accounts, debt recovery and the assigned property manager....all ignored.  1st week in January, got a reminder where they then added fees onto my account.....again wrote emails and left voicemail messages, ignored by accounts and debt recovery teams again but this time got an email response from property manager apologising for lack of response and telling me that a payment plan would be set up on my account to spread the amount over a period of time....I responded asking for some information on how it occurred...again ignored!  Finally, last week received a final demand with a threat of legal action if not paid within 7 days....yet again, emails and voicemail left to accounts & debt recovery all ignored

As someone willing to pay the amount and understand why the DD is not sufficient to cover payments, I am shocked and disappointed that no-one is willing to speak to me about this.

Edit 20/01 Spoke to property manager who was helpful and explained some things.  If only accounts could have phoned in December, this would have all be resolved at that point

Have been in a rental for 5 years factored by PMC. Lost my carpark fob and it took around 6 months to recieve a replacement. I found them to be pretty dismissive and they refused any sort of discount on the replacement fob, despite the fact I wasn't able to use my designated car parking space for nearly half a year. Eventually a replacement appeared through my letter box with no note, apology, nothing. Also, their working hours of 9.30 to 4pm Mon-Thurs and 9.30 to 1pm Friday (despite what it says on their website) aren't the most convenient.

The most hopeless company ever.
I have just moved in to block 4 Dryburgh gardens.
The house is freezing the the shower is tepid, it‚Äôs like living in an ice box.
When I first moved in there was no tv connection, no buzzer on the door with that company, Abertay housing said was all checked.
No heating in the bathroom, dribble on the water taps , no hot water in which they said had all been checked. Do not get a house with them.
Thomas Ferrie.

Pick up my daughter regularly in Grampian Gardens, the close cleaning leaves much to be desired.

No cleans for months, there is also mice or rat droppings all over the close. Pretty disguising and not helped when the euro bins don't get emptied regularly and rubbish flies about the street. It doesn't help there is a large family living across from her (6/7 adults in a 3 bedroom flat) also not locals. Leaving their rubbish bags in the close as there is no room in the bin, I wonder why?? Because the flats are overflowing with people and the bins are overflowing with rubbish.

They are the first to complain if a child has their toys in their own communal back garden, let's see if they can do their own job??.

They charge weekly for closey cleaning, I think my child's mum deserves a refund!.

Photos will be added tonight.

Their flats should come with a Physical and Mental health warning, my health has really went down since i moved into one, they are freezing cold, damp, no sound proofing, you can hear everything in them, they are well below living standards and well past their shelf life. It's about time they came down and they built semis. Someone even stole flowers curtains and plants from close. Getting worse.

Arguably the most incompetent housing association in Dundee. Having the audacity to still impose rent increases upon those working decent "full rent payers" that continually endure unacceptable conditions caused by your  "anti-social ignorant tenants". Those same issues that all go against your so called tenancy policy! that you've been told about time and time again. It is your responsibility to act on your own tenancy policy over anti social behaviour to ensure safe, healthy, and liveable environments. Your inspection process is an absolute farce, Noted your "housing officer" whilst letting out another property takes notice of the issues right under her nose - clearly observing the problems and choosing to walk away and ignore them!

Guys came up very quickly to sort my gutters.
I wasn't home but that wasn't a problem he phoned and was very nice on the phone.
They even fixed the tiles that was broken even tho I never reported them.
Very pleased with the service. ,üëç

After the other estate agent put me down, one of my friends advised me to put my property on market again by AB property estate agents.
Since beginning I received a professional service. They always respond quickly and have very good communications with both sides, they made my property sale process very smoothly and stress free.
I am very happy with their services and strongly recommend them.
Thanks Alex and Morgan

I can‚Äôt recommend AB Property enough. From my first initial contact with Morgan in the office, to Alex who came out to my property for a valuation, to Lesley in sales. Everyone made me feel so relaxed and at ease at something that can be so stressful! Their level of professionalism and research makes the difference. A great team all throughout. Not to mention I bought my property from them also, and again, they made it so easy and relaxed to deal with.

It's the 2nd time I used AB Property. 2 years ago I bought my first flat and now I sold it with them. I can't thank them enough for the smooth sale and the personalised care from the whole team during the process. Especially Bill was a big help for me in porting my mortgage and even corresponding with other agents to buy my new house. I can't recommend AB Property enough. It was a fantastic experience with them from start to finish.

Had my house sale completed this year and also my mums recently and everything from start to finish went smoothly with them both.
Everyone was very helpful and they kept in touch regularly.
Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend AB Property Consultants to anyone selling their home
Thanks for such a great service.

I'm a Private Landlord with a small letting portfolio. Over the last 16 years I've used various letting agents, most disappointed for various reasons.
I switched to AB Property Consultants 4 Years ago, and what an excellent company,  friendly efficient staff, great Marketing, and best photography I've experienced.
I'm happy to recommend them for buying, selling or for rental services.
Richard Wheeler.
Landlord.
My friend was in for a medical assessment, the staff are great.

At last a company which provides excellent factoring services!
Good communication, modern online reporting and monitoring, responsive to issues and has reduced most of the regular costs which were being charged by previous factor. As a company they have been very proactive in making recommendations such as replacing lighting with energy saving units and are responsibly planning and budgeting for upgrading works such as communal stair refurbishment and painting.
Don‚Äôt be put off moving factors just because the process seems too much effort, Sarah and her team make this hassle free and handled all the handover from existing factors.
We are so glad we made the change to AboveBoard Homes!

Our block of flats switched factors a year ago after several years of substandard service from Charles White. Sarah at AboveBoard has over that time been an excellent factor. AboveBoard have proven to be less costly for our regular factoring fees, saved us money on communal electricity bills, overseen repairs to the roofworks (which Charles White never even identified needing repair), and the accounting/invoices have been clear and transparent.

Sarah has been friendly and responsive, chasing up suppliers and taking on board suggestions of flat owners. She took the time to visit the block for walkarounds to identify any issues and kept on top of the roofworks as they happened.

I have since moved out of the block she was managing, but will keep AboveBoard Homes in mind if we ever need to replace the factor in my new block of flats.

I highly recommend Sarah Morrison and her team at Above Board homes. Sarah was instrumental in supporting me in the undertaking of switching factor companies. Our development was in such a bad way with our old factor company who were completely inefficient, unhelpful and expensive. Above Board is the complete opposite and everything you want in a factor company; they are responsive, clear, fair, work effectively, great management of projects and communication. They‚Äôve saved us a ton of money while actually getting the work done around the development. If you‚Äôre looking at switching factor companies it‚Äôs totally worth the effort to be in the capable and attentive hands of Above Board. Thanks Sarah and team!

Our development moves to this company a few years ago after deep frustration with our previous factor.
While the vote to move to Aboveboard was split, the vote to get rid of them was unanimous and now they are disputing the owners votes.
Avoid this mob like the plague. Many promises, but no ability to deliver.

Our block decided to move to AboveBoard Homes after some truly terrible service received elsewhere.

We're now three months into service with Sarah and her team and the experience has been of such a different level that it's making us regret how long it took us to move Factors!

The AboveBoard team are diligent, attentive and look at each aspect of property management as an opportunity to improve rather than just a box ticking exercise of "that's been inspected" and nothing more.

The online portal and invoicing system makes everything crystal clear and we're getting regular updates and information sharing on all aspects of the block.

True attention to detail and fantastic service all round.

Recommended.

Best Letting Agency.
5 years with them and i found support fast for any problem small or big. Top üëçüëç

I only had a very basic idea of what I would like but they suggested how best to do everything & I‚Äôm very pleased with the results. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to use again üòä

The AGM team are my construction team of choice. They are working with me to renovate and insulate an old cottage. They completed the construction of a bathroom utility extension  and  full bedroom remodel in ‚Äò24 and have begun work to renovate my living room now in ‚Äò25. They are an excellent company - very experienced working on old buildings/ cover all trades  / good at problem solving and provide guidance to help you make design choices .

Converted our single unused garage into a beautiful kitchen as well as converting the utility room into a walk in wardrobe.
Managed to more or less complete the job in 2 weeks but had delay with window which was outwith AGM‚Äôs control but promptly fitted the following week and all the wee snagging issues.
House and driveway left cleaned and tidied every day with a thorough clean at the end.
Professional job and finish and I would definitely recommend AGM to my friends and family
Building of retaining wall and laying of driveway. Very professional job completed in the expected time frame. Great communication and went over and beyond expectations.

AGM Construction recently managed the renovation of our large, old manse. All the way through the process they were professional, helpful, full of suggestions, good humoured, considerate and friendly. Alistair, Graeme, Michael, Owen, Daniel, Lewis and Nicola provided a great service and we enjoyed having them around as we settled in to our new home. We are really happy with the work carried out and will be using AGM again in the future. I highly recommend them.

What can I say about Haxton‚Äôs and in particular Sharon that is nothing but positive praise. We recently sold our flat with Sharon after my step daughter recommended her following a house purchase of her and her partners experience. From start to finish the process ran super smooth and even though we don‚Äôt actually live in Scotland , nothing was too much trouble and Sharon went out of her way on out of hours viewings and advice to us on potential offers etc . I had full confidence in Sharon experience and knowledge to trust her to do the best for us and after a couple of months, the sale went through without a hitch at a price I didn‚Äôt think we would achieve. We now class Sharon as a family friend and would have no delay in recommending Sharon and Haxton‚Äôs to any potential house / flat sale or purchase. Super super service and a great result for us from a lovely lovely lady .
Thanks Haxton‚Äôs

Sharon Preston of Haxton property should be your first stop if you are buying or selling a property. When Sharon came to our home to give a valuation for sale of our home it was easy to see straight away that we had chosen the correct agent to deal with our sale.
Sharon has a great knowledge of the estate agency business and straight away put us at ease. She worked tirelessly throughout the process and kept us up to date at all times. If you are looking for an estate agent then look no further than Haxton Property.
We not
We not only found Sharon and Haxton Property we also found a friend.. Davie &Anne

We had an excellent experience using Haxton Property for selling our flat. Sharon was extremely accommodating, going above and beyond to make sure the process was both seamless and easy on our end. She was amazing to deal with, with an extremely reputable and professional business. For anyone selling their property, I cannot recommend Sharon and Haxton Property enough!

Sharon at Haxton Property has been fantastic. We last moved house 38 years ago, and just about everything has changed!!

Sharon from haxton property has just sold my house. From start to finish she has been amazing. I had never sold a house before and Sharon guided me through the process with ease. If I could give 0 stars I would.
Extremely unprofessional and greedy. All of the worst types of landlords rolled into one. They do not respect students especially and if you show her a slightest hint that you don't understand something related to the renting process they will exploit it. Constantly lying about intentions to fix things and never actually acting on it. An agent asked me why i was "giving her attitude" like she was my primary school teacher when i didn't want to tell her why me and my roomate were leaving. Some of the shadiest behaviour from any person I've ever seen. Most landlords are just incompetent, this one is malicious. Also impossible to contact when you actually need something.

Refused to deal with anti-social behaviour from two of their tenants. Shameful. Caused both trauma and the need for therapy. Avoid like the plague.

It was by far the worst letting agency. We rented a flat through this agency. They were unprofessional, amateurs, and they did not do anything to assist us during our stay in Dundee.

We faced many issues living in this flat.For instance, a constant noise was coming from the pipes throughout the day. It was really annoying as it did affect our daily routine. They responded that it is common for new flats to make these types of noises. That's a joke.

I would not recommend renting any flat through this agency. Ideally, try to avoid letting houses via letting agencies.

I have read the previous reviews of this company and can confidently say that this was not my experience of AB. We had great support from the agent throughout the tenancy and could contact the office any time and they could not be more helpful. I obviously don't know what happened in any of the other scenarios but I certainly did not get the impression that I could be bullied or intimidated by anyone from AB. We dealt with the lady that runs the company throughout our tenancy and this was a pleasant experience for the whole time we were in the property, there was certainly not any time where i thought otherwise. Please note Im sharing my experience not discrediting others.

I am getting ready to vacate a property I have spent a year in under the management of Alison and her team. I can say that I have had nothing short of her full support and attention throughout the entire process. Everything was quick and easy to get set up. All issues we presented to Alison were logged and dealt with in a timely manner. We didn't have to argue or compromise, we were just given what was required when we needed it. I would happily rent through the company again based on the last years service.

Amazing response time.

My experiences with Almond are all positive.  They are there when you need them the staff are all friendly.   Any jobs I've had done on my home have been done efficiently and professional.  If you have any issues talk to your housing officer as I have found out they can help in many ways.  Future Almond tenants  you will be very happy with your property and service.  I give 9.5 score from 10

worst housing association i have ever experienced when you try to get a home i applied out with the area as i didn't stay in west lothian they come into your current home and make you feel small they say it has tired decor they tell to open the windows there is a smell even when there are 3 different plug in fresheners on they say your home wont pass to get another one they say these hurtful things even when they know my father is a pensioner carer looking after some who has been ill for 30 years the house was not as bad as they made out i had just wallpapered the year before i have laminate flooring they tell you that you should have carpets i cant have carpets because my mother is incontinent and if you have more than on pet then forget it they tell you that your only allowed one there staff have no manners or feelings for others.

Take months to do repairs which leads to more damage from the original repair. This leads to waiting on other repairs being needed. Left a leak that was coming through a light fitting for nearly 4 weeks which caused the electricity to keep tripping and damaged flooring from continues leaking. Took over 6 months to replace a shower screen. Took over a 2 years to fix a drawer in the kitchen that was supposed to be replaced when we first moved into the property. Some of the repair workers don't show up to appointments that are pre arranged with no notice or explination so made arrangements for someone to be home for no reason atall. When complaints are put in they don't get back to you and ilyou need to constantly phone up to get a response. The reception staff say they will call you back and do not (this has been on several occasions).  Terrible experience with every repair we've needed
Been an almond housing tenant for 17 years always had a great service wouldent want a house with anyone else  quick at doing repairs and staff are always great.

I've had a fantastic experience as a tenant with Lynn and Euan at AGP over the past five years. Now that I've moved out, I can strongly recommend renting a property with them. They were very reliable at keeping in touch, prompt with repairs, transparent about costs, and have consistently been warm and understanding as people. It's quite clear from my experience that they prioritise making and keeping good relationships with their tenants. This is an absolute rarity in the UK rental market, and I wish other agencies could be this good.

I've rented from Angus Glen for two years and during that time they have been nothing short of outstanding in every single aspect of our tenancy. The lease signing was an entirely painless, fully transparent process. When we moved in the flat was in a fantastic condition, spotless and recently refreshed, with all documentation and gas/electricity certificates kept up to date. Angus Glen have meticulously documented the state of the flat with numerous pictures and videos and made sure that we had access to them at all times. During the rare times where something in the flat needed repair, we could quickly report the incident on an easy to navigate online portal. Maintenance staff was assigned at the speed of light, there have been times where we raised a concern well past 10PM and yet still received a response within a matter of minutes. This is also true for other communications, Lynn and Euan are very easy to reach and reply to emails at a speed that I both admire and fear. 99% of maintenance issues raised in the flat have been resolved in 24h or less. Upon moving out we received very helpful and clear guidance about the expected state of the flat and also contact information to their recommended cleaner if we wanted to work with one. We decided to clean the flat on our own and have still received our full deposit back very shortly after our tenancy has ended.

I truly appreciate Angus Glen's continued committent to transparency, at no point in the entire process of renting with them did we feel cheated, mislead, or taken advantage of as we have with previous letting agencies. They have shown themselves to be a golden standard of letting agents and I wholeheartedly wish they expanded their services to other parts of Scotland just so that I could stay with them. Lynn and Euan are absolute superstars who are simply fantastic at their jobs and their wealth of experience and incredible customer service made us feel taken care of. They always been nothing short of professional, respectful, and extremely kind. I would highly recommend Angus Glen to anyone looking for a place to call their home in Dundee, they have never let us down and raised our standards for any future lets sky-high ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Absolutely brilliant experience renting through Angus Glen Properties. Lynn and Euan was always on hand to help or give advice. Repairs was always done on time and polite tradesman's used aswell. Definitely recommend Angus Glen Properties.

This was my first time renting and I am so glad it was with Angus Glen Properties! They have really set the bar for other rental agencies and I‚Äôll have to remind myself not to get my hopes up too high for my next rental. I had no problem reaching out to Lynn for any questions or assistance during my tenancy. Communication with Lynn and Euan was always swift with kind and professional responses. Their online tenancy services were very easy to navigate and I was never left long with any worries. I would highly recommend to anyone considering renting with them!

We had such a great experience renting our flat through Angus Glen Properties! The flat was perfect. Lynn and Euan were great, they answered every query promptly and were just lovely people. Issues were fixed quickly and to high standards. I highly recommend them to everyone!
Tried contacting the Energy advice lady, went into the office, then called. Over the space of a month. I've yet to hear from her?

Annan Solicitors and Selling Agents have been absolutely incredible from start to finish - and even now, they continue to be supportive, professional, and genuinely brilliant at what they do. Within just a couple of weeks, we had both purchased and sold our property, all thanks to their hard work and expertise.

Their communication is AMAZING, not only with us but also with interested buyers. They are super responsive, friendly, and consistently go above and beyond. Throughout the whole process we truly felt that they cared about our future and were invested in helping us make the right move.

A huge thank you to Michael and the rest of the team ‚Äî we couldn‚Äôt recommend you highly enough!

Annan was the agent for the seller when we bought our house. We dealt with Michael himself and he was a pleasure to deal with - accommodating, polite, friendly and helpful. When we needed to sell a flat a few years later, I asked Michael to assist and was even more impressed with the service provided as a seller. Michael is running a really efficient set up and everyone we dealt with throughout the whole process offered an excellent and friendly service - not a single criticism of anything along the way, and believe me, I have had plenty cause to criticise other estate agents I have dealt with in the past! Moving is always a stressful business and sadly it seems everyone has bad stories about estate agents and conveyancing solicitors who add to the stress, but whether buying or selling, I would not hesitate to recommend Annans to anyone. They are most definitely a stand out example of someone getting it right and providing excellent service.

I would highly recommend¬†Annan if you're looking to sell or rent out your¬†property. They were supportive from start to¬†finish, with very competitive¬†rates and quick to respond to any of my queries. I had some problems¬†with my neighbour which was very stressful and they handled it brilliantly¬†which made such a huge difference. Michael and Gill especially¬†were really helpful and made my time as a landlord and subsequent seller stress-free.

They sold our parents home in Craigentinny for my sister and I after my parents passed, and they were very affordable, efficient and tactful. They were very complimentary of it, confident in its sale and prepared fantastic schedules with very well taken images and an amazing 3D video walkthrough.

They made it so easy, the sale was no hassle at all. We would definitely use them again.

Well done Annan.

I had a fantastic experience with Annan during both the sale of my old home and the purchase of my new one. They sold my house in just two weeks,the entire process was smooth, efficient, and stress free. The team was professional, responsive, and kept me well informed every step of the way.
I highly recommend them to anyone looking for reliable and knowledgeable solicitors for buying or selling property.

I had an excellent experience with Aquila Management Services while selling my home. From start to finish, every member of the team was incredibly kind and helpful, making the whole process smooth and stress-free. A special shoutout to Paul ‚Äì his knowledge and experience in this sector are immediately clear. He made me feel at ease right away, and every question I had was answered promptly and in great detail. I really appreciated how approachable and professional he was throughout. If you're looking for reliable support when selling your home, I highly recommend this team! Thanks again Paul :)

Returned keys for a woman I met outside after they told her to return keys by 12:00 on a Saturday. They were closed so I offered to return the keys as she lived an hour's drive away.

I feel compelled to share the full extent of their unprofessionalism and disregard for tenants. Not only did they make baseless claims to charge me for redecoration expenses related to an upstair neighbor's water leak stain on the ceiling, but they also attempted to charge me for overall repainting and cleaning. When confronted with evidence proving that the stain was caused by the neighbor's property and not my responsibility, they changed their narrative, accusing me of unauthorized painting using non-neutral colors.

To further illustrate their incompetence, they even used a walk-in inventory report from a completely different property with a different address, wrongly claiming it as evidence against me. Fortunately, I had the original walk-in report of the correct property, complete with pictures taken by Rentahome themselves, showing no changes whatsoever. It's astonishing that Rentahome would go to such lengths to fabricate claims, hoping that a favor adjustment would work in their favor through My Deposit Scotland. My Deposit Scotland ruled in my favor, recognizing the agency's unjust attempts to withhold my deposit. It was a relief to have an impartial third party acknowledge Rentahome's wrongdoing and validate my claims.

What makes this situation even more infuriating is the fact that I had gone above and beyond as a tenant by finding a new tenant to take over the apartment, without charging any fees to Rentahome. Instead of appreciating my efforts and ensuring a fair return of my deposit, they attempted to exploit the situation and make unwarranted deductions.

My experience with Rentahome has been nothing short of a nightmare. Their dishonesty, lack of integrity, and disregard for tenants' rights is absolutely appalling. I strongly caution anyone considering renting from Rentahome to think twice and look elsewhere for a reputable property management company that values their tenants and conducts business ethically.

grossly unprofessional and incompetent agent.

after being promised a professionally cleaned flat on our move in date, we arrived to an absolutely disgusting flat. previous tenants soap in the shower and hair in the drain, brown drips down the back of the fridge, filthy cupboards and so on. the agent (Grant Stewart) reluctantly arranged a sub par clean that was a wipe of the cupboards and fridge, and a sweep of the floor the next day, the rest we did ourselves. on top of that, we spent the first month missing days of work and university to have repaired the multiple maintenance issues that included, peeling door handles, a faulty dish washer, vents falling out of the ceiling in the bedroom and an extractor fan that didn't work and was filthy. grant (sole agent at this company) was almost entirely void of any accountability and repeatedly told us our concerns were "not at the top of the priority list" and that "some people wouldn't mind cooking without an extractor fan". Bare in mind taking out first months rent and full deposit, totalling at ¬£2,500 was dealt with promptly by him. although he did offer us a measly ¬£50 for our inconvenience, it was only after being asked. he did increase this amount after i pointed out it was disrespectful after all the inconvenience he had caused us. I sent emails pointing out all of the legal documentation he had provided, and violated through his unprofessional conduct, to which I received almost no acknowledgement.

upon moving out, we left the flat in considerably better condition to which we found it. however he was not happy, he called us and using a sarcastic and confrontational tone, swore at us down the phone over a freezer drawer and a plant we had forgotten to take with us. absolutely abysmal conduct and grossly unprofessional. as the sole agent, grant blatantly takes on more that he can handle in an effort to retain profit and disregard tenant experience.

I can back up every single claim with email chains and recorded phone calls of him swearing at us. yes, it got to the point i recorded phone calls as i lost all faith he would conduct himself professionally and in the best interests of us, himself and the landlord (to which i attributed no blame, other than ignorance to grants behaviour)

my only blessing was that he did not conduct an inventory via a third party dated prior to our move in date, so he had zero grounds to retain any of our deposit. Not to mention the advert for the flat stated the wrong floor and council tax band, should have seen the red flags.

if you can help it, avoid this agency at all costs. worst experience i have ever had as an experienced tenant with outstanding references. I wish it hadn't come to this as i'm not usually not one to complain but i feel obliged to warn others so they don't get trapped in a tenancy experience like ours.

I've been letting out an Edinburgh flat for 1 year with Stewart Property Letting now and I have had nothing but excellent service. Grant gave me his mobile number from the beginning to answer any questions and keep me updated. I've recommended them in the past and will continue to do so.

Dylan & Avril sold our family home last year. They did way more than just sell the house. They understood the circumstances, offered advice, support, reassurance as well as getting a far higher price than we'd hoped for. Highly recommended.
Very professional, reliable company. I highly recommend if looking to sell your house quickly.
Highly recommended, very professional and effective

Since changes have been made.They dont actually care as long as they collect their rent
Rather than get to the rote cause under the previous clerk of works.this house is only deteriorating..im now going legal as ive had and injury also out side the building.
I. Leaving bridgewater should have took the council offer 5 years ago

Avoid at all costs. Cannot do anything right. Such a disgrace. Would not recommend Bridgewater Housing Association to anyone. If I could rate less stars I would. Not worth any stars. Too good at wanting their money but not good at dealing with repairs. üò° blaming covid for all this I bet when others can do stuff.

If I could rate them lower I would, ridiculous landscaping charges, they even charge you for sending you the letters with their bill.... Some staff are really good others are pretty poor and unhelpful.

Owns the building I rent my flat out of, water pumps have been broken for 4 days. Not made any effort to fix nor supplied clean bottled water! During the covid 19 health crisis we can't even wash our hands, food or flush the toilet! Don't even answer the phones to discuss issues with them! Avoid at all cost
1 star is to high .staff so rude would not let us explain problem kept talking over us .then when we were trying to get point across she hung up.

Always closed to the public rather than the 10 residents on different days, cant really make up their mind either a Monday or Tuesday. Much better place down the road. Cant see the sense in there business model. Wont be back!

If you are a landlord please do not give your properties to Curb.

They do not honour their own policies and you will be lucky to get the keys to your property back within the agreed timeframe even after they sign off on it and you get solicitors and lawyers involved.

They use the premise of guaranteed rent but pay you less than market rate, on top of this they pay you late!

They also have the audacity to try to overcharge you on extortionate repairs which are above the market rate. So you lose on income and on maintenance cost.

They place disruptive and anti social tenants into your property - who then cause irreparable damages and disrupt the whole street with anti social behaviour and noise.

After having a fire in my temp property with C-urb PSL, they helped me and my family quickly move into a new temp property, still within C-urb. Everyone I have dealt with since the incident has been amazing. From the girls in the office to maintenance and repairs team. Special thanks to Stuart for everything.

I recently let my flat using C-urb PLS.

Initially I phoned the office to enquire about the Service they offered. I was given the overall information I needed at that point and I was emailed draft documents to read. I was told the Housing Manager, Nadia, would phone the next day when she was back in the office.

Nadia phoned promptly the next day, now giving me detailed information and the opportunity to ask all my questions. She explained my responsibilities and the timescales fully, in an easy to understand and professional manner. She was then fully supportive throughout the whole process, helping me at every stage. If I emailed her she replied straightaway and was easily contactable by phone if I needed advice and guidance. I met her at the office at one point to hand over documents and keys and also at the flat to assess the progress. The meetings were focused, professional and friendly. Throughout the short timescale it has taken to let the flat everything has been dealt with in an easily understandable and very efficient manner.

The service I have received from C-urb PLS and especially Nadia, has been exceptional. Thank you.

I've been a resident at Merlin Crescent since 2021, and my experience with C~urb has been consistently positive. I've been fortunate not to have any major maintenance issues, and the few small ones that have arisen were always fixed within a very reasonable timeframe. A special mention to Nikki, who looks after the block ‚Äì she is truly great and always incredibly helpful. Her attentiveness makes a real difference. Overall, I'm very happy with my living situation here.

A friend of mine is living through a nightmare due to C-urb's neglectful incompetence. They are a wheelchair user who has been unable to leave their flat since last year due to a door not being widened. This is entirely due to C-urb's discriminatory decisions as the issue was first raised 4 years ago.

Despite an increase in needs and plenty of notice, C-urb refuses to fulfil their legal duties until an occupational therapist assesses the communal doorway changes as necessary.

It's a shame and disgrace that c-urb wants to waste NHS time to prove an issue that has been proven time and time again. I suppose until then it's fine that at least one tenant is imprisoned (and paying for it!) in case the company might save a tiny bit of money?

Never consider renting from the heartless individuals that make up this company.
Came out to fix my window frame instead they plastered white stuff all over it looks an absolutely mess. Definitely wouldn‚Äôt call that a repair could have done a better job my self

They should offer people on benefits free if its the gym they want to use. And free fitness no matter what it is. They should offer lower rates when it comes to hiring rooms for the ones that have been here more than ten years

Took a day off work as was told they would be out in the morning. By 15.30 I'd called 5 times. No one answered so I went down to see them. They then promised 4 pm. Still no one. They finally called at 16.45 to say they'd be out tomorrow!  To think I'm over ¬£1000 a year on factor bills for cadder housing.  It's a bloody joke.

Been a tennant in this housing area for over 23+ years wouldnt recommend moving here.
Staff friendly and nice but waiting lists are a joke, housing stocks are a disgrace.
We moved in to larger apartment due to last home being damp ridden and too small only to be offered a disgrace of an appartment which we reluctantly accepted.
After many botched repairs and more dampness we had almost given up staying in the cadder area.
A new build was planned in the tresta road part of cadder and we were notified we were second of 2 places for a housing transfer which we have now been told we have been unsuccessful. Its a joke.
Strongly advise to avoid cadder housing.

Just want to say That the new receptionest is is one in a million.. very friendly and approachable she goes out her way to help you no matter what.. Just hope she sticks around.. Don't usually get Receptionest in a bubbley mood üòÅ Thanks for all your help...
Fantastic organisation with a real focus on supporting tenants and staff.

Compared to council and housing assosiations in the area you're paying much more for them to invade your privacy on a monthly basis, inspection after inspection and now they want to take photos, you get harrassed by neighbours and its apparently your fault when when you send them video proof of whats happening, nobody responds to emails. I feel constantly anxious and taken advantage of

They recently took over ANCHO in Irvine. Now ANCHO were always poor, however now the delays in getting anything addressed is beyond a joke.

Been left with contaminated drinking water for over a week now after their contractors carried out a sewage repair.

The Asset Management office is staffed by individuals who don't even understand their own roles, they cannot organise, project manage, see works through, they aren‚Äôt even conversant with current legislation and yet will attempt to claim you have no recourse for this or that ‚Äì it‚Äôs frightening they even have a job.

They discriminate against disabled tenants and will attempt to cast you as part of the problem should you complain, the management will talk down to you and sneer at your disabilities.

And their complaints system actually allows the individual who has been complained about - to investigate their own complaint, what organisation allows employees to investigate themselves? I mean seriously?

In the end it doesn‚Äôt matter if complaints are upheld ‚Äì because they carry on making the same errors,

I assumed that when they took over ANCHO they would keep the staff below the management ‚Äì and run a brush through the actual management team, because most of them have been there for decades and what‚Äôs happening now is, new blood is not bringing in new ideas, but repeating the same mistakes because that‚Äôs what management are teaching them to do ‚Äì and now with the delays to get repairs done now it all goes through a call centre, I don‚Äôt see the point in keeping that office open at all ‚Äì but then maybe that‚Äôs the idea.

Poor, poor organisation; we have been in our new build accommodation since October 2022 and been plagued by faults and severe lack of responses from Cairn and their nominated sub-contractors. We have promised the earth to resolve some serious issues concerning our heating controls systems and now 19/01/2024, these repetative issues have not been resolved.
The level of incompetence demonstrated in their vain attempts to resolve numerous faults between them and the sub-contractors beggared belief.
Faulty extract fans, Gas/Electricity meters installed and then allocated wrong street addresses (still on-going with some tennents) fitting of non-standard toilets (yet to be replaced), property inspections after 6 months failed to materialise, shower rail curtain support missing (after two attempts, failed to provide the correct support) which we purchased and replaced ourselves.
Hours spent on the phone, using their Portal to raise/report/chase up inaction to resolve issues which just never seemed to get fixed ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Would we recommend Cairnha? NO, definately not.

Yet another month has gone by and still an issue (on-going for well over a year) remains unresolved, despite promises and commitments from Cairn Staff. Latest ‚Äúassurances/promises‚Äù including:
‚ÄúWe are working hard to resolve the issue ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. ‚Äú
‚ÄúThe issue has been forwarded to the ************** department‚Äù
‚ÄúOur contractor has been scheduled for next week (w/c 07/10/2025)‚Äù

And you‚Äôve guessed it, NOTHING yes NOTHING has materialised. No improvement from a terrible organisation.
Helpful until you get in the door and then it‚Äôs impossible to get ahold of anyone in the office. Unprofessional. They just ignore emails and phone calls once they take your money
Terrible organisation don‚Äôt care about their tenants even when you‚Äôre disabled

Issues affecting responsible tenants continue, despite the glossy spin publicised by Cairn.
Simple issues like maintaining the property and gardens take forever to be addressed (even after TWO YEARS) despite stipulations in the Tenancy Agreement.
No enforcement, no consequences for failure to comply, only results in a ‚Äònew build‚Äô area descending into a ghetto in a very short space of time. Not a basic standard expected by a ‚Äúresponsible‚Äù landlord.

Having had experience of bullying directly by a staff member of this company, I would not recommend them. This makes me feel very uneasy leaving home, I live very close to this aggressive individual. I complained to them, but I was laughed at by one of their managers. My experience with Caledonia Housing Association has been extremaly disappointing.
Neither the housing officer nor the management team have been helpful in important matters.
There were multiple situations where I needed support, yet my messages remained unanswered and the issues unresolved.
From my perspective, it often feels as if their main focus is simply ensuring that rent payments are made on time, while real tenant needs receive little to no attention.
Based on my experience, I felt unsupported and left with the impression that the service provided offered very little value.

I spoke to Gaynor and this was the 2nd time dealing with this lady, she is an absolute superstar and if you look up customer service her name should be beside it , she totally gets it , can put herself in your shoes and does her utmost to help you. I absolutely love speaking to her and as a manager of 13 people I wish all of mine showed the same display of professionalism and kindness, she should be so proud of herself and Caledonian Housing should be ensuring they keep her otherwise I will steal her lol.
