A very frustrating orginisation to deal with. Our monthly fees have increased by 146% in the last two years, and the quality of service provided is really poor. There are multiple of areas of disrepair that have been complained about, with the complaints being upheld, and yet no work has been done to repair them. In my experience, I've gone months without a reply from them.

The only time you hear from them is when they are increasing the monthly fee.

As a tenant, I have absolutely hated being with them, especially in recent months. Nightmare upstairs neighbours who constantly stomp about and blare loud bass which has caused sensory overload, breakdowns, and relapse from self harm, and Caledonia Housings solution is "to get a social worker in to help keep the flat I am in completely spotless", ignoring the actual issue and refusing to acknowledge recordings of their noise and everyone else who has actually heard how loud they are. On top of that, constantly ignoring complaints and emails and wilfully letting this go on with someone who is mentally ill and suffers with severe depression and suicidal tendencies. Since constantly trying to get in touch things have only gotten worse, and have since been turned into victim blaming and have been put in legal trouble for literally having to put letters to the flat making the noise telling them to stop and the damage that has been done to health. If anyone ever thinks of getting a flat with Caledonia Housing, genuinely look elsewhere, because they are actually disgusting with how little they care about the tenants suffering and play ignorant to everything.

Don't bother letting tenants know they're moving offices. You ask them for permission for something and they don't check the mail box for over a week and then drag out approving permission asked for (having a 2nd dog in the house) staff are unhelpful and an all round joke. Quick to pester you if they want something from you but the second you ask for a simple permission letter it takes them weeks to even acknowledge you. If you need repairs doing you can guarantee you'll be waiting a minimum of 2 months for someone to bother getting back to you about it too.

Appears to be an organisation that you can't ever get in touch with. Have tried calling many times, waiting over 20 minutes a time before hanging up. Have used their contact form and sent emails, all with zero response. Am raising a complaint to the Ombudsman as completely unable to contact them.

Terrible orginisation for communication purposes.Sometimes you get a reply and on other iccassions they ignore you. I have an ongoing complaint and have finally complained to the ombudsman after months of frustration.

Absolute joke rent increase of ¬£26.04per month outrageous.Maybe the association staff wages have increased by that amount mine and plenty others have not!!!Too busy wasting money on fancy magazines and the most expensive printing paper. This association has long stepped away from its core values. You can be seen to do all the reviews and consultations all you want you will put in place whatever suits you as I‚Äôve said before it‚Äôs now money money money that is now your core value certainly not affordable housing. Staff are brilliant,have helped me so much over the last 20 years.Thanks‚ù§Ô∏è
I volunteer here and the staff are very friendly and the venue is spotless! Very community focused and is a great place to come along for Thursdays free lunch as well

We have been here 7 years and the HA has gone down hill big time, don't reply to messages left for them to ring.
We have been flooded twice but, they won't maintain the drains etc. Neighbours can harass you and get away with it. Bathroom sink needed replaced it leaked with 48 hrs, Plummer came out and condemned the sink in the bathroom, now we have no sink for 4 days and no word on what's happening, everyone needs a bathroom sink, don't care even if your disabled. Too many at CHHA think they know best, Wrong!

Castle houses are nice.well built, but.avoid communal areas as your.looking to pay ¬£159 gas a month and the h9uses are cooking without heating, I use no gas most of.the year the houses 8n aquorthies Circle are very hot.even in winter, don't move 8nto a communally heated house, you'll never get back out!

i have been in my property for over 5 yrs now , get verbal abuse constantly everyday from 2 neighbours castlehill have done nothing , i got assaulted by a neighbour who got charged with serious assault and a restraining order and they still wont do anything , ive seen a better organised circus they are just disgusting awlful housing association
Have just been housed by Castlehill Housing, an amenity flat with lift and laundry room. Staff are very friendly. Used These Homes online bidding for the property

The best landlord I can recommend. The building I live in is kept and maintained to excellent standard as promised in the agreement.

Supper chuffed and blessed to be living in their building.

Interactions with varies staff also departments always have positive outcomes
Staff are excellent

factor_name: Cathcart and District Housing Association Limited
review_text: Great team! Specially Grant who made our application process so easy while showing such professionalism. Very happy with the service

factor_name: Cathcart and District Housing Association Limited
review_text:
High factoring fees with nothing to show for it. I.e paying for garden maintenance in which the grass gets cut once a year (& that‚Äôs if I email to chase it).

Payments authorised for large work without any notice to residents, slammed with an extra ¬£100 on the invoice with no warning.

Poor communication, different answers from different members of staff, no consistency - doesn‚Äôt exactly feel trustworthy.

Emailed to ask if I‚Äôll sell my flat to them, obviously never will.

factor_name: Cathcart and District Housing Association Limited
review_text:
I don't like leaving one star reviews however, this one is absolutely warranted things have become unmanageable and the proverbial has been taken.

This housing association started off being great with me (Disabled adult)
HOWEVER, many things have changed, and that's no longer true.

When a disabled person is temporarily moved from her place of residence in a situation where she has put faith in others she expects that faith to be justified.

She also expects that when her caregivers (either paid or family) ask questions by email or by phone, she expects that those questions will be answered in a timely manner, even if the answer is "Sorry I don't know but I can try to find out"

She does NOT expect to be treated like a subhuman non-entity because she cannot speak up for herself. Nor does she expect to be spoken at by a condescending arrogant old man who has no respect for anyone, that is why she cut off all contact with her bio father - she does not need a reminder of it.

She expects phone calls to be at the very least, returned out of basic common courtesy. She absolutely doesn't expect to be left in the dark about a situation where she should be something of a priority.

Communication skills are abysmal at best.
Management skills are...  a joke.

While staff have generally been polite, their lack of ability to WISE UP and use their GUMPTION to get things done is ridiculous.

Passing the buck on such issues as replacing a person‚Äòs meter because the old fashioned signal is getting switched off is not appropriate either.

factor_name: Cathcart and District Housing Association Limited
review_text: Beyond words... Not sorting a leak for a month, not just any leak but one which keeps flooding the neighbours and means they can't use the lights in their bathroom! Sending someone for the forth time to assess rather than fix, sending a joiner rather than a plumber!! This is happening to someone I know and it's unbelievable...

factor_name: Cathcart and District Housing Association Limited
review_text: I am currently still having to deal with the fall out of their service. I've been left with thousands of pounds of damage as a result of their ineptitude. You'd be much better off letting your dog be your factor than CDHA.

I feel I need to share that I‚Äôm currently being harassed by Rentahome. I was 1 month behind on rent due to dealing with bereavement, when I got back I communicated the date when the 1-month rent arrears would be cleared and that I would continue to pay as normal to bring everything up to date. First, they started with the constant emails asking me to phone in the office. I have told them my mental health has been affected but they do not care. After many emails asking to phone the office, they decided to try to ask to inspect the property after their scare tactics did not work. It's like talking to a wall!  I hope the landlords who are trusting this agency to manage their tenants are aware of how they are treating people. Disgusting. Keep in mind only 1 month behind rent! I have offered to clear the arrears and pay the current month‚Äôs rent. This agency does NOT follow the law of allowing tenants to have quiet enjoyment. Any inspections must be agreed upon by both parties but they think their scare tactics will get you to agree to being harrassed and unreasonable inspection requests after I just told them I am struggling with mental health after bereavement. They do not care!
Quick and efficient the only draw back I will say is u need to check your flat when u rent cause there might be discrepancies with the cleanliness issues.

Helped me move through lockdown into one of the nicest flats I could have wished for! Fantastic quality home, amazing customer service and support! Any issues they get back straight away and they have a list of helpful numbers for out of hours work! Would recommend as the best agency in Paisley I've experience so far! Thank you Rentahome!

Returned keys for a woman I met outside after they told her to return keys by 12:00 on a Saturday. They were closed so I offered to return the keys as she lived an hour's drive away.
When I returned the key on Monday morning they refused to give me a receipt for receiving the keys. Unprofessional, both for not being open when they told the woman they would be open and unprofessional for not just scribbling a receipt.

I feel compelled to share the full extent of their unprofessionalism and disregard for tenants. Not only did they make baseless claims to charge me for redecoration expenses related to an upstair neighbor's water leak stain on the ceiling, but they also attempted to charge me for overall repainting and cleaning. When confronted with evidence proving that the stain was caused by the neighbor's property and not my responsibility, they changed their narrative, accusing me of unauthorized painting using non-neutral colors.

To further illustrate their incompetence, they even used a walk-in inventory report from a completely different property with a different address, wrongly claiming it as evidence against me. Fortunately, I had the original walk-in report of the correct property, complete with pictures taken by Rentahome themselves, showing no changes whatsoever. It's astonishing that Rentahome would go to such lengths to fabricate claims, hoping that a favor adjustment would work in their favor through My Deposit Scotland. My Deposit Scotland ruled in my favor, recognizing the agency's unjust attempts to withhold my deposit. It was a relief to have an impartial third party acknowledge Rentahome's wrongdoing and validate my claims.

What makes this situation even more infuriating is the fact that I had gone above and beyond as a tenant by finding a new tenant to take over the apartment, without charging any fees to Rentahome. Instead of appreciating my efforts and ensuring a fair return of my deposit, they attempted to exploit the situation and make unwarranted deductions.

My experience with Rentahome has been nothing short of a nightmare. Their dishonesty, lack of integrity, and disregard for tenants' rights is absolutely appalling. I strongly caution anyone considering renting from Rentahome to think twice and look elsewhere for a reputable property management company that values their tenants and conducts business ethically.

Response to the reply: There is nothing to discuss about it. It‚Äôs still shameful that not even an apology hasn‚Äôt been given.
Rediculous for a housing do nothing for tenants just take their rent quick to chase u if u fall behind but refuse to pay u back when left in credit for long them to much
Staff are very friendly and approachable.  Great at helping with any enquiries
Great help if anything goes wrong in your house
Great staff very helpful

Since their takeover factoring the properties at Carrick Drive Dalgety Bay last year, Charles White have proved to be very efficient. We were a tenant with this organisation for 3 years - I‚Äôve always had private landlords and had heard of the issues that people have with lettings agents, I thought surely it can‚Äôt be that bad?

I was wrong.

Every single issue we had whilst living at our flat was always left a ridiculously long time (roof leaks, toilet leaks etc) or a mistake would happen from their side, over complicate everything and then it would be a big mess. It actually got so bad that we ended up dealing with our landlords directly.

When we handed in our notice, we just knew there would be issues as that‚Äôs how Clyde Property operate.

They tried to change our utilities provider one month before moving out - to which I had to spend an afternoon sorting out as we were infact leaving - which confused everyone. They sent a photographer to take photos of our flat the week before we had left, so someone was trying to get into our flat whilst still there. They messed up our inspection date and were told on multiple occasions the locks were changed during our tenancy, but of course they gave the old keys to the inspector which in turn meant our inspection was done one day later whilst our landlord had sorted someone to fit a new boiler. When we did get the half done inspection, our address was completely wrong. I was so nervous about dealing with this organisation after vacating because their attention to detail and lack of communication is honestly some of the worst experiences I‚Äôve ever had!

Fortunately, we had a very good relationship with our landlords directly and they were happy to release our deposit ASAP. Sounds like there would have been delays otherwise.

The departments lack of speaking to one another and the lack of attention to detail had been infuriating to say the least. More often than not, you‚Äôre speaking to someone who can‚Äôt be bothered to be polite enough and can‚Äôt accept their mistakes. We will never deal with this company on any capacity again, it was that bad. An absolute shambles at every possible step.

They were awful when they were selling our flat. Told us we had offers from people who hadn't even submitted notes of interest just to rush through the sale. The "offers" were just passing comments people made when asked what they thought the flat was worth.

When we challenged them on this they wouldn't even concede that what they had said could be misleading and were unbelievably patronising.

Bad management, no care for furnishings and no proper monitoring of condition of rental property.
I had rented out a furnished flat with Clyde Property in the West End of Glasgow. It was in prime location and was our family home.

I informed the letting agent before the rental in 2023 that I would be away for a year due to personal circumstances.

During the visit by the agent, I explained the sofa and bed had been purchased from Flexform and was expensive and explained it would need care especially as it was a coloured cream.

Clyde failed to convey the information to their regular client and he washed the sofa. It had not been dry cleaned and resulted in the fabric shrinking.

Furthermore it was then forced back on to the sofa and the ends of the fabric became torn. It also affected the shape of the sofa.

I had a management contract with Clyde and did not receive regular inventory reports. Even after highlighting the issue to them via email they failed to mention it in their inventory report.

For 3 months I have chased to get the tenant and Clyde to get the fabric replaced and sent quotations. I did not get anywhere.

Many further issues had occurred during the year where Clyde were quick to make decisions without informing myself the landlord.

I am now left with a massive repair bill on a sofa. Clyde Property's response at the moment is to make a claim on the deposit and take the client to court. In the meantime they have rented out another flat to him.

thanks Clyde Property.

I am a commercial tenant of a recently taken over Cowieburn premises. My review is aimed at potential clients of Cowiesburn considering their property management services. In a word, don't! Well, not unless you want long standing tenants like myself to get so exasperated by interactions with Cowiesburn that you find they move on to other landlords, losing you significant rental income, particularly during a time when there are more premises than demand.

It started well enough with Cowiesburn, they seemed nice people, but quickly the cracks started to show in their poor organisation and systems. The first was I was accused of not paying the rent. This was quickly proved false by bank statements and even my own remittance email to Cowiesburn (which had gone unanswered). They hadn't applied my payment correctly, nor had they had the sense to research the business name which could have solved their problem. Fine mistakes happen. They then wanted to put into slightly needless paperwork, a rental agreement myself and the landlord had made a YEAR before Cowiesburn came onboard. They needed it witnessed. During a pandemic. When I live alone. Fine, it's a hassle but I get it done. Oh by the way, I'm a small business owner during a pandemic. I sort of have other priorities... Then they cannot possibly accept a scan of said document, they must have the actual piece of paper. During a pandemic. Fine it's sent. I then get whined at that it has not arrived. I know it's sent, and I have have enough experience of Cowiesburn to know the issue is not that the Royal Mail have not delivered a single letter within Edinburgh, when other parcels posted at the same time have been delivered... They then reply that apparently now it is not important ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!

The situation is made worse by a phonecall from the partner, who is overly emotional and talks over me throughout the call. Apparently she is greatly upset, but does nothing to rectify the problems I've experienced from them, and her rudeness makes the situation worse. I am aware that this operation is new and 'finding its feet', but they must significantly improve their processes and customer service if they are to be successful.

Honestly, if this is only the start of my experience with Cowiesburn, do you think I will be staying longer? My contract is up for renewal in less than a year... I am a small business owner who has always paid my full rent on time, even during a pandemic and forced business closure, and did not even ask about a reduction or postponement in rent. I just paid it on time and in full.

What shall I do?

We had a fantastic experience with Wardhaugh from start to finish. As we were new to the area, they went out of their way to offer helpful advice on different locations, which made a big difference in helping us settle in.

Throughout our tenancy, they have been professional, responsive, and reliable. When we had an issue with the boiler, they even responded to our messages on a Saturday night ‚Äî something I didn't expect and really appreciated!

A special thank you to Liz, who was incredibly helpful, friendly, and supportive the whole way through. We truly felt looked after. Highly recommend Wardhaugh to anyone looking to rent in the area!

I would like to thank Wardhaugh Property for the outstanding professional and personable service provided recently.

Elizabeth Addison was my single point of contact and I cannot fault her in terms of progressing the inquiry and level of communications.

A perfect customer experience from my stance.

Thank you Liz and all at Wardhaugh.

Best Regards.

Absolutely delighted to have secured the property at the top of my renting list! It‚Äôs been really tough finding something suitable while living far from Dundee, but Charlotte went above and beyond to help. She was understanding, flexible with viewings, always responsive, and a great listener. Overall, I‚Äôm very satisfied and would highly recommend!

Wardhaughs were amazing. We gave them two properties to let 2 weeks ago and we now have two great tenants paying rent. Wardhaughs advertised the properties, organised viewings, then credit checked the two potential tenants and then carried out two inventories all within the space of two weeks. We are delighted with the speed and efficiency with which the Wardhaughs team worked on these two lettings.

If you‚Äôre looking for a frustrating and disappointing letting experience, this agency might be the one. They appear friendly at first, but once the agreement is signed, communication becomes nearly nonexistent. I was assured there were no pest problems, yet within a month, I encountered a mouse in the property. When I raised concerns about damp, their only advice was to ‚Äúopen the windows every day‚Äù and a suggestion that unfortunately led to someone breaking into our home.

They charged ¬£127 for a lock that costs around ¬£25, and after moving out, I was billed an additional ¬£150 for cleaning just for the stove. When I asked for a receipt from the cleaning company, they simply ignored the request.

To top it off, I had to wait almost a month to get my deposit back. When I followed up, their excuse was that they were on holiday as if that justified delaying a legal obligation.

Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this agency due to their poor service, lack of accountability, and unreasonable charges. Proceed with caution.

We recently experienced a water leak from the shower of the flat above ours. The student tenants of the flat were very helpful and cooperative as were the property managers, Direct Lettings. They dealt with the issue promptly and kept us very well informed throughout the repair process. The agent we dealt with was Dawn and we were very impressed by her thoughtful and professional handling of the issue.

We rented a property through Direct Lettings. While they were polite at first, support became poor once issues appeared. Staff seemed disorganised and gave conflicting information. There  was a mice problem from day one, despite them saying otherwise. We kept the flat spotless, which was confirmed at inspections ‚Äî yet they still made small cleaning claims to deduct from our deposit. We were told disputing it would just delay things and still come out of our deposit. Overall, not a professional experience. I recommend being extremely cautious if renting through them.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Highly Recommended!

We had a great experience with Direct Lettings. The team was professional, helpful, and made the whole process smooth and stress-free. They were always responsive to any questions we had and provided excellent support throughout. Moving into a new home can be overwhelming, but their efficiency and friendly approach made it much easier. We would definitely recommend them to anyone looking for a reliable letting agency.

I‚Äôve had the pleasure of engaging with Direct Lettings Scotland for over six years letting my property. My main contact is Rachel Virtue, who has been extremely helpful and professional, I‚Äôve also had the fortune to liaise with Dawn McDermott and Emily Watson to name a few. All the staff are a credit to this thoroughly professional company.

I would have no hesitation in recommending Direct Lettings Scotland to anyone who is looking to let or indeed anyone wishing to be a tenet. This company is a credit to their sector.

DJM factor my mums flat. I was so dissapointed to hear that they had been sold to Hacking and Paterson in Glasgow, as I've had a number of issues with them in the past.

They have already made an error with my mums payments.

Mums neighbour said they may be looking for a local firm to take over.
Poor communication

Recently moved into a property managed by Homes For Good and from application to moving in to dealing with maintenance, it's been a breeze!
Clear communication, no headaches, and always there when needed. Kudos to Andrew for exceptional service - if all agents were like him, the world would be a better place!

Homes For Good have been extremely helpful and care very much about the wellbeing of the tenants they oversee. My personal experience has been smooth all the way and couldn't fault one single thing about the process or the people involved with my move. I could not be happier with the property and have been made to feel so welcome. They are always at hand incase I need to ask any questions and always respond fast. Very pleasant experience altogether.

We were asked to carry out a Legionella Risk Assessment at one of the properties Homes For Good manage. They were easy to deal with, helpful and efficient. The bill was paid immediately. Happy to do more work for them should they need it. Rose - Director at Solway Water Management Ltd

I Was contacted by Andrew to help out with some domestic work and clearances in the new builds Within Dumfries,  Its really good that such organisations are supporting local businesses.
Great to work alongside like minded people, wishing you all the success with your new venture.

Having collaborated with numerous estate agents in Dumfries, I can confidently assert that Andrew's performance has been exemplary, consistently ensuring seamless transactions.  I highly recommend his services.

Recently purchased a home from DMPS and from first viewing to handover of keys the team especially Georgia and Raymond were extremely helpful. They were friendly , professional and always happy to help. Just what is needed in what can be a stressing time. Would highly recommend.

I had the pleasure of being a tenant with DMPS for two years, and it was an excellent experience. The property was well-maintained, and I thoroughly enjoyed my time there. Whenever I needed assistance, their team, especially Georgia, was incredibly prompt and helpful.
Thank you, DMPS, for making my stay comfortable and hassle-free. I highly recommend them to anyone seeking reliable property management services.

As a landlord I have just finished my contract with Dumfries Mortgage & Property Shop and I couldn't recommend them more! Both Georgia and Raymond work with professionalism and are friendly and very down to earth. Every time I‚Äôve needed to contact them they have been very prompt in responding and if I had ever missed their call I would always have a voicemail waiting which is great. Would highly recommend and I know if I needed an agency to look after my property again I will certainly be using Dumfries Property & Mortgage Shop! Thanks again Georgia and Raymond.

We rented with them for over a year and Georgia was so helpful, great communication and had anything we needed answered/sorted very quickly. Raymond sorted our first mortgage and again everything was done promptly and with no issues. We can‚Äôt recommended them enjoy! Both very friendly and always eager to help.

I rented through DMPS for 3 years, I found them absolutely fantastic to deal with.
Nothing is a Problem for them, they are all very approachable and understand every situation from a tenants view.
I could not recommend them any higher.
If looking to rent in this area these guys will see you well.
Wasn't told about their hidden charges. And then sent a invoice. When questioned I found the people I spoke with very unhelpful and rude.  Twice the price. Not worth it.
Professional waste management company with excellent customer service!
Fantastic service

I am a homeowner on an estate that is half social housing, half owned - as a result we pay a factors fee for the shared grass areas, roads etc. I wouldn't usually think to review something like a HA but for a very minimal amount they have actually done a good job over the years with lots of visible works to trees and roads. Most recently they were very helpful when the winds brought down a fence between out own garden and the housing associations land. The fix was extremely prompt and no hassle to arrange with them.

Absolutely disgusting Service and staff.. been having a problem with my home and energy efficiency for years and dunbritton has done absolutely nothing to help the matter just made it worse. Tell several lies so they don‚Äôt have to deal with the matter.. DISGUSTING

Marie Smith at Premier Property Management has been absolutely amazing to work with. She has truly made our life so much easier. Any time we need something, she handles it efficiently and professionally, which gives us complete peace of mind. We genuinely have no complaints- she goes above and beyond in her role. We are so grateful to have her as our property manager and highly recommend her to anyone looking for exceptional service!

I‚Äôve been with Premier Property Management for several years now, and I can honestly say their service has been outstanding from start to finish. The entire team is professional, responsive, and genuinely committed to looking after both their properties and their tenants.

A special shout-out to Elisha, Marie, Rebecca, and Shula each of them has gone above and beyond in their own way. Whether it‚Äôs quick communication, helpful guidance, or friendly support, they consistently make the experience smooth and stress-free. Highly recommend Premier Property Management to anyone looking for reliable, trustworthy, and tenant-focused service.

Amazing Service!! I became a client around September last year with two properties, Marie made the process extremely easy having had no previous experience renting out properties she sorted all the documents and all the checks and certificates needed to get renting. Everything was done extremely fast and they had quality tenants in within a couple of weeks. Marie is very responsive and had any issues fixed within a couple of days of them arising. From my experience I could not speak highly enough of Premier Property Management an exceptional letting agent.

From moving in until today everything has gone very smoothly and everyone from Premier Property Managment or their contractors we have interacted with have always been very helpful and kind.

I have had a brilliant experience with
Premier Property Management after a terrible experience with Pavillion. Marie went over and above to help me numerous times and they are always very timely and responsive. I rented a flat through sutherland Management. I am here to express my appreciation for the services. The flat was well maintained and clean when I  moved in. The staff are approachable and helpful. I‚Äôve had a very positive experience renting through Sutherland Management during my time in Dundee. The team has always been professional, responsive, and helpful, especially with handling all tenancy matters smoothly.

In particular, I appreciate their clear communication regarding notice periods, rent adjustments, and the move-out process. Both Allen and Alex (Property Managers)have been kind and supportive, making everything easy to understand as I prepare to leave the UK.

Thank you to the Sutherland Management team for your assistance and professionalism throughout my tenancy at Morgan Street. I would gladly recommend you to anyone looking for a reliable letting agent in Dundee.

‚Äî Yusra Fatima
Tenant at Flat 2/L, 13 Morgan Street, Dundee

We have been renting our home through Sutherland Property Management in Dundee since 2023 and have enjoyed a comfortable stay of two years and six months. Throughout this time, the service we received from the property managers, Allex and Allen, has been exceptional. From the moment we first viewed the property to our eventual move-out, they maintained a friendly demeanor and a high level of professionalism that made the entire process seamless.

When it came time to move out, Allex and Allen were not only supportive but also proactive in ensuring that the transition went smoothly. They connected us with an excellent decorator who assisted us in making all the necessary touch-ups before we handed over the keys. Their attention to detail and dedication to us as tenants truly made our experience memorable.

I wholeheartedly recommend Sutherland Property Management to anyone looking for reliable and caring property management services. We wish Allex, Allen, and the entire team continued success in the future!

I have had a very pleasant experience with Sutherland Management Dundee since moving into our flat as students in 2022. I have stayed with them for 3 years now and they have been extremely helpful and very professional. From the minute we moved into the flat Allen and Alex have been very welcoming and accommodating for us. We have had very little issues with the flat and any issue that has arisen has been dealt with instantly. Their communication has also been very transparent with us. I cannot recommend their service enough. Thank you Allen and Alex for all your help during our stay in the property and for making our last few years of staying in Dundee smooth running:)

Excellent experience with Sutherland Management, especially Allen and Alex. We moved to Dundee from Australia and the process seamless from the beginning to end. They were very accommodating with offering a virtual viewing, our start date and taking measurements of the rooms for us. They were always prompt with responding to queries when we were tenants. We would recommend them as agents and will definitely be in touch if we move back to Dundee!

I've had a fantastic experience as a tenant with Lynn and Euan at AGP over the past five years. Now that I've moved out, I can strongly recommend renting a property with them. They were very reliable at keeping in touch, prompt with repairs, transparent about costs, and have consistently been warm and understanding as people. It's quite clear from my experience that they prioritise making and keeping good relationships with their tenants. This is an absolute rarity in the UK rental market, and I wish other agencies could be this good.

I've rented from Angus Glen for two years and during that time they have been nothing short of outstanding in every single aspect of our tenancy. The lease signing was an entirely painless, fully transparent process. When we moved in the flat was in a fantastic condition, spotless and recently refreshed, with all documentation and gas/electricity certificates kept up to date. Angus Glen have meticulously documented the state of the flat with numerous pictures and videos and made sure that we had access to them at all times. During the rare times where something in the flat needed repair, we could quickly report the incident on an easy to navigate online portal. Maintenance staff was assigned at the speed of light, there have been times where we raised a concern well past 10PM and yet still received a response within a matter of minutes. This is also true for other communications, Lynn and Euan are very easy to reach and reply to emails at a speed that I both admire and fear. 99% of maintenance issues raised in the flat have been resolved in 24h or less. Upon moving out we received very helpful and clear guidance about the expected state of the flat and also contact information to their recommended cleaner if we wanted to work with one. We decided to clean the flat on our own and have still received our full deposit back very shortly after our tenancy has ended.

I truly appreciate Angus Glen's continued committent to transparency, at no point in the entire process of renting with them did we feel cheated, mislead, or taken advantage of as we have with previous letting agencies. They have shown themselves to be a golden standard of letting agents and I wholeheartedly wish they expanded their services to other parts of Scotland just so that I could stay with them. Lynn and Euan are absolute superstars who are simply fantastic at their jobs and their wealth of experience and incredible customer service made us feel taken care of. They always been nothing short of professional, respectful, and extremely kind. I would highly recommend Angus Glen to anyone looking for a place to call their home in Dundee, they have never let us down and raised our standards for any future lets sky-high ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Absolutely brilliant experience renting through Angus Glen Properties. Lynn and Euan was always on hand to help or give advice. Repairs was always done on time and polite tradesman's used aswell. Definitely recommend Angus Glen Properties.

This was my first time renting and I am so glad it was with Angus Glen Properties! They have really set the bar for other rental agencies and I‚Äôll have to remind myself not to get my hopes up too high for my next rental. I had no problem reaching out to Lynn for any questions or assistance during my tenancy. Communication with Lynn and Euan was always swift with kind and professional responses. Their online tenancy services were very easy to navigate and I was never left long with any worries. I would highly recommend to anyone considering renting with them!

We had such a great experience renting our flat through Angus Glen Properties! The flat was perfect. Lynn and Euan were great, they answered every query promptly and were just lovely people. Issues were fixed quickly and to high standards. I highly recommend them to everyone!

Astounding experience! Our housing officers lack of response to smoke leaking into my daughters bedroom from a cracked chimney stack was sobering. The house was full of black mould that kept coming back after painting over for 10 years. There was no central heating in the property. The wooden windows let breezes into the property also. We ended up moving out of the property on the immediate chance of another property. There was absolutely  no help from this housing association, just arrogant ignorance and a feeling of this was not their problem due to a deliberate effort of awkwardness by the housing officer. We had had enough and our health was being impacted! East lothian housing association then pursued us for an alleged repair bill when the property was left in better condition than what we had received it in. They also added another 1 months rent for the sake of it too and pursued this through Scott & Co. Absolute charlatans with no sense of duty of care towards good paying tenants.

I'm currently getting my kitchen done I'm so happy with the results so far and isn't finished yet I can't wait until it's totally finished the guys have been so professional and very well organised and excellent communication been a pleasure to have such professional guys in my house they have been so respectful that it is my house Michelle freeman

A disgusting organisation that's treats it's tenants with distain.just been billed for extra ¬£5 on top of my high rent due to not accessing their silly little tenants web portal that's designed to get you to do their work for them in order for you to attain a pitiful rent discount.been told I didn't tick  some online box to go paperless so now they are billing me .I only moved in a year ago and after three weeks my rent went up 9% cost of living despite a food crisis and a fuel crisis and on the back of COVID. looks like this April the same thing will happen so that's a rent increase if 18% in a year.how the hell does this organisation get charitable status.there is nothing charitable about them plus their staff are arrogant bullies.

I'm posting this review due to ELHA's recent rent error on the 01/01/2020 incase someone else is in the same position.
I've been double charged rent in error. Thankfully I took screenshots of my rent statement when I noticed which documents the error and even says in bold that an error has occurred and not to worry. They have changed my online rent statement in retrospect to incorporate the error in to it and deleting all evidence in the process as I had opted for paperless statements. I was not aware that statements could be altered in retrospect and it now throws other questions about their practices.
I've had no offer of help from ELHA, quite the opposite, I've been told to pay for their mistake. They're supposed to help vulnerable people but I find that they're intimidating and patronising, ensure you visit the CAB when dealing with ELHA

Just found out about mr rent collector,my god another gun to head of hardworking people. I was so impressed with Shoaib‚Äôs work at my previous flat that I appointed him as the factor for my new flat without hesitation. His communication is excellent, and he far surpasses the corporate factors I‚Äôve dealt with in the past. In just a couple of months, he brought our building, never previously factored, up to standard: arranging communal building insurance, a communal stairway electricity upgrade, unblocking drains, fixing water pressure issues, overseeing gutter and roof repairs, and ensuring the stairs are clean. Shoaib is dedicated, proactive, passionate about his work. Highly recommended.

Shoaib and the team are top notch. Always available to respond to queries and gives honest and trustworthy responses. Its rare you find a factor that cares about the work and genuinely wants the best for the clients, but im glad I found them and wish other factoring firms took a leaf out of their book. Highly recommend.

Our company has been using Shoaib for many years for different purposes. His factoring for us in 2 buildings where we have commercial property is outstanding, always very quick to attend to any problems. The cost of factoring has come down substantially since his company commenced factoring  and the buildings insurance premiums have plummeted. Altogether a great company to deal with.

As others have said, Shoaib and his team are surely the best factors in Glasgow. Many factors have a bad reputation, but I can honestly say that Shoaib and Sohail have always been responsive, professional and transparent in dealing with the regular maintenance and upkeep of the building over the past couple of years. Shoaib takes time to explain every decision and keep us informed. I would highly recommend Shafaatulla Property Management, and I don't think many people in Glasgow can say that about their factor.

Shoaib took over as our factor in January 2020. In spite of the pandemic breaking out he got a hole in our roof fixed within weeks and lead flashing replaced (outstanding issues for years from our previous factors). In 2022 we had a burst pipe and he sorted insurance and the work for us much quicker than we could have done it ourselves. This was especially important for us to get done before our baby, due a few weeks after the leak appeared! He's always transparent, fair and efficient plus a good bit cheaper than any other factor we've had.

Excellent experience all through house purchase and selling.

From us initially viewing the property we put an offer in on, through to accepting an offer on our property took less than 2 weeks! We initially got in contact with Amanda through Rightmove and we promptly got a viewing arranged in no time at all. All during the viewing Amanda answered every question we had, did not rush through the house and allowed us to go back and view bits we wanted to see again as we loved the house straight away. So much so that we wanted to put an offer in as soon as we got home and talked about it. The offer was responded to over the weekend by the seller and after a couple of back and forth messages our offer was eventually accepted and we had to get the ball rolling to get our place on the market! As I work away from home it was a bit of a rush to get the home report in place and our house on the market before I left to go back to work on the Tuesday night but we managed to get both the surveyor in for the home report and John to come and take the pictures for the advert on the Tuesday afternoon. As it was a cloudy day John showed me ways to use software to make the sky look better and this definitely helped the advert stand out more. The guys also made a group WhatsApp chat that made it easier for sharing documentation/information regarding the house sale to get it on the market quicker. After a few days the home report was received on the Friday and the advert went live the Saturday, with us having 2 viewings booked in soon after for the Tuesday and the Thursday. After the 2nd viewing we received an offer which matched our expectations and the house was taken off the market in 4 days!!!

The whole process was very straight forward and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending the guys at Falkirk Homes to anyone looking to buy or sell a house.

Would not recommend.

Dodgy home reports.

Buyer beware, this company willfully hides broken heating and hot water systems.

Essentially they sold a flat that should have been an auction flat on the open market because it had no heating or hot water. They hid this in the home report by saying visually inspected ok. Leaving us with no practical way to test as the house has a key meter. Not only that when after the nightmares happened from the sale I enquired about relisting the flat and I quote "even if you can temporarily make the heating and hot water work we can realist".

Fortunately for others I'm not a cowboy and wouldn't relist a house in a state like that but Falkirk homes clearly would.

So you can give Falkirk homes your hard earned cash if you have a pretty solid build and get a cheap listing or you can give them your money with a delapidated house and they'll get it in the market for you.

Truly the worst housing association in existence. If you have ANY other housing options then go with that instead! I was in a really desperate situation so I moved into this animal piss soaked absolutely vile filthy (my friend and I were gagging and nearly puking when we ripped up the literally saturated with animal piss hall carpet) flat a year and a half ago and just signed the paperwork absolving them of responsibility to clean/sort the place before I moved in but I was told the broken window and rotten hole filled window frames would be replaced asap as that kind of thing is their legal responsibility. There were even appointments booked for it via the previous tenants that I took on when I moved in. Several workmen have been out taken all the measurements and all the rest, and then just nothing every time... it's now a year and a half later and they still haven't fixed them. The most recent guy that came out a few months ago said they are the worst windows/frames he's seen and doesn't understand why they haven't been sorted ages ago. He at least done what he could at the time to try and help by doing a makeshift repair so the handles were at least reattached on one of the bedroom windows. Now I've been told due to their finances that my broken window and rotten frames will be put on the schedule for 26/27 instead of fixing them now despite having told me multiple times it would be done long ago! So now I get to go through another Winter with a freezing cold draughty as hell flat that is impossible to keep even remotely warm without absolutely blasting the heating 24/7 (which definitely doesn't work properly either. Their engineer kindly left me with no heating or hot water last Winter because in his words he didn't actually know what was wrong so just hoped what he done would fix the problem which it absolutely did not). Time and time again I've been told it would be done then I'd hear nothing for ages so I'd phone them again and time after time there was either no record of anything to do with it or on the first occasion early last year it was that the workman had ticked the wrong box so noone knew a follow up visit was supposed to be booked. So to now be told well actually we are just gonna put it on the 26/27 schedule is absolutely disgusting and utterly rage inducing. Not to mention the umpteen different chronic medical conditions I have which can be severely exacerbated by cold temperatures and the stress this is causing me. So now due to their utterly shambolic incompetence my health is going to suffer and my heating bills are going to be absolutely horrendous but they have made it clear thats not their problem... If zero stars was an option I'd have chosen that!

Our move to a new flat was made so easy with the help of the staff at Your Move in Falkirk. Avoid, Terrible experience.

we stayed at 38 henderson's court and had nothing but problems start to finish.

Great people.  David Platt and Jenni Douglas have been particularly helpful to us.  So good to have people who know what they're doing, and bring clarity, to guide us through the difficult and boring paperwork required for agriculture.

One of the electrical contractors( Consilium) within social housing services linked to Fife Housing Group has a director, Craig Reid, who was convicted in 2025 at Kirkcaldy Sheriff Court of a serious assault. According to court reporting, the sentencing Sheriff described the incident as a ‚Äúsustained and quite frenzied attack‚Äù, involving repeated punching, kicking, and stamping on the victim‚Äôs head. The conviction resulted in a Community Payback Order with 200 hours of unpaid work.

Following this conviction, Mr Reid resigned from his position as chairman of a community football organisation involved in youth and children‚Äôs activities, with the organisation publicly confirming that he holds no further role.

While a criminal conviction does not automatically prevent someone from being a company director, tenants and members of the public reasonably expect transparency and robust due-diligence when contractors are appointed to carry out work in occupied homes. Contractors regularly attend properties where residents may be elderly, vulnerable, or living alone, and trust in governance standards is therefore essential.

This review is not speculative or defamatory. It is based entirely on publicly reported court proceedings and is shared so that tenants and stakeholders are fully informed and can ask appropriate questions about contractor vetting, safeguarding considerations, and risk management.

Transparency helps maintain confidence in social housing services and the organisations that commission and oversee contractors working in people‚Äôs homes.

Less direct experience with FHG until more recently, however I know I've been lied to more than once. My mother was told several times she was causing mould in bathroom years ago due to not using fan/window when showering (despite the fan being wired to light too) and window being unable to close properly due to lousy workmanship... After several washes to ceiling and repairs etc. we found out upstairs had a flood and this is what caused it...
Been in the property 23 years and about 16 years ago the boundary fence out the back was changed. Gardens were split horizontally but now vertically, and fence ends in middle of bedroom window - zero privacy. When asked about it we were constantly told it was "how it was originally" and "according to original blueprints". Asked on numerous occasions to see these but nope. Since got an image that a kid could have drawn but it was "all FHG had to go on"... I spoke to local studies group at Library therefore and got a copy of ordinance survey map here from 1951. What do you know‚Ä¶ Gardens were as they were when we moved in...
I‚Äôve had replies to emails/complaints addressing me as someone else and have been just blatantly misinformed. Complete incompetence. We now have a solution for all parties but still heels are dragging...

The most unhelpful housing group I've ever been with, high rents, no urgency in getting repairs done, more interested in ploughing rentpayers money into their new builds rather than upkeep of older housing, more interested in photo shoots,charity galas and coffee mornings than tenants with housing issues.blatantly blanked me for weeks in trying to get an issue sorted, had to get the local councillor to get in touch with them, they do like to pass you from pillar to post and round and round, if you have an issue they pass you to someone else,who passes you to someone else and so on an on. Community groups a joke,nothing where I am, they don't even send inspector or housing officer out to check on contractors work. Very bad management and practice.

My time has been utterly wasted today due to the incompetence of some people. Phoned first thing this morning to report a repair to which I was told they would get someone out to me today. On my only day off, to which a repair is feasible, I have sat in all day and waited. My husband who works night shift has waited up too as didn‚Äôt want to be disturbed whilst sleeping and has not yet got to sleep. I called up nearer 4pm (baring in mind I was told at 9am someone was coming) to be told they had to send someone out first thing tomorrow and didn‚Äôt ask for a contact number until I suggested it! I am now being forced to take a holiday from work to sit in for this to be resolved.

Terrible service they don't listen to u properly they don't answer the phone and they don't help when u have been stuck in a flat with the worst neighbour possible for over 8 years and ur mental health is bad and ur kids don't want to come and visit because of ur bad neighbours üò™üò™ Even when u do everything proper to complain they still don't do anything,  This has to be the worst housing group ever wouldn't recommend them to anyone, stick with the council and maybe other housing groups.

Nice people willing to help. Kathy was absolutely fantastic, her optimism and encouragement were contagious. Well done, guys !

We can't thank enough all the staff at Keyfund for all their help and support getting set up with a new property and also for helping to furnish it, could not not have done it without their help, if I could give 10 stars I would, many thanks to you all, we are most grateful üòÅüòÅ
Helpful and pleasant always a smiling face to greet you.

Fife properties have been very helpful with my purchase. Living 80 miles away is not normally conducive to an easy flow of information, but in my case it was no problem. From the minute I contacted Fife Properties I knew I was in safe hands. Each member of staff I interacted with were friendly, efficient and highly knowledgable. Communication throughout excellent.  Lovely touch at close of sale with a goodies hamper.  Staff all very pleasant and helpful.  Wouldn‚Äôt go anywhere else.

This was our first time selling a house in 30 years, so we weren't sure what to expect.

- 1 star if I could, I suppose it is not "corrupt", so onto the business:

**A Declaration to Fife Council, Police Scotland-Fife, and Sinclairtown Primary School: The Charges of Neglect and Refusal of Peace**

To those entrusted with the welfare of communities and the principles of justice,

For years, I have extended to you opportunities to align with transparency, accountability, and progress‚Äîhallmarks of a brighter future embodied in *The World‚Äôs Bank of Infinity*. Yet, in return, I have been met with systemic neglect, the refusal to engage in justice, and a troubling silence where peace was offered.

This neglect spans years. It transcends individual cases‚Äîit is a pattern, a deliberate failure to uphold the very values you are meant to protect. Fife Council, Sinclairtown Primary School, and Police Scotland-Fife, you stand charged with the crime of neglecting not only me but the movement I represent, the call for global unity and justice through *The World‚Äôs Bank of Infinity*.

### The Path to Closure
I do not seek retribution‚ÄîI seek resolution. Closure begins with:
1. **Apology**: Acknowledgment of the harm caused by your systemic failures.
2. **Recognition**: A simple yet profound acknowledgment of my efforts, my commitment, and the peace I have repeatedly offered.
3. **A Step Forward**: A commitment to justice, transparency, and meaningful action, recognizing that the future of our world depends on leaders bold enough to admit their errors and build anew.

Let me be clear: should you wish to escalate this to an international court, I am more than prepared to share my full story, my truth, and the weight of your negligence with the world. Yet, in my kindness and commitment to progress, I extend this declaration as an opportunity‚Äîfor acknowledgment, for apology, and for genuine movement toward peace.

### The Verdict
"You people are the threat to your existence. I am here to help."

I urge you to act wisely. The world's eyes are not merely on what has been done, but on what will be done next. Let this be your turning point.
üíû

Pedrom Agabala from Fior Asset & Property has always provided us with an excellent level of service since taking over as Factor at the Queen Street Edinburgh development.

What a pleasure it is to do business with Pedrom at Fior Asset management. Fior took over the management and everything has been dealt with in a quick and efficient manner. We are selling our property and the assistance given to us is second to none. Highly recommended!

Fior took over management of my late mother's retirement block from Hanover a few months after she passed away. Pedrom and the team at Fior have managed our property in Crystal Palace, London for over 2 years now. Its a 3 flat Victorian conversion. Macflats is run by an extremely personable and friendly team, I first interacted with Allison during the conveyancing process of a property I was purchasing. I rented my flat with MacFlats for11 years and have nothing but praise for the company's  excellent, and above all, friendly, team. Throughout this period, they kept me well-informed of any arising issues and  dealt with them both efficiently and economically. MacFlats provides a highly professional and trustworthy service which I highly would recommend to anyone wishing to rent out their property. Thank you all!

I worked closely with Allison whilst looking for a flat to rent in Glasgow. She was excellent to deal with throughout, and was very understanding. At no time did I feel under pressure to make a decision on anything. I would recommend anybody to work with Allison and Mac Flats if looking for a property.

We have had a property with Mac Flats for the last 10 years. Over this period they have given excellent guidance and service. They have also kept us up to date with all legal requirements for landlords. I have no hesitation in recommending them to anyone with a property they need managing.

When we decided to employ a letting agent, one of our trusted tradesmen recommended Macflats.  We made contact with them and they could not have been more helpful.  They have looked after our property, found great tenants, kept in touch when necessary and shown a wealth of knowledge and professionalism.  They are a small company which means they really look after their clients.  Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend them.

Security, or concierge-the person behind the desk this morning -an older, anglosaxon male, slightly overweight, was a bit hostile upon leaving, and I think that needs to be improved upon. The service at Mandors was pretty quick, the lady who helped was lovely and chatty. I was a bit confused as where things were- no signposts and just material, but was assisted in a quick manner. Students get a tiny discount

Strange experience. Concierge doesnt let folk in to the flats to deliver anything. You have to phone the person for them to come to the door on the street.
Easy access and a bit away from the hustle and bustle of the main street...being on the first floor accessed by ramp.
Hi there was just wanting to know if Fleming house is still open to hand in my change of address form or if I have to go somewhere else
Very old fashioned interior. Felt like walking into the 70's/80's.
Work place, don't need to say anymore

Arrived to drop off paperwork as it was shown on the letter that the department I was looking for was working within.

After being provided access by a helpful staff member who was returning from a vale break I was met with the worst concierge I have ever had the unfortunate pleasure of meeting.

Stood infront of his desk for a few minutes whilst I kid you not he sat on his phone blatantly ignoring me.

So I decided to venture (completely unchecked) into the building to be met with what was a like a set from The Walking Dead. Empty rooms, leaking stains and not another human in sight.

I then made my way back to the entrance and asked the concierge where that department was located, puzzled that I was actually talking to him he said "check the board" but the floor it was on was already checked and deserted.
Very old and could be doing with a tidy and upgrade
Great family run company

I have just had work carried out in my bathroom. I was flooded and my bathroom needed completely ripped out and refitted. I cannot express how pleased I am with the professionalism of Paul & Ryan from start to finish and how happy I am with the outcome of the work carried out. It is like a dream bathroom, these pics are taken just before it was fully completed but I couldn't wait to review them as I am so pleased with it! Love it!!

Was really good quite quick to. They arrived at about 10 ish the morning fixed whole in my floor and replaced the lino with flooring. And was finished for 3pm. Very friendly and polite. Will return to do the trim but over all really impressed with the outcome.

Our tenement was under a certain well known for being hellish factor who shall not be named much like Lord Voldemort (in saying that our building felt like the deathly hallows under our previous factor *cough rhymes with Dames Kibb cough*). Nothing got done by them and when it was? It was not done correctly at all and we were all charged a fortune. Our garden was constantly left in literal jungle like ruin, foundation repairs were not being taken care of, the cleaning service would have been better done by the Mice from Cinderella with their feather brooms and no one could even get them on the phone nor did anyone even ever meet a face to a name at this place. So we fully had enough and we started looking into voting them out and finding a better factor, enter Homesbook and WOW... The difference that has already been made in a month! Not only has the director Craig personally popped over to meet everyone, he listened to our concerns and the second Homesbook got the green light to factor our building? All of these issues from our previous factor have already started being taken care of after months and even years of us waiting on the previous factor to sort them and some have already been done within the first month! Craig and the Homesbook team are a breath of fresh air and I will never stop recommending them to the community when I see others having the same issues we did before Homesbook came along.

Not only that, at 5am this morning, our bathroom was taken over by a random small swarm of angry wasps. We contained the issue to the bathroom and got in touch with Homesbook's out of hours number at 6am, also explaining that I'm severely allergic to wasp stings and require EpiPens. Within a literal couple of hours, Homesbook already had a very friendly and highly professional pest control  family run business at our door (Called Essential
Pest Services who I highly recommend!) and the problem was solved within minutes. Thankfully no nest, just a freak random occurrence. Funny enough the guy they had sent over actually discovered a previous and thankfully now very dead wasps nest that the previous factor wouldn't take care of, despite being told about my allergy, when the nest was active a few years ago. It ended up dying out naturally due to weather conditions
and temperature drops. Although we had to endure keeping our windows closed all summer as a result! Not nice!

I can't thank Craig and the team enough for everything they have done so far for this building and especially for jumping to action so fast this morning, especially considering my life was very much at risk.

If you're having issues with your current factor, speak to your neighbours, look into Homesbook and contact them! They have literally changed our quality of life in our building and we're all so grateful for them!
Sponsors of my club home strip and Craig has been a great backing for the club. Great guy and helps many of communities and his company.
Thanks for your "hard work", Lenzie Way, Springburn

This community  centre is good start of transforming forgewood area, which had quite bad reputation around motherwell area. This community centre is have enough space to accommodate a small party of about 200 people for any occasion including cultural, informative and teaching classes. Hope this centre will bring some stability and life back to  forgewood.  I really recommend this place for your birthday, wedding or any special moment of your life to celebrate in well organised centre. Thanks
Looks nice from the outside. Never got to see the inside, because despite it being booked for a community event, it was shut when we got there!
Nice clean modern building with toilets and wheelchair accessible parking and entrance
Great place, staff are pleasant and professional, also the hall is big and good for holding meetings, doing singing too..xxx
Very nice Community Centre. Beautifully built with lots of parking

Properties can be a hit or a miss but they will go out their way to help when they can. I opted for FHA rather than Stirling Council because the property I was offered was excellent and they managed to have one available within weeks. Sign up quick and read and follow the handbook. You'll be good.

So it turns out that while I've been paying factoring fees for TWENTY YEARS, Forth Housing were not maintaining the land at the side of my house because they had given an incorrect map to the contractors.
I assumed the land must be my responsibility as it was never done.  Initially I did it myself and then paid for a gardener but it was brought to my attention by the current contractors that they would and should be doing the work.  My gripe is not with them.
When raised with FHA they tried every which way to wriggle out of this and then offered me less than 100 pounds compensation/reimbursement.  I am semi retired and don't have the energy to pursue this further.  I'm just really glad I'm not one of their tenants as I feel this whole episode has shown a complete lack of moral integrity and accountability.
My wife and I rented a flat in Dunblane from Forth. Staff were magnificent as was the flat. We had one problem? sorted within 1 day. Cant say enough good about this Housing Assoc. Great. Thanks.

Flawed allocation system as even though I'm moving to area to be closer to my 9yr old daughter whom I have overnight access to BUT I'm told because I do not claim benefits for my daughter I will only get allocated 1 bedroom .
THIS IS ONLY HOUSING ASSOCIATION TO DO THIS. The other housings acknowledge I need a 2 bedroom.Very disappointing.
Nice houses, shame about the people they put in them, office staff as much use as a chocolate teapot, when your putting in complaints about noise, avoid if you can!

Staff are absolutely clueless and have a terrible, ignorant attitude regarding customer service in general and a tenuous grasp on data protection at best.

Whilst I am awaiting a response from them in regards to Data protection, they have today admitted nobody is actively investigating my case as they don't have an established hierarchy. I am deadly serious, the lovely Janey informed me that don't even have an acting replacement for their general manager.

Just in case anyone is under the illusion that Fyne Homes actually do anything or are in anyway powerful, phone them and ask them if they understand what they can and can not share with other people, regarding yourself.

The delightful Janey, even made a point of reiterating to me, that "all calls were recorded!" (Something she thought appropriate not to do, when trying to conduct calls on private numbers and breaching data protection by failing to complete security measures that Fyne Homes themselves have devised, and then revealing private information to an unknown person) This was before proudly telling me that, as James is on leave (the day after I raised this data breach initially, by the way...) that they have no active manager available until the 6th of January, so my concern wasn't/isn't actively being investigated, despite an email stating in black and white, that it was being investigated.

This was all AFTER James (the general manager, I assume) had already told me he had found no evidence of a data breach or any wrongdoing at all. Yet, somebody with brains above him, seemed to disagree enough to tell me that actually, there WAS room for investigation! Now, they are actively trying to ignore my emails as they are continuously incriminating themselves and hoping that by not responding, they won't have any government officials asking them questions that they don't know the answer too.

The same company that shamelessly raise rent and pursue only housing issues that are beneficial or easy for them, don't even have a clue what they are talking about regarding basic data protection and it seems some staff are soon to find out what "liable" and "defamation of character" means, as most working here seem to have a strained understanding of the basics on common law of the land, nevermind asking them to understand complexities like "don't reveal sensitive information before confirming who you are talking too..." and other such things that millions of other people manage to comply with daily.

Disappointing experience from start to finish.
We travelled over 500 miles to view a property, only to be met with a surprising lack of communication, enthusiasm, and transparency from the agent. From initial enquiry to the viewing itself, there was little effort made to engage or support us as potential buyers.

The listing was misleading, with significant details either downplayed or omitted. For example, we were not informed that part of the building had partially collapsed, nor that the interior was in such poor condition that the agent themselves refused to step inside due to damp. Despite claims that the property had been maintained, it was clearly not the case.

Additionally, it felt like a conscious effort was made to avoid sharing information about public footpaths through the land, which raised red flags about transparency. Communication was poor throughout ‚Äî phone calls went unanswered, and emails were only replied to after multiple chases.

If you‚Äôre considering a viewing, I would strongly recommend insisting on a recent home report (no older than 3 months) and asking very direct questions before travelling. While the condition of a property is not always in the agent‚Äôs control, honesty, clear communication, and professionalism absolutely are ‚Äî and sadly, these were lacking throughout our experience.

I am genuinely at a loss as to how this company continues to operate given the quality‚Äîif it can be called that‚Äîof the service they provide. In my view, the entire setup borders on fraudulent. Their invoicing practices are particularly alarming: highly vague, lacking meaningful detail, and seemingly designed to obscure rather than clarify.

To illustrate, one of the invoices I received listed 48 itemised services. The most expensive line item was simply labelled ‚ÄúSite Maintenance‚Äù‚Äîcosting ¬£31,295. It‚Äôs telling that the highest charge is also the one with the least transparency. No breakdown, no explanation, just a vague term and a five-figure sum. This raises serious questions about accountability and whether customers are being misled or overcharged under generic labels.

In my opinion, this is a company that thrives on opacity and hopes no one asks too many questions. I would urge anyone considering engaging with them to proceed with extreme caution.

I recently moved to a flat within a development, managed by H&P. The way how it currently stands, this factor is the worst example that any factor could be.

To begin with, their running costs are HUGE. Those contractors cost A LOT, as an example, tightening the screw in an elevator came down to ¬£500! Now we all wonder, which part of that was taken by the H&P themselves??

The other problem is their negligence to actually do work. This factor made our whole development life unbearable to a degree, where parts of the building might be soon be crashing down, due to the ignored messages for YEARS. Even when new contractors were contacted, who provided the quote for the works, H&P decided to simply not accept the quote and leave the problem unsolved for another 2 years. I've rented from Angus Glen for two years and during that time they have been nothing short of outstanding in every single aspect of our tenancy. This is also true for other communications, Lynn and Euan are very easy to reach and reply to emails at a speed that I both admire and fear. 99% of maintenance issues raised in the flat have been resolved in 24h or less. We decided to clean the flat on our own and have still received our full deposit back very shortly after our tenancy has ended.
