Great staff.

Having had a number of factors over the years we moved to Indigo Square a couple of years ago, they have been  very proactive and actually seem to care about the property. Very good at communication. I would happily recommend them.

We switched from a previous factor to Indigo square just over a year ago and so glad we did.  Since moving to them a big communal issue was discovered which has had many complications and complexities.  Despite this Euan has persevered and seen through all the dealings with the contractors and collection of funds from other owners in the block.  Throughout this the communication has been great - we've always been kept up to date on progress and blockers along the way, with in person meet ups and/or zoom calls if required.  I know for sure that if we had stayed with our previous factor this issue would still be outstanding for a long time to come.
The worst factor in Glasgow award goes to: indigo square! Val can‚Äôt respond to an email without it being personal - also can‚Äôt do the job that get the management fee for!

Indigo Square took over the factor responsibilities, from a well established factor, a few years ago at our flat complex at G3 6NS.

After the seamless process of taking over the factoring services Indigo Square implemented and continue to provide improved customer service and response times and much improved cleaning, gardening and other property maintenance services in terms of quality of service and value for money compared to the previous factor.

We have had a very positive experience with Indigo Square. Every query and email was received and acted upon quickly including rubbish removal in the close and repairs. Things were followed up efficiently and they communicated consistently. We highly recommend this company with their professionalism and value of service.

We‚Äôve worked with Individually Designed Homes across numerous sites, and their expertise, organisation, and planning are truly second to none. Every project is run like clockwork ‚Äî well structured, highly efficient, and professionally managed from start to finish.

Having worked closely with their team, I can confidently say that if I were ever to buy a plot of land, they would be my first choice to design and build my own home. Their attention to detail and ability to deliver consistently high standards sets them apart in the industry.

Highly recommend.

IDH were easy to work with, providing regular and clear billing information on a regular basis throughout the process. The workmanship was to a very high standard and communication clear and concise.
We would recommend IDH to anyone looking for high quality and dependability. Nothing was too much trouble and any client changes dealt with quickly and effectively.

We couldn‚Äôt be happier with the work IDH delivered on our extension and kitchen reconfiguration. From start to finish, the team was professional and efficient and the quality of workmanship is great. The end result has completely transformed our home. Highly recommend!

IDH converted our double garage into a single garage, office and utility room, also creating a new front door and entrance hall in the process. They were communicative throughout and carried out the work to a high standard. Our neighbours have praised IDH's consideration of their impact on others and general politeness. We would recommend IDH to anyone with a sizeable job that needs doing.

IDH completed an extension and full renovation of a ground and garden flat in the West End of Edinburgh.  Throughout the project the ethos was always "can do" which is very refreshing in construction.  When inevitable issues occurred solutions were offered and any problem dealt with quickly and effectively.  There was a true team effort approach and I'd have no reservation recommending IDH.  I enjoyed working with the IDH team and hope to do so again in the future.

Staggeringly incompetent. Let their tenants get away with fly tipping and have no interest in actually helping. If you need them to do anything it takes months if not years of constant phone calls where you are led to believe it will be dealt with only for it to be ignored.

Absolutely disgusted that an elderly gentleman couldn't get into his accommodation and their response was it could take upto 12 hours to get someone out to you, apparently they have no managers available and no way to complain as this is part of the tenancy agreement so they were happy to leave him sitting on a wet step

Terrible service. After two months of complaining about their tennnats fly tipping the items are still there with no end to this in sight. It took them two weeks to respond even after the police were involved in an incident involving their tennant. The staff simply don‚Äôt care.
Had to give it 1star for rank , would have gave minus if poss, a bunch of useless housing officers who seem to pick and choose and is like trying to get blood out a stone for help and repairs
Terrible service! Frequently avoid doing repair works/ much needed replacements for months if not years on end. Rude staff that don't listen to complaints and hang up on you.

factor_name: J. B. & G Forsyth Property Management Services
review_text: Worst ever factor. Not repairing external rainwater pipes for a number of years. Now the issue turned into more serious dry rot issues which would cost tens of thousands of repair. Even after the dry rot issue occurred, they are still not responding due common repair requests. They should be held liable for all the financial costs and stress ocurred on all residents involved.

factor_name: J. B. & G Forsyth Property Management Services
review_text: My husband and I have been customers of J B & G Forsyth for many years and can honestly say we are very happy with the service we have received. They have always dealt with us in a very courteous and professional manner. The ladies in the office have always been polite and friendly. A lovely company to deal with.

factor_name: J. B. & G Forsyth Property Management Services
review_text:
absolutely discusting  the worse people and terrible staff.  The receptionist she has been there for a while but could learn a thing or two about how to deal with a phone call or how to talk to their clients.

Service is poor service fees are paid and always extra payments have been charged.

Only if I knew how to get rid of them I would.

I dont know how they are my property factor amazed.

Judging by the previous reviews they back up what I have said and never ever would i recommend such vile and evil people.and company in my life.

They should be ashamed

factor_name: J. B. & G Forsyth Property Management Services
review_text: Arrogant staff and completely forget that they are working for you the customer. Promise phone calls back and never do so. If you query an invoice they point blank refuse to discuss the matter.

factor_name: J. B. & G Forsyth Property Management Services
review_text: This company is dreadful, they lack professionalism and are extremely rude. They don‚Äôt answer the phone or emails. I have no idea what we pay them for as they do nothing! I would avoid at all costs!!

I thought Donal and his trainee were excellent: comprehensive, respectful, trustworthy and completely professional. I was very satisfied with the time taken to explain a few issues and grateful that my comments were treated appropriately and promptly allowing my Home Report to go 'live' in a timely manner. Superb service.
I used these surveyors to obtain an updated EPC. They were quick to respond, extremely helpful, and went out of their way to assist at every turn. Highly recommend.

Easy to navigate portal. Step by step process. One stop Place for payments, home report, contract etc.
Very quick service to arrange the date for HR.
Happy with the value on the house. Fair and reasonable.
Very professional and fair. Unexpectedly quick turnaround of report despite Bank Holiday. Would certainly recommend and use in the future.

I give this one star because irrespective of the surveyor duty and skills involved in a undertaking a property survey,  it needs to be presented fairly and without ambiguity. I had a home report done - the onus being on the seller- which identified some low level damp. Because of the word 'rot' as well as damp, the impact of this report has been catastrophic and I have now had to remove my property  from the market. Based on the way the issue was phrased, feedback from buyers was they assumed the property was riddled with wet rot and had serious damp issues - This  is the main deterrent with my kind of older property- Scotland is not optimal for dry arid conditions and the flat is 120 years old. I believe that this phraseology and the high valuation price (that sat at odds with market forces, other agents views  and pitched my flat well above expectations)  has been THE significant cause of inability to sell my property given perception it would be a financial burden to remediate ( I had two v moderate quotes which could not be acted on whilst it was on the market ). I later had a damp expert examine the property and his view based on 40 years of experience,  was there was no discernable damp (smell touch and visually)  - he could have charged me for work but he as an honest expert didn't feel it was neccessary. His advice was ventilation and possibly a dehumidifier in the depths of winter. There are concerns about property agents utilising high valuation prices to try and achieve high prices but don't lose due to their fees if the property as mine did fails to sell. I spent over ¬£3000 as well as the cost of the survey and the effect on my health has been catastrophic. I don't think Shepherds care nor take any of this on board....money drives everything it seems

Failed to identify copious amounts of asbestos in the house I purchased. Loose asbestos boards were lying around the garden and should have easily been identified by a chartered surveyor in addition to exposed areas within the home. Numerous other inaccuracies in the home report. Unsure what level of visit was made to the property. I was told photos were taken of the areas in question but none could be produced. I found Graeme Stewart, managing partner to be particularly unprofessional and rude in dealing with my complaint. Internal inquiry found no wrong-doing which is hardly unsurprising. Requested information on how to raise my complaint further with ombudsman or regulatory body but communication was ignored.

I have worked professionally with Shepherd Surveyors for 11 years during which time they have carried out over 900 home reports for our clients. I've always found their knowledge, expertise and service to be superb. I would recommend Shepherd Surveyors for carrying out your home report and furthermore should you need a more in depth survey of a property that you intend to buy, which is displaying potential underlying issues, their assessment will be invaluable. Iain IVY
First class service.   Surveyor arrived on time, conducted the survey in a professional manner and my draft report was ready for approval within 24 hours.

Surveyors came out to complete a valuation on my property for a re-mortgage. They were quite rude did not take theirs shoes off and walked all over my cream rugs and bedroom carpet with their muddy shoes on. No offer or apology. Customer service very poor.
I have had an excellent service from Shepherds. Fast turn around and easy to follow instructions to complete necessary online forms. Highly Recommend.

We had Steven visit to give a survey of a property we were about to list for sale. We had already had two agents give us a listing valuation of 220k, we showed Steven one of them.
The survey appeared to go well, Steven said it would be online in 24 to 48 hours. Three days later, after I'd emailed his office only not to receive a response, it eventually appeared with the valuation of just 190k, yes 30k lower than the two estate agents!!! No reason was given in the report, everything was marked 1 apart from two 2's for minor items.
Beware of Steven from Shepherd Chartered Surveyors in Aberdeen.

We had Steven survey our property last week. The appointment was nice and straight forward with no issues at all. Seven was really reassuring and allowed a nice chilled out appointment. We hen received the home report in time to get our house on the market for the weekend which we really hoped for. Massive thanks to Steven and Shepherd's. 100% recommended!
Fantastic customer service from Paul Delaney who went over and above for us today  - helping us to make it all happen for our client at last minute! Highly recommended

Extremely good and professional team. I required an updated survey which was needed in a timely manner to assist with house sale. Kevin Angus was great at fitting me in and processing things quickly. Would highly recommend.

Shepherd did my home report, they came within a day or two to do it very efficient.
The surveyor was very professional and explained everything as he was going along and at the end gave me a valuation .

I‚Äôd just like to pass on my thanks to Alan and Fraser who carried out a single survey on my home yesterday.  They were both very friendly, courteous and professional. They were thorough and efficient and worked to provide their report very quickly ( received today).
The Survpoint portal is so easy to access and navigate with all your information in one place.
Very grateful for an excellent service. I would highly recommend Shepherd Chartered Surveyors East Kilbride.

From first dealings with the company, arranging a suitable time with Linda for the survey, things ran very smoothly.
Linda took into account when would suit us best.
On the day of the survey, Norman arrived on time, was very smart and also pleasant.
The survey was carried out with the minimal disruption to us both and the finished article was  emailed for approval very quickly.
We both appreciate the care taken in dealing with, what has been our family home for 37 years and would not hesitate in recommending the use of Shepherd Chartered Surveyor's.
Thanks to Linda and Norman.

Norman done the survey and home report on our property and couldn‚Äôt have been better.
He is a lovely man, very friendly and excellent at his job.
Only took about 30/40 mins and brought all his own equipment including ladders and was truly no bother, wouldn‚Äôt have known if he was there.
Would recommend him to anyone who is looking for a Surveyors!

I would highly recommend Shepherd Chartered Surveyors. I personally used them to provide my home report to put my property on the market. The estate agent I used put me in touch with them and they were fantastic. Norman came and did the inspection as soon as he could and my home report was complete for me to review the next working day!

I did also phone the office with a query and Linda was fantastic on the phone and very helpful.

Thanks again to Norman and Linda for your quick, professional service. If I require any service you provide in future I will be back!

Jennifer.

Excellent customer service from Shepherd's in East Kilbride.  Linda was great, totally professional and yet friendly at the same time.  The Home Report was carried out promptly and process explained thoroughly, which provided me with considerable comfort having not sold a property in a very long time.  I would not hesitate in using Shepherds again and would recommend them 100%

Update my deposit was returned after a number of emails & several weeks of anxiety. This is my experience they need to be investigated they pull the wool over small sole trading businesses to impress their very rich clients. Please be cautious when taking on any commercial property as they expect you to do major roof repairs, structural work & they keep the small business deposit. Their clients  are multimillionaires & Shepherds encourage it. This is the manky unfit building they allowed me to rent from 2022 which cost ¬£26,208.21p also roof repair ¬£1200, electric repair before entering building was ¬£350. I left a beautiful shop in pristine condition & they still kept my deposit because of a faulty repair they carried out before I moved into the shop in 2022. Plus I paid the insurance on the building at a cost of near ¬£1400 quotes for insurance ¬£160 & ¬£204 they charged ¬£591. Confirmation by email stated no dilapidation but they still withheld my deposit. Hang your heads in shame all that are involved.

Cowboys. Home report completed for the property we purchased missed several very obvious problems. Can only assume they didn't visit the property, or if they did, the surveyor didn't even get out of his vehicle (Porsche). Two years of stress sorting it all out with the ombudsman.
Extremely unprofessional company - they don‚Äôt respond to emails and don‚Äôt disclose basic information regarding sales when requested. Would not want them to sell any properties for me whatsoever

I‚Äôve been looking at the reviews just to see what they‚Äôre like online because I haven‚Äôt heard a good thing about them from anyone in the estate. We have all been talking a lot recently about them, and no one likes them and wants them gone. They rob you of your money with their overcharges. Everyone I‚Äôve told about my charges has said the same thing, they‚Äôre ridiculous. My friend has a new build and he pays a lot less to maintain their grounds. Another friend also pays a lot less, and I‚Äôm talking under ¬£100 with no huge balance. I seriously think they need to be investigated as a company because something is not right. Nearly ¬£4000 for grass cutting seems excessive especially when the job is not done correctly. They also bill you for gardening but the planting is awful. The gardeners were here yesterday and they done nothing which more than just me noticed.The buzzer systems on all flats also don‚Äôt work.

Avoid these crooks like the plague. Do not buy a property that they are factoring. I have attached some photos of the ground currently that have been neglected.

If I could give minus rating I would. Strachur Wharf as its poshly known has a problem with fly tipping at bin store on Strachur Grove. JG put up a camera at residents expense to deter this, spoke with Jordan who is development manager to be told camera is a "dummy" camera and there is nothing further they can do but to contact GCC as it is an environmental issue with leaving items at bin shelter. The residents here in houses pay for their own bulk uplift but are expected to contribute to the communal bin area which we are not "allowed" use as it's sole use is for flats it sits beside.
We pay a quarterly fee to have these clowns "manage" the development and what do we get in return ?? Very little to nothing, an appalling management service which should be avoided !!

I notified the factor about this problem three months ago!!! Water is entering the gas boiler and it is blocking! This morning it was full of water again and I have no heatingüò°üò°üò°Shame on this company!!! The bills are insanely high and we don't get any support! Where is our money going????P.S Your answer is inadequate to say the least! I can see a leak in the gutters and that's where the problem with my water heater comes from! It's impudent of you to write to me that the water heater is not your problemü§®üò°

Absolutely hopeless factors . I've lived at my property for 7 years now . Having to pull my bins through my house, due to other neighbours blocking access to the path with their own bins. Have asked for support from factors to ask if they can remove them . All nice on the phone but have done absolutely nothing to help . Nest time they try to over charge me for other neighbours bulk uplifts I know exactly where I'll be telling them to go . Over charging company with no support at all

I wish there was an option to give zero stars. Absolutely awful service from this company to the point I'm considering legal action. Refuse to complete communal repairs for areas not on your title deeds. They send generic responses when you challenge them on the information they supply that is incorrect. If you can, avoid this company at all costs. The reviews speak for themselves. I think they hope people will roll over and let things go if they ignore the issue long enough but unfortunately for them that won't be happening on this occasion.

Giving James Gibb a One Star review feels generous. From unexpected charges on invoices, to charging very high management fees, no real SLA for resolving issues (they're extremely slow), outrageous building insurance charges, unusually high turnover (11 different property managers in 9 years), no property manager deputies, this has to be one of the worst property factor/management companies in the UK.
No accountability, and zero transparency. They have even been in the news for leaving customers without water for days. They are one of the worst customer facing companies I've ever have to deal with.

Vandalism, drug use, and antisocial behaviour in resident-only areas have been repeatedly reported to the property manager with photo and video evidence. Multiple residents have raised complaints and suggested solutions, yet nothing has been done more than a month later.

James Gibb show no care for their paying customers or their legal responsibilities as a property factor. Their lack of action and poor customer service is on another level of terrible. 1 star is too many.

We are now forced to go through their complaints process which we fully expect to be just as poor.

Diabolical factors. Unprofessional and don't seem to care. Residents don't seem to have an ability to vote on what work is completed. Just feel trapped and extorted. They're holding over ¬£100k of residents money with little to no information when the work will be completed. Overcharged by c.¬£300 in an invoice, amended it - not even an apology. Check your invoices!!!

AVOID AT ALL COST! They deserve a 0 star rating. They are a notoriously bad residential factor, and have even featured in the news because of this. You can check the following article in the Edinburgh Evening News: "Residents in Leith flats left without water for four days after leak in building."

Absolutely the worst property factor I have his the misfortune to be lumbered with.
Communication is woeful, don't reply to emails or return calls.
Costs have tripled on a quarterly basis.
Needless to say,if you can avoid DO avoid.

The worst factor management company I've dealt with in over 25 years. If I could give zero stars I would. They are rude, neglectful, they never take ownership of their own errors and terrible client service. Rarely respond to emails in line with their own terms and conditions and they can't keep staff due to their awful management. Our development has gone downhill since this company took it over. Do not touch them with a bargepole

Awful awful awful. My latest bill is ¬£50 and they haven‚Äôt done any form of maintenance where I live- the grounds haven‚Äôt been handed over yet- but I‚Äôm expected to pay ¬£50 for maintenance and groundswork for a small square of land about half a mile away? I have sent several emails to query this and ask exactly what land they ‚Äúmaintain‚Äù but there‚Äôs been no reply. It‚Äôs always the case of radio silent when I need something but the second they are owed money they are contacting me. They are a complete joke and anyone who works for this horrible company should be ashamed of themselves.

The way these people conduct themselves is shocking, how they keep getting away with ripping people off is beyond me
Ask for a call back, never happens, the woman in accounts has no interest in helping, speaks over you and talks to you like dirt.
I also know for a fact that everyone else in my building is of the same opinion, we need to look at having them removed as our factors at government house.

Lack of professionalism and a level of communication very disappointing. They have no interest in resolving your issues whatsoever. They increasing the fees very often which leads concern about the overall level of service being provided by this company. Avoid any services from James Gibb

If I could give no stars I would. Honestly the worst company we have ever dealt with. Bills turn up late. Bills stating they have done gardening in the winter with frost on the ground. Tried to charge us for gritters when the whole street nobody had seen them. Think we're finally away from them and they are charging us 100 pounds admin fee. They must have the highest paid admins in the whole of the UK. Try everything you can to stay away from these people. For years we have been paying other people's debts and supposedly that is normal

If you‚Äôre considering a new factor, avoid this company at all costs. Extremely poor at property management and communication. Very very good at invoicing though. Not experienced a company this bad for a long time. I suppose the 200+ other public reviews say it all really. For your sanity‚Ä¶avoid. They‚Äôve literally cost us a fortune

Very poor communication, had five development mangers since they took over our property. No tracking system on reporting a fault to its fixing. Invoicing poor with no explanation to additions. They issue newsletters that give high level professional information but the reality at the property level is completely different. Recommending to my fellow development owners to change factor.

Similar to those other reviews we've had an awful time with this company. Their communication is poor and we've been asked for money in the past when it hasn't been due, and they then admit to the mistake when challenged.
For all those that have had enough, there is light at the end of the tunnel as we have finally managed to end our contract with them. It did require a lot of effort from someone in the estate to collect a number of signatures, and despite following the advice set out in the contact, the company did delay ending the contract as they queried the validity of the signatures. During this period the entire estate was invited to attend a meeting at a nice hotel, during rush hour, at the other end of the city to discuss general matters about the estate. That's where their customers money is going! My advice to everyone is to organise and get rid of this shower!

This company is absolutely shocking. They do not reply to emails even from solicitors. You cannot get through on the phone. They bully and demand money where none is due. There is nothing you can do to make contact and discuss issues
. If I could give negative 10 stars I would. Appalling company. God help you if your property comes under their mismanagement. One of the worst companies I have had the misfortune to "try" and deal with.
They should hang their heads in shame.

Scammers. Avoid. Absolutely waste of money and time.
I bought a new build house few years ago at housing estate with around 96 new build houses and now city council adopted most the estate to maintain. James Gibb still have a few meters square of lawn to cut at our estate and they charging us a fortune. We can't get rid of them and its just a pain in a back side
I would agree with all the comments and would highly recommend Jamie. A reliable and professional plumber, he knows his stuff and was prompt and very competitive when we needed a radiator leak fixed.

We‚Äôve called on Jamie repeatedly over the years and have recommended him to friends after he was recommended to us. He‚Äôs brilliant at identifying issues  and coming up with solutions. Nothing is ever a bother for him and no job is too small. He‚Äôs also really efficient, quick to respond, reasonably priced and comes when he says he will! Would highly recommend.

We have always been very pleased with any work we have had done by Jamie McBride plumbing over the years. Jamie is a good communicator and comes when he says he will!  He also comes promptly if the problem is more urgent. He is happy to take on both large and small jobs and he has a pleasant and friendly manner.

Absolutely superb service from Jamie every time. From gas installations to boiler issues to general plumbing, he's done everything on time and with precision and attention to detail. Jamie's a class act. Highest recommendation.

I‚Äôve used Jamie for years and would recommend him to anyone. From a full boiler replacement to regular maintenance and help with minor plumbing issues, he is always quick to respond and does everything to a high standard. Thanks so much üòä

The Southside team was truly professional in helping me secure a perfect flat. The application process was incredibly efficient, and I was always impressed by how promptly the staff responded to my queries. The thoughtful welcome bag on move-in day was also a lovely, unexpected touch!

Their professionalism continued throughout my tenancy and even after I had moved out.I would like to give a special thanks to  Rob McDonald, who was my main point of contact throughout my time with Southside. Most recently, Rob went above and beyond when an Amazon parcel was accidentally delivered to my old address. He stepped in to coordinate communication between myself and the new tenant to find a solution, which took a huge weight off my mind. It is rare to find such dedicated support after a lease has ended. Highly recommended!

I lived in a Southside Property for over 8 years. Throughout that time I have had exceptional service and support. Repairs are easily reported and fixed, visits are well communicated and regular. My property manager was available and quick to respond to any query. With property in Edinburgh being in high demand, Southside are a  trusted brand I would be confident in telling anyone to use.

So far so great! Recently moved into a new place thanks to Southside and they have been great. Gotten a very cute welcome package (never received one with any other housing agent!!), and responses to any problems were solved or communicated quickly! Ione has been a stellar property manager and really appreciate Southside for checking in on us even after our move! (shoutout to Scott!). Great experience.

I've been a tenant in a Southside property for 4 months. Ione has taken care of my account and is absolutely the best! She responds quickly to any inquiry I have and has been so helpful. Would definitely recommend going with Southside. Their professionalism and quick response times make it such a good experience to live in one of their properties.

I‚Äôve had such a great experience with the Southside Property Management team! Moving to Edinburugh from England was a big step, but they made the whole process smooth and welcoming. A huge thank you to Morgan, Aaron, and the entire Southside team for their outstanding service and the lovely welcome gift bag.

I would like to place on record my thanks and gratitude to Becky Mazzarelli, who has been my property manager until very recently. Becky is now moving on to another role within Umega, and I have no doubt will be equally successful in her new venture.
Becky has always been professional, and very helpful with managing my property for me, whilst ensuring my tenant has been well looked after too.
It has been very reassuring to know that my property has been in good hands.
I have always had timely communication, support and advice throughout. I wish Becky all the very best for the future!

I have found working with Umega very straightforward. I moved in with my boyfriend so decided to let out my flat. Kim made everything feel very easy in terms of getting the property ready, and I didn‚Äôt need to worry about a thing.

Claire is my portfolio manager and again everything is very straightforward and communication is excellent.

I have nothing but good things to say about my experience with Umega - from start to finish they have been friendly, professional and easy to work with.
Lydia Keogh has been our agent - she recently inspected our property. She was thorough, friendly, informative and pleasant to work with. All my questions were answered in detail. Excellent service

I moved back to Edinburgh during the Pandemic and found a property through Umega. Ever since the start they have been helpful, approachable, responsive and customer focussed.

The last stint of my tenancy I have had the pleasure to deal with Nora as my Portfolio Manager. She has made that a pleasurable experience.

I can only recommend Umega for the professional approach without losing focus on the people aspect of the letting business!

As a private landlord it all became too much to manage so Suzie Wilson easily onboarded my properties, helped with maintenance, found good tenants and likewise achieved good rents. She really removed all of my stress and I would recommend her highly.

These guys were great start to finish.

They turned up when they said they would, were helpful with ideas and really quick turn around with high levels of workmanship.

We had a full front garden remodel carried out in two days start to finish including laying slabs, building planters, laying turf and planting  amongst gravel beds.

My wife and I are absolutely delighted with the finished product, would use again and highly recommend.

Cheers Steven and team!

Steven and his team were amazing to work with and have transformed our garden from a dated and concrete-filled mess to a stunning garden that we can't wait to be in all summer. Steven's ideas for the paving and advice on stone and pattern were spot on and complement the house and style perfectly. He went above and beyond offering advice and assistance in the garden as well and his team were wonderful - professional, friendly, and talented. We would recommend Steven and his team at John Lessels Landscapes any day and look forward to using them again in the future for our front patio.

This is the second time I have used John Lessels Landscapes.  I am always impressed by their service.  Their team always arrive on time on the date stated.  They are extremely hard working.  Steven has a keen eye for what works in a garden and improved my garden immeasurably.  I wouldn‚Äôt use anyone else.  Barbara Muir, Edinburgh

Absolutely fantastic service, will be recommending them to anyone needing their garden done. Attention to detail was impeccable and such great value for money. I cannot thank you enough - THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!! Before and after don‚Äôt even do it justice!

We have employed the services of John Lessels Landscapes a few times now for different projects and have been happy with the results everytime. They were prompt in their initial response to our enquiry and were able to complete the job we asked for within our timeframe. Polite and professional, highly recommend.

Lomond Letting were amazing with our recent move. Craig and Elizabeth were always on hand to help when ever we had any questions. They kept us in the loop as soon as they had any updates on our application. Would 100% recommend to anyone looking for a reliable letting agent.

Thanks again to the team for helping us find our new home.

Lomond Letting and Craig have been excellent right from the onset keeping me up-to-date with the progress on my letting application. Everything has run smoothly from the contract, moving, deposit and rental payment and attending to minor issues. Great service all round and would recommend them when considering a property in the Dumbartonshire area.

I‚Äôve had such a positive experience with Lomond letting  From the very beginning, the team was friendly, professional, and incredibly helpful. They guided me through every step of the letting process, answered all my questions promptly, and made everything so easy and stress-free.to anyone looking to rent or move ‚Äî you‚Äôll be in great hands! Thank again to Criag and his team.

Fantastic team, I can't praise them enough! Very professional, approachable, friendly and great communication every step of the way!! The best letting agents that I have dealt with by far, going above and beyond all expectations to provide a gold standard service!

Was in the need of a place to rent and on a time limit. Craig and the team were extremely kind, helpful and attentive. They went above and beyond to help me. If I ever need to move again in future they'll be my go-to.
Courteous and professional to deal with
Amazing first class services

Kingdom housing are quite frankly a terrible company to deal with.
I would urge anyone renting through them to research the property they are moving into, specifically the ‚Äònewer‚Äô foundry flats.

There are some dodgy tenants clearly smoking in building and not just cigarettes, multiple complaints been made from all tenants yet nothing is done about it.

They put up our rent recently but what is that being spent on? Certainly not the communal areas. The building hasn‚Äôt even had an entrance door for the past week so flies are flying into the building, the walls and carpets in the corridors mainly the entrance are quite frankly disgusting, why put carpet in an entrance where everyone‚Äôs dirty shoes are walking over, it‚Äôs embarrassing when having visitors. New flooring and walls painted is a bare minimum in the entrance. Cleaner comes once a week but all that appears to be done is hoovering and certainly nothing gets cleaned, residents having to clean the lift ourselves as it‚Äôs revolting.

Put rent up but services going down, it‚Äôs shocking.

We pay for the upkeep of the property outside our house, grass etc but that's all they do, the grass. Bushes and trees are left to grow massively, the trees grow outwards and over the footpaths and we trail bird shit into the house where we have young grandkids, I have asked Kingdom several times if they can trim them to no avail. It's a service we pay for and they are not providing it, absolutely shocking that our grandkids could be playing in bird shit.

Changed my mind about the last reveiw since housing officer was out. They have done almost nothing to help and severely impacted my mental health. Neighbours are allowed a veg patch in communal garden but I'm not. I pay the same rent so should surely be given the same amount of planting space. Have been made to feel like I can't approach kingdom housing for support anymore.

Kingdom has taken over the garden maintenance recently. I would just like to say what a wonderful job they are doing, so much better than previous contractors.
I have found the gardeners easy to approach. They are always happy to help if it is within reason. They take time and take pride in their work, always clean up at the back of them. Always greet you with a smile.
I have also found Michelle very approachable and helpful. If they can help they will.
I hope Kingdom keep doing their own maintenance as they take great pride in their work.
Well done Kingdom, keep up the good work!üëç

Caldwells Court tenant

Just had an email today stating rent is going up by 7%! Every year there is an increase.
Based on the monthly rate of the property when I moved in Dec 2019 it came with fitted carpets and blinds.
Will Kingdom be upgrading the flooring anytime soon? The only difference between my property ( Mid-Market) and social
Housing list, is the flooring, blinds being installed which was  included in price of rate.  I would have rather had no flooring and put my own flooring in and blinds.
Can Kingdom Initiatives tell me  if flooring will be renewed at any point? Kingdom are putting in increases every year to Tenants, I would expect some sort of upgrade.
Let me know your thoughts Kingdom, Thank
You.
Mr Weir

I used to get support from Kingdom support and care 2 years ago and the staff for the Kirkcaldy area have always been very friendly and helpful I have also requested self referred long term support from them from them as before it was short term I was quite gutted when my support was stopped when I was homeless years before that back when I was 18 the Dunfermline team on the homeless part had treated me bad but the Kirkcaldy service have always been kind and considerate and helpful and very respectful toward me which I‚Äôm grateful for .I refuse to have any other support than kingdom and kingdom is the reason my life has had a slight improvement to it in some ways they‚Äôve no idea .I‚Äôm more than happy to have self referred back to kingdom just hopping that I can get things sorted to get support set up again because kingdom when I had support from them they are the reason I was starting to improve mentally and going out more but when my support was stopped I was back at square one and physically I still have limited mobility especially due to my weight but when kingdom support me I feel it helps me feel more confident in managing my anxiety‚Äôs when shopping because when I‚Äôm shopping and they‚Äôre there supporting me I‚Äôm less anxious it‚Äôs the same with appointments they‚Äôve really made a difference unlike support workers I had long before them who were terrible .I highly recommend anyone to self refer or get assessed for long term do what you can because other support services in fife area I will not give names have been quite unreasonable and unfair and disrespectful kingdom i can promise has been by far the best .If I don‚Äôt get support from kingdom again I will keep self referring as I don‚Äôt give up that easily, I need support because I struggle on the daily basis and understanding things and need prompting with things social work don‚Äôt refer me for long term so I can only help myself by self referring
As it has help5 me in every way and staff have been very helpful in helping me out with anything and everything I have went through...
KSC outstandingly professional, nothing is to much bother .

A sex worker was given written permission by Langstane to use the flat above me as premises for her work. The Director of Housing, Judith Sutherland, who has since "taken early retirement", informed me in writing that she had given permission and, since then, I have had to hear obscene noise every day which means I cannot have visits from my family. I believe I'm right to consider the decision to allow it to be vindictive and shameful. And a senior staff member advised me to get some friends to beat up a problem neighbour who had mental health problems - absolutely disgusting. The Director of Housing breached my statutory right to repairs under Housing Scotland Act 2001 by restricting my contact to emergencies only because I kept reporting drug dealing and aggression. "In Scotland, tenants have the right to report issues with their landlord in writing, including matters like repairs, access, or complaints." The Association also has fake reviews from employees. Three similarly worded recent positive reviews, all posted on the same date, are from an employee and her mother. A new positive review is from another Langstane employee whose position in the Association can easily be found online. Another new review is from the father of another employee. This has been reported to Google. They really are worried about accurate reviews from tenants. The government is likely to intervene. Not before time.

Absolutely appalling housing association! After almost 5 years of being their tenant and utterly unbearable antisocial behaviour, drug issues and junkies, I‚Äôm finally moving out. The best thing I am ever doing. Being there tenant has SERIOUSLY effected my mental health. They do not care about issues and have never ever sorted it. They do not care about tenants only their rent. I‚Äôm over the world to be leaving them and urge anyone not to go with them. They don‚Äôt even deserve a star. I‚Äôve been through absolute hell!
they are installing rigged thermostats for tennants so they would have to pay more. 100% have shady contracts with heatcare because they are doing lansgtanes dirty job

This is hands down the worst landlords in Glasgow I was with them for 10 years and the house was abysmal it had single glazing windows with black mould on the frames I brought this to the attention of the association but all I got was an anti fungal paint which done nothing I also informed them of the water that was leaking through the seems and flooding the window area nothing was ever done about that the boiler never worked properly and had to be repaired no less that 5 times a year I complained and asked for an up to date boiler never happened they promised double glazing windows and continueusly moved there schedule saying at first I was in phase 4 then phase 6 and finally phase 7 during lockdown my bay window ceiling collapsed destroying my tv and nearly my terrapins tank because there was a leak in the brick work their idea of a repair was to staple a shower a curtain to the inside of the building the plasterboard it up which didn't happen till 6 months after the incident I asked for them to replace my tv because I had already complained about the water going and they tried to get me to claim it back on my insurance i told them there were responsible for not acting when i first asked for the repair to be carried out and then accused me of not being available when their repair team called it was during lockdown.  Anyone thinking of renting from these clowns look elsewhere the staff are useless cheeky arrogant pathetic people that will do anything to not repair their properties and my personal opinion is the reason for this lack of care for their Tennants is that the government funding that was given to them specifically for double glazing and up to date boilers has been misappropriated in some way because the government funding was more than enough to get all afore mentioned work done 5 years ago

If I could give Loretto minus 5 I would. Where to begin? Close area is unkempt and untidy. On several occasions there has been  excrement all over the inside of the building. The lift constantly. Unfurnished stair Wells that are unsafe. There is also a number of issues with some of tenants behaviours and how they look after the close and act in general. If you work or have kids I would not recommend staying here. The flats themselves are not up to basic health and safety requirements. Mould, damp, wet electrics. Tried to relay these issues to the current housing officer. I have been ignored totally. As soon as we mentioned the electrics as a standard and unacceptable risk she blanked us. Wheatly homes have us that it was logged as we were cheeky towards her. Fabrications like this when there are children in my house that we Do not let use light switches is crazy. Other neighbours houses are in similar state. Between this and so.e neighbours thinking they can live there lives however they want when there working families and children.

I could not recommend Lorimer House highly enough.
Thanks again to all the staff, carers and nurses.

This review is reluctantly posted after months of documented failures and a complete breakdown in trust between them and residents. Common areas and perimeter grounds have not been maintained to acceptable standards. They have applied questionable communal charges, which remain unresolved numerous months after being disputed. Repeatedly found to be Incapable of communicating within reasonable time, often taking several weeks or longer to respond to serious matters and only after being pursued for responses - ignoring or failing to respond to residents appears to be a common custom and practice. Meetings have been repeatedly promised that failed to materialise. After constantly over-promising and under delivering on all fronts, they‚Äôre abandoning the development while blaming residents for their own shortcomings (gaslighting) and charging each resident a ¬£50 exit fee in the process while simultaneously refusing to coordinate a handover to alternative factors. It‚Äôs hard to distinguish whether this company is incompetent or wilfully negligent. A disaster from start to finish. I expect an excuse-laden deflective response to follow below.

We‚Äôre genuinely grateful for their hard work and would highly recommend Yates Hellier to anyone looking to sell. An amazing team and a truly exceptional service.

I came to know about this agency through a recommendation from a waiter at a caf√© who I told I was looking for a flat in Glasgow. When I visited their website I found a property I liked and so I contacted the agency and arranged a viewing -so far all is normal.

Adding more references the next day.The agent Andy promised to get back to us the next day. This is where the story ends. The receptionist seems very uninterested and don't seem to know much about the procedures - we were connected away from her almost every time we called to ask questions about the reference papers.

FORTUNATELY during this very stressful time of waiting for a call back we went online and looked for reviews of this agency. After not finding one single good review about Macfie and co we decided to go for another agency and flat. We are very happy with this choice as Andy or another representative from the agency, weeks later, STILL has not contacted us as they promised......

Lesson learned: Always do research on the services you are going to buy before buying.

I rented a property that was listed as ‚Äúsecure entry intercom‚Äù. Well, in five years of asking for the front door lock to be secured and the intercom system to be fixed, they panned me off. Only when my member of parliament contacted Environmental Health, did they send someone to clean the debris. In less than 12 hours of the Scottish Rent increase cap freeze being removed, I got a rent increase notice of 11.3%. So I gave my notice to move out citing all of the reasons.
