The OHAL building is easy to get to. You can access it's non-wheelchair accessible entrance from Victoria Street or the wheelchair accessible entrance from Junction Road. All the staff in there are very helpful and friendly. There are large ground floor interview rooms.
They helped me get away from finstown to shapinsay
Very good
FABULOUS PLACE TO VISITÔºå THE ALBERT HOTEL IN KIRKWALL IS IN MY HUMBLE OPINION IS BY FAR THE BEST PLACE TO BASE YOURSELF AS EVERYTHING IS GOOD ABOUT ITÔºå
Very good
Nice and almost hidden place. Perfect surrounding for a dog walk or a small hike. The small mountain near by offering a look over Glasgow

What A Fantastic Place Hidden In West Dumbarton With Some Fantastic Masonry Work And This Building Goes To Show Some Of Scotlands History And Folklore . A Great Spooky Vibe As This Won't Be A Place I Forget Soon Because Of It's Size And Spooky Features
Stunning building with a lot of history. We popped in to the tea rooms and they were kind enough to provide take away coffees and drinks, all at a very affordable price. Thank you
Great area for a walk, long or short! Free car parking and clearly marked paths. Popular with dog walkers and horses.

We visited this place during the week in October.  Unfortunately,  the House was closed but we could still go for a walk. You can choose from different routes on the hill. Great wee walk. Make sure you have waterproof boots on if you visit after a rainy day as some places can be muddy. Great view of the Clyde.

Will leave the most vulnerable in flats with mould and drown your downstairs neighbour with floods, then theyll only fix it after 4 years of battling it out. They wont fix any structural issues in the communal hallway instead just painting over it in deep red and paint your door in it too over 3 days. Who knew it could take 3 days to paint a door!! The level of quality is unbelievable, awful place ran by people who just dont care, shame the homeless have to deal w this as theyd be grateful for the nonsense the housing gives

My personal experience of dealing with this organisation isn't very good. I would strongly suggest that if you reside in a council house then you don't waste your time applying. Don't waste your time applying if are in work. Paisley south housing association specialises in providing 2nd homes to junkies and alcoholics. That's why when you drive up neilston rd at night there is hardly any lights on in the flats

Terrible no stars if it was an option
Lazy, take no action, allow tenants to run riot destroying council property, refuse to take action on problem tenants, would not recommend, unless your a huge problem tenant that wants an easy time then apply here
Ran by complete amateurs from top to bottom.unhelpful staff  that only tell you what they can't do instead of what they can do for you .worst customer service around , avoid at all cost please
I can't believe they've kicked me in the teeth again üòï I'm not taking this lying down..... I an taking this further

The Paisley Property Maintenance guys are fantastic.  Always good quality work, reliable, helpful and just really good people to deal with.  They fitted a new bath and shower unit for me and I was really pleased with the quality of their work, and they were there on the dot to the minute they said they were arriving.  Having now used their service a number of times, I recommend them, and they will always be my go to service when I need repairs or improvements to the house.

Neil, Dene, Benji, and Joe renewed all of the bathrooms in our house. All done with no fuss and without disruption to our home. The job was perfect, and as I know Neil, I managed to get 'mates' rates! However, even if you don't know Neil personally, you will still receive great value for your money and a high-quality finish.
Very very reliable and lovely, helpful guys.  Have used a couple of times now and would absolutely recommend.

I feel I need to share that I‚Äôm currently being harassed by Rentahome. I was 1 month behind on rent due to dealing with bereavement, when I got back I communicated the date when the 1-month rent arrears would be cleared and that I would continue to pay as normal to bring everything up to date. First, they started with the constant emails asking me to phone in the office. I have told them my mental health has been affected but they do not care. After many emails asking to phone the office, they decided to try to ask to inspect the property after their scare tactics did not work. It's like talking to a wall!  I hope the landlords who are trusting this agency to manage their tenants are aware of how they are treating people. Disgusting. Keep in mind only 1 month behind rent! I have offered to clear the arrears and pay the current month‚Äôs rent. This agency does NOT follow the law of allowing tenants to have quiet enjoyment. Any inspections must be agreed upon by both parties but they think their scare tactics will get you to agree to being harrassed and unreasonable inspection requests after I just told them I am struggling with mental health after bereavement. They do not care!
Quick and efficient the only draw back I will say is u need to check your flat when u rent cause there might be discrepancies with the cleanliness issues.

Helped me move through lockdown into one of the nicest flats I could have wished for! Fantastic quality home, amazing customer service and support! Any issues they get back straight away and they have a list of helpful numbers for out of hours work! Would recommend as the best agency in Paisley I've experience so far! Thank you Rentahome!

Returned keys for a woman I met outside after they told her to return keys by 12:00 on a Saturday. They were closed so I offered to return the keys as she lived an hour's drive away.
When I returned the key on Monday morning they refused to give me a receipt for receiving the keys. Unprofessional, both for not being open when they told the woman they would be open and unprofessional for not just scribbling a receipt.

I feel compelled to share the full extent of their unprofessionalism and disregard for tenants. Not only did they make baseless claims to charge me for redecoration expenses related to an upstair neighbor's water leak stain on the ceiling, but they also attempted to charge me for overall repainting and cleaning. When confronted with evidence proving that the stain was caused by the neighbor's property and not my responsibility, they changed their narrative, accusing me of unauthorized painting using non-neutral colors.

To further illustrate their incompetence, they even used a walk-in inventory report from a completely different property with a different address, wrongly claiming it as evidence against me. Fortunately, I had the original walk-in report of the correct property, complete with pictures taken by Rentahome themselves, showing no changes whatsoever. It's astonishing that Rentahome would go to such lengths to fabricate claims, hoping that a favor adjustment would work in their favor through My Deposit Scotland. My Deposit Scotland ruled in my favor, recognizing the agency's unjust attempts to withhold my deposit. It was a relief to have an impartial third party acknowledge Rentahome's wrongdoing and validate my claims.

What makes this situation even more infuriating is the fact that I had gone above and beyond as a tenant by finding a new tenant to take over the apartment, without charging any fees to Rentahome. Instead of appreciating my efforts and ensuring a fair return of my deposit, they attempted to exploit the situation and make unwarranted deductions.

My experience with Rentahome has been nothing short of a nightmare. Their dishonesty, lack of integrity, and disregard for tenants' rights is absolutely appalling. I strongly caution anyone considering renting from Rentahome to think twice and look elsewhere for a reputable property management company that values their tenants and conducts business ethically.

Response to the reply: There is nothing to discuss about it. It‚Äôs still shameful that not even an apology hasn‚Äôt been given.

We have just sold our property through LM Properties Paisley. The team at LM Properties (Robert , Craig and Brooke) are all very friendly and approachable. Nothing was a bother to them. They done a first class job and dealt with things in a professional manner, they phoned us  immediately with updates or any relevant information. We would not hesitate to use them again in the future and would highly recommended them to anyone who needs this kind of service. Thank you

LM Properties are really a great firm.  They are like a small and family-run business (although they are not family).  They are always professional, really on the ball, and extremely helpful.  I have worked with them for over 10 years as a property owner, and I have no hesitation in recommending them as a letting agent - both to owners and to tenants.
Fantastic firm. Have worked with them for over 20 years as a landlord. No regrets. Thoroughly recommend to tenants and owners for their professionnalisme, knowledge-base and all-found friendliness.
Excellent communication and very professional. I would highly recommend LM Properties if you have a property to rent.

We have used LM properties for several years as our letting agent but have recently used them to sell a property. The charges were clearly laid out and they did an excellent job in promoting the property and achieving a sale within one week of listing it. Would highly recommend the team at LM for your next property you want to let or sell.

Excellent experience, professional, kept informed and updated all the way through the process.  Thorough with excellent attention to detail.  Have happy tenants with a good match to the property.  Highly recommend Katie and Pax Property Ltd, Katie really cares about what she does and is a credit to her industry.

Pax Property Ltd is an excellent company to deal with.  I organised a company let for three of my employees and the service from Pax has been faultless.  Katie the director is obviously very experienced in this sector and knows the market well.  Thank you.
Hard working agent with a lot of experience and knowledge of the local area. Would highly recommended

Fantastic business, highly recommend!

I recently purchased 6 properties through Walmac. Everything was laid out in a very detailed and professional manner. Followed by thorough and prompt communication throughout the purchasing process.

Also, fantastic project management of a refurb on one of the properties after purchase.

We are looking forward to working with Walmac again on our next purchases.

Easy to deal with, I was given regular updates on the status of sale, they performed a Christmas miracle of finding a last minute replacement buyer as the original pulled out. Happy with service and fair valuation on my flat.

A fantastic individual, he couldn't of done more to help if he tried. Incredibly informative, optimistic every step of the way, and honest up front. What more would you want from someone who was in charge of renovating your property.

Plans to work with him again in future have already been spoken about.
Garry is truly one of the best. Knowledgeable, hard working, refines each property for a specific need. Cannot recommend him enough. Has literally been a game changer for me.
When we were selling a tenanted property we used Gary at Walmac Property. Gary was available throughout the whole process. Cannot recommend Walmac enough.

Excellent communication. Very friendly. No problems with getting the whole deposit back.

I have rented a house with them for 3.5 years. I recommend Robertson Property Management!

An overall decent letting agency severely let down by attempts to scam us and other tenants out of deposits.

We rented with RPM for two years, and throughout that had no real issues. Most issues we brought up got passed straight to the landlord who solved them promptly, and the letting agency were fast to respond and easy to communicate with.

When we decided to move out we were warned by a friend who had rented with them recently that they would try to come for our deposit on baseless grounds - in my friends case they initially tried to take his whole deposit before backing down to a still absurd ¬£80 each when they challenged their claims.

Sure enough, shortly after moving out we were hit with a huge list of claims relating to cleaning, repairs and even removal of items that previous tenants had left in the flat. After we challenged the claims and demanded proof, we received a set of photos covering two of the flat's four rooms and about a third of the points they raised. We again challenged them, and eventually received the photos taken in the inspection before we moved in, which were of a laughable quality and completely confirmed every point we had been making about the state of the flat when we moved in. At this point they gave up.

The degree of incompetence and either apathy or malignance that the agency handles the inspection process with is frankly astonishing. I don't have enough evidence to confidently say that they have a pattern of preying on students but it seems likely. It's regrettable that this spoiled an otherwise decent letting experience.

I've had an incredible experience with this landlord and could not recommend Robertson Property enough!
I was put into an unfortunate circumstance some years ago and Robertson Property done everything they could to find me a property within my budget and support me during a very stressful time.
They responded quickly to any queries or issues I had and have been fantastic and friendly throughout the 7 years I have rented with them.

Having transferred from a poor letting agency, I feel qualified and confident to recommend Robertson Property Management, as a highly efficient and reliable company with a good knowledge of property and the market both generally and locally. The staff are friendly and approachable while skilled and business-like. Basically they get the job done.
Well done and thank you.

Excellent experience, application process was very fast. No issues whatsoever. I was always informed of any work going on several days in advance via email and they were more than fair when it came to the return of my deposit. Would absolutely let from them again and would recommend them to anyone.

Had nothing but problems in bathroom with leaks and blockages since we moved into our house 3 years ago. Resulted in our whole bathroom being replaced by a team of incompetent clowns who left us without washing facilities for 3 full days during the process despite being told this wouldn't be the case before the work started. The problems now are worse than ever and today the toilet started pissing out rancid sewage from the pipe at the back and seven hours later it is still not fixed despite being told it would be fixed in 2 hours max.

Moved here in March it was a mutual exchange after moving in the repairs were done house and garden all decorated garden cleaned and on its was too I'm absolutely delighted to have exchanged now certainly was hard work but so worth the blisters sweat and tears now.  Lovely landlords very approachable repairs can be a bit slow due to trades people outwith paragons control

Very poor service, lack of action in regard to a boundary fence which they are responcable for. To date 4 people have looked at the fence and when I rang the last person to see it has to look at it again. I was given an appointment time and date that the person was to visit and talk to me, and surprise they didn't turn up, and when I phoned it had been cancelled. Very poor communication and responsibility for what they are responsible for.

Tried several times to pay a bill over the phone.  I and to dial a second number, was on hold for ages then it went to an answer machine.  I didn't leave a message as I work in a school and cannot take calls.  A bit unfair that you cant pay a bill but will be charged for a reminder letter.

Spoke to a lady on the phone about my housing application, very friendly and polite .. Have heard they are a good housing association to be with ao really hoping they can help me get back to living close to Family by offering a house.  Fingers crossed .

Well managed? We have had water coming through our bathroom ceiling for 6hours now. This was reported to your ‚ÄòEmergency Call Centre‚Äô who are completely incompetent at dealing with an emergency issue. After chasing this up three times tonight I have now had a call saying this is now not being attended tonight.

The water has been turned off now to try reduce the damage to our property. However, this has left not only us but 5 other properties without running water heating and even a flushing toilet.

Total disgrace of a company and have never had a single good experience with Park Property Management in the 5 years living here.

This review is reluctantly posted after months of documented failures and a complete breakdown in trust between them and residents. Common areas and perimeter grounds have not been maintained to acceptable standards. They have applied questionable communal charges, which remain unresolved numerous months after being disputed. Repeatedly found to be Incapable of communicating within reasonable time, often taking several weeks or longer to respond to serious matters and only after being pursued for responses - ignoring or failing to respond to residents appears to be a common custom and practice. Meetings have been repeatedly promised that failed to materialise. After constantly over-promising and under delivering on all fronts, they‚Äôre abandoning the development while blaming residents for their own shortcomings (gaslighting) and charging each resident a ¬£50 exit fee in the process while simultaneously refusing to coordinate a handover to alternative factors. It‚Äôs hard to distinguish whether this company is incompetent or wilfully negligent. A disaster from start to finish. I expect an excuse-laden deflective response to follow below.

PPM took over the factor management of the new build estate a live on. We never got anything to set up a direct debit with them we then received an unnecessarily aggressive letter saying we had missed a payment and were being billed with a late fee. A bill of which we're yet to receive a original invoice of. We called it was paid and the late fee was waved but no less than 6 months we have another late payment letter without an original invoice?
Abysmal service

My property is managed by Park PM, unfortunately, Park PM have been extremely unresponsive and even when they do respond, it is not a full and complete reply.

I had emailed enquiries regarding the charges incurred since January 2025 and have been chasing the Finance team multiple times via email. Called them and said they will get back to me, 3 weeks later still zero response. Called them again this week and said staff on holiday (really ? since January ?)  and will reply the next day.

Surprise surprise, I didn't get any reply the next day. Incompetent, unprofessional. Paul McDermott, if you are reading this, get a grip. The owners have already had a video call with yourself in the past year and these same exact issues were communicated to yourself but nothing has changed since.

This has been the worst property management company I‚Äôve ever had to deal with. Unfortunately, I am not in control of the contract for the residential area where I live. It is deeply frustrating to pay them each month, knowing how poor their customer service is and how consistently they fail to address even the most basic issues in the communal areas they are responsible for. Truly disgraceful.

Second time I've tried to get a foodbank code from them. Last time i got no call back at all and I'm needing to try and chase them this time. I'm going to make a complaint if they don't get back to me today. They shouldn't be authorised to give these codes out if they don't get back to people. If you are stuck and need a foodbank I'd suggest calling citizens advice or a social worker. Going through parkhead housing is just more stress on top of stress

Update. Tried to get a code again today and again got nothing. Food banks are for emergency food. Absolute shambles. Making a complaint
Terrible experience especially after burglary, they have mess in the office, they are aware of situation but doesn't let know and not feeling guilty at all
So far so good, nothing was imposed on us as partners of this association. Hope it stays like that.

Staff friendly n went I
Went theyve always been very helpfull
Very friendly and helpful staff offering a fantastic service to Tenants and Community

My mother died of cancer 4 years ago, after which I succeeded to the tenancy. Rather than treat this terrible event with professionalism, empathy and understanding, PHA have instead caused nothing but stress and hassle ever since. When I initially applied to them for a transfer to rebuild my life after the death of my mother, their first step was to attempt to blackmail me into paying for the cost of an entire kitchen unit because of a superficial blemish on a 12 year old worktop, which they falsely accused my late mother of having damaged. Since then they have forced me to live with pests, to the detriment of my health and personal belongings, and which has now caused me to have to live with bare and cold plywood flooring. I've had to live with recurring black mould because their maintenance staff have been incapable to treating it properly. When their supposedly new windows were not weather tight, it took multiple visits for them to solve it. I have had to put up with chronic and excessive noise from multiple different sources. I have a diagnosed disability which affects my capacity to live as normal in the property. PHA have shown complete disregard for this despite intervention from my GP, and have withdrawn my medical transfer points. I live alone in a large 2 bedroom property which could be better suited to the homeless families languishing on their waiting list. Yet they have scuppered any realistic chance of me obtaining a transfer, while their management encourage me to vacate to an unaffordable private let - that is their approach to allocation of limited housing resources. This is not the half of what I have experienced from them. Their housing officers behave like debt collectors who are not remotely interested in helping tenancy issues. Their management, specifically their Operations Director, have done nothing but invalidate and deny my point of view as a rent paying tenant, and have otherwise engaged in gaslighting, denial and accusations. This is their conduct in the aftermath of a terminal illness towards a surviving family member. They preach about quality housing, yet deem it acceptable for a disabled tenant to have to live with pests, mould, noise and bare floors. Absolutely dreadful.

applied for partick housing, got 4 kids wife mental health not great, receptionist was good but there were 2 ladies who were not very friendly they asked me too many daft questions, as my application was a joint one, they have refused to take my wife as part of application refused to accept medical form, they advised me partick is a small area look for a bigger house somewhere else! I was raging, not happy with the service.
Extremely ill-mannered, anti-social, rude, and conspiratorial. Particularly disappointed that a family tragedy prompted not a single shred of concern or understanding. Dreadful people.

Worst housing association around Georgina Kent & ms mchouchon are running the place to suite themselves mainly ms Kent & if you have an opinion or speak up against the way she runs things she tries to silence you with almost bully tactics like threating you with losing your tenency & when you have a complaint about ms Kent it goes to miss mchouchon & the complaints disappear so I've asked to speak with Mr McKenzie CEO he's to big to speak with me & according to miss Kent & miss mchouchon I can't speak to anyone above them on the CHAIR & also miss Kent thinks it's ok to visit your property when you've asked her not to & proceeded to make myself & family unwelcome & telling us it's there property they can basically do what they want & miss mchouchon on a recorded call told me PHA members  can come to my property at Anytime & ask people in my property to identify themselves they think there lanyard badge makes them some sort of force please do not let these people away with this contact your local MP & Scottish public ombudsman & seek legal advice if need be stay well clear of this association

Totally fraudulent company trying to get money from the owners for works which have not been done nor properly tendered for. No property management and constant errors being made. Got charged ¬£144 for an electrician to attend site for 5 minutes to look at a repair and no repair was subsequently done - took over 2 months for them to get a price from the same electrician for what the repair would cost! Disgusting.

Keynorth have been providing building consultancy services to McIntyre PC for several years. They are a pleasure to deal with, always professional, fair and reliable. We would highly recommend Stephen and his team to all prospective suppliers and clients.
Very professional, experienced firm, and excellent client service and I have no hesitation in referring to my clients, Stephen makes their life easy!
Fantastic team led by Stephen, worked with them well over a year, great service, very responsive and always willing to go the extra mile!
Have known Stephen for a number of years and wouldn't hesitate to recommend his services to anyone looking for property management advice or assistance.

Have been working closely with Stephen from McIntyre property consultants for several years. Have had an excellent experience to date. They are incredibly helpful, responsive and prompt in all property related matters, and have substantial expertise within the industrial and retail property sectors. Have conducted many freehold transactions via themselves as well as rental/lease transactions on commercial investment properties. Fees are also competitive which always helps.

As a professional estate agent who specialises in selling tenanted property, I regularly deal with letting agents. I have to say, in the time that I been dealing with Pavillion Properties I have been extremely impressed with every aspect of how they manage their landlords' properties and their helpfulness when it comes to working with our company for the transferring information. They go above and beyond, incredible levels of professionalism, and are some of the most hardworking letting agents I have come across in the  whole of Scotland.
I have no hesitation in recommending them to any landlord in the Dundee area looking for the best property manager.

I noticed that a property was marked as "Just Added" on Zoopla. The first issue arose when I called Pavillion at 10:26 am to ask about a viewing. The woman on the phone didn‚Äôt even allow me to finish my sentence or mention the address before interrupting me and saying, "book the viewing online." I then took the afternoon off work to travel from Arborath to Dundee for a viewing at 2:15 pm. The gentleman who was there to show me the property informed me that he wasn‚Äôt the letting agent and didn‚Äôt know the answers to the two questions I had; he advised me to speak to the letting agent. I liked the flat, so I submitted my application at 2:56 pm. However, I received an email at 3:45 pm (not even a courtesy call) stating that "the property has not long gone under offer." Between the person who showed me the flat and the agent I spoke to on the phone after receiving the email, all they had to say was, "it isn‚Äôt me that is dealing with it."

If I were a landlord seeking Pavillion to manage my property, I would look elsewhere. If they can‚Äôt even manage basic communication with each other and handle viewings for a flat that is already taken, it raises concerns.

As a potential tenant, I would also consider other options. If they are unaware of which flats have been taken, how can they be expected to handle maintenance issues effectively?

This is for Callum
He's proved to be a very good project manager.
He managed major upgrades to our tenement building, all of which have improved the living conditions for the tennants, the improvement of the building structure and the desirability of the flats from a point of view if selling and or renting.
Thank you üòä

Thoroughly impressed with Pavillion, particularly the professionalism, knowledge and guidance from Sally who managed the refurb. The 2 bed flat was renovated and tenant in place within 5 weeks. Sally kept me updated every step of the way. I‚Äôm happy to recommend and use Pavillion again in the future.

I rent from Pavilion, and I‚Äôve had an excellent experience so far thanks to Sean, who manages the property I‚Äôm in. From the beginning, he‚Äôs been incredibly helpful and responsive, usually getting back to me the same day or the next.

As an international student, finding housing was overwhelming, but Sean made the process much easier. He was kind and accommodating, even meeting me at the property with the keys when I moved in and taking the time to show me how everything in the house works. (It would have been difficult for me to get the keys from the office with all my moving bags in tow from the airport, so this was a big help)

When I‚Äôve needed repairs, they were handled quickly, so far they‚Äôve all been handled by the next day, and the contractors Sean arranged were efficient, punctual, and professional.

I feel very fortunate to have Sean as a property manager because, in my experience, many property management companies like Pavillion focus only on the landlord, not the tenant. I have not really interacted with anyone else at Pavillion, and I know I probably just got lucky, so my review is mostly to give credit to Sean who has been very fair and supportive. I‚Äôm really grateful for his assistance and the positive experience so far.

If I choose to move after my program, I‚Äôll keep renting from Pavillion as long as he‚Äôs there.

Fantastic place for your kid's.
Amazing memories of growing up in Oxgangs in the 70's, spending every day of the school holidays from Hunter's Tryst and Firrhill school's.
It used to cost 2p to get in and it was big John Spence, that ran it ?
You played football, table tennis, there was a wee tuck shop, my Mum got her hair done there ( her perm ).
Played for their fitba team, home games at the crappy pitches at Colinton Mains, with the changing rooms in a wooden hut, with everyone smoking fags ( 10 regal small )
I'm so glad, it's still there, striving.
If the kid's can take half the memories and happy time's we all had, it will stick with them forever.
Brilliant place for the "young uns" !
Colourful character's went there like "Midge, Stevie Devine, Dougie Begbie, McGinn, all great guys, until they asked to borrow your Adidas Sambas to play long shots on the floory bit for football.
Great time's.
Wish you all the best.

Great place ...staffed by nice folks who want to help their community. My 5yr old went to the Halloween party and loved it. He thinks I should put kisses on here
So here you go xxxxxxx

Born and bred in sunny Oxgangs in 1964 and from about 8yrs old, spent many many happy times at the " Commy Centre " !
I remember big John Spence, whom ran it for years.
Played for your footy team !
Brilliant place to spend all your school holidays in ! ( 2p to get in )
I hope the centre is doing well and hope for the best for the future, for you all !
Highly recommend any parents to get their kids going here !
Yep, great memories of a great place !!

From Alex Le Grice

Having dealt with many property management firms before, I can say that TCF stands out for their transparency, ethics, and genuine communication. There‚Äôs no sales jargon or empty promises ‚Äî they explain everything clearly and always deliver on what they say.
I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend TCF to anyone looking for a trustworthy property management company. In fact, I‚Äôd be more than happy to be their unofficial ambassador and spread the good word!

I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews but I‚Äôve never experienced worse customer service than I have from Redpath Bruce - to the point I no longer feel safe in my property, avoid them at all cost.

Firstly you‚Äôll have to wait at least two weeks for any response from them, no efficiency or customer care whatsoever.

If i could give zero stars, I would. Redpath Bruce "manage" the shared spaces in a development where I own a house. Would have given zero stars had that been an option.  Inept, lazy, uncommunicative, & absent are 4 words that spring to mind when I think about this company. Our business has successfully been a client of Redpath Bruce‚Äôs for many years.   Customer care and diligence is consistently delivered across all instructions we have worked with them on. We took on Sentry to replace our old factor and couldn't be happier. Excellent engagement and open communication. Actively seeks positive change if needed, and seeks to cut costs that are reflected back to all of us. Highly recommended!

I highly recommend Sentry as a new and better type of factor. We recently had an emergency with the carpark gates not opening  needless to say myself and my neighbours in panic mode unable to get our cars out and go to work.our Factors Sentry property had one of their guys out from as early as 8.30am the young man in question gave his name as Sheraz very polite and friendly he was there for the full day helping all the residents effected reset there fobs and allocate new ones .I was personally very impressed with Sentry and their approach to resolve the issue until the gates were fixed by the engineer.well done Sentry and the young man who was there in the front line the whole.

Can't fault Sentry at all. They (and in particular Gary Russell) were always very proactive, communicative, and accomodating in my experience.

Whenever I had a query I recieved a response same day and the issue was usually resolved not too far beyond that, a huge step up from the previous factor. Were I to move and find my building being managed by Sentry I'd be really pleased.

Gary Russell and the Sentry team have worked wonders since taking over the factoring out the Plaza Development. Many historical issues have now been resolved and they are working their way to ensuring the the longevity of the development by putting plans and schedules in place for ongoing, short, medium and long term work. Very easy to work with, very pleasant and professional. 4 stars as there us always some room for improvement in every walk of life.

Our building moved to Factors Direct a little over a year ago. Consistently good communication. Happy with the service I‚Äôve received.

I am so happy our tenement switched to Factors Direct! They are a vast improvement on our previous factors. Their service is personal and they are quick to respond to requests and emails. I am delighted with the sub contractors they use for the garden and close and all the costs are reasonable too.

Used to be with Ross and Liddell in our old property moved to new house where factors direct were factors and we can honestly say they have been brilliant one phone call and the problem is fix within a few days with top quality tradesmen, we do highly recommend Factors Direct they do what they say

Changing factors , I was told, isn't easy.  Wrong - it was way harder.

Factors direct have been excellent so far, really glad we made the switch to them this year, they were so helpful during this process as well. Recommended!

Moved into a flat after seeing it had a good factor in place. Our experience with T&M in our estate in Beith has been decent. I'm giving them 5 stars, however, because
Of our Property Manager Rachel Melville. Since she's taken over things have been much smoother and we feel any issues we've had have been quickly resolved. Thanks Rachel!

We lived in a property factored by Taylor & Martin for six years. We found the company to be professional and proactive. Our property manager Rachel Melville is extremely knowledgeable of tenements and the nuances of conservation area buildings, and is passionate about keeping these old properties in running order, while preserving historical character. Our property required some work and Rachel was very kind and understanding about the impact sudden costs were on the owners, ensuring everyone was up-to-date via regular homeowners meetings and frequent email correspondence. When we came to sell our flat, the positive home report was a reflection on the upkeep of the entire property, which is testament to Rachel and her dynamic approach. Rachel is a genuine, determined and articulate person who we valued having as our property manager.

Was really good quite quick to. They arrived at about 10 ish the morning fixed whole in my floor and replaced the lino with flooring. And was finished for 3pm. Very friendly and polite. Will return to do the trim but over all really impressed with the outcome.

Not only that, at 5am this morning, our bathroom was taken over by a random small swarm of angry wasps. Within a literal couple of hours, Homesbook already had a very friendly and highly professional pest control  family run business at our door (Called Essential
Pest Services who I highly recommend!) and the problem was solved within minutes. Thankfully no nest, just a freak random occurrence. It ended up dying out naturally due to weather conditions
and temperature drops. Although we had to endure keeping our windows closed all summer as a result! Not nice!

I can't thank Craig and the team enough for everything they have done so far for this building and especially for jumping to action so fast this morning, especially considering my life was very much at risk.

If you're having issues with your current factor, speak to your neighbours, look into Homesbook and contact them! They have literally changed our quality of life in our building and we're all so grateful for them!
Sponsors of my club home strip and Craig has been a great backing for the club. Great guy and helps many of communities and his company.

My fiance (now wife!) and I were planning a wedding with about 4 months notice and were becoming frustrated with the options available for a reception venue. I had a list of about 15 questions I sent out to all potential venues and the vast majority would not directly answer them instead opting to send out brochures detailing expensive packages or offering to arrange a sit down meeting with their in house wedding planner.

It was a breath of fresh air when Richard came back to me within 24 hours answering all queries clearly and honestly. He would always respond quickly and nothing was too much trouble for him.

The hall itself is bright,clean and a really good ‚Äúblank canvas‚Äù with plenty of tables and chairs for up to 100 guests (covers available for hire). It has AV capabilities and PA (with induction loop) for hire. They can recommend DJs and have a cafe onsite whose staff are very flexible with catering options.  The bar is VERY reasonably priced and the staff were incredible on the night and assisted in every way possible.

If you are local and need a venue for any event or celebration then this is the place. Value for money,real care and total flexibility. Other venues should take note‚Ä¶ this is how you do it.

They take forever to answer the phone. Their automated ‚ÄòMillie‚Äô service is useless and if you complain about it they don‚Äôt record the complaint‚Ä¶ they state online that they‚Äôve received mainly positive feedback about it‚Ä¶ lies!!

Complete scammers!! Worth the read...

Received a parking ticket for parking on Moss Street Paisley. Confused as I had a visible ticket on my windscreen I appealed with immediately.

Turns out my car was not in an allocated bay therefore they have rejected my appeal as there is "clear signage" to back this. Okay so this would be fair if this is the case however it's not as there was no "clear signage" and still is none to date on street itself where I was parked.

They included a picture of a sign from the other side of the road as part of their evidence however refuse to look at my evidence which dismisses there was no signage for me and my side of the road. ( pictures to follow of where my cars parked, including the only sign which is blank white due to weather damage, how should I know what it used to say? pictures of my car with the white sign together, pictures of my car and the pay and display machine - the only thing on my side of the road, pictures of the pay and display machine itself - nowhere does it state in certain bays only. )

I can't now argue that I was in an incorrect "bay" however if they are issuing fines for such issues, it's their responsibility to make sure their rules are clear and visible. The contact number they provide in the outcome of the appeal letter have no idea on how to help and point-blank refuse to do anything, they only suggest ignoring it till the Notice of Owner arrives which i find disgusting.

If I had been ignorant and trying to park where I am not allowed, why would I go to a pay and display machine and get a ticket. What is worse about this case as there was 2 wardens who seen me arrive, seen me go to the ticket machine, seen me display the ticket and then smiled at myself and my partner as we walked off. Surely common decency would be to approach us and advise that the ticket I've just bought isn't valid for that "bay".

I have full evidence to show that there was no signage to show these rules, yet they are not accepting accountability in their mistakes with regards to replace old signs. They say they have picture to prove this yet the sign and the car isn't in the same picture, what does this prove exactly? That sign could have came from anywhere - it did, across the road. However, they want to act oblivious to my picture which show's the car and the sign beside it completely blank.

They have your hands tied because if you pay for it while trying to appeal it, it refuses your right to appeal. But if you don't pay the ticket goes up in price. I would 1000000% win this case in court, but this is where they take advantage of the public. Does anyone really want to go through all the time, stress and inconvenience of court for a parking ticket - no, so people pay the fine when they are 100% within their rights to have it revoked. Absolutely disgusting!!!!!!!

Over a 3 year period I have had to complain several times to the finance recovery team about discrepancies with my mums sundry income account.
I have had final demand notices for wrong invoices or invoices never sent, received 'urgent' messages from sheriff officers instructing me to pay despite not owing anything.
Neither myself or my mum( age 92) have ever been in debt in our lives.
I look after her affairs and recognise when something is wrong straight away but many elderly people would just pay, my mum would not be aware if a bill was wrongly sent .You are meant to trust the local authority. How many others have simply paid ?It is distressing being contacted by a debt agency. I was left feeling stressed and very perturbed. I had the inconvenience of going to the office and the embarrassment of having to justify and defend ourselves.
I have always received an apology from the council but never acknowledged my request for a meeting.

Shocking,  received an email from finance dept asking me to send copy of my bank details and statements and my address, as they didn't have my bank details because I didn't pay council tax direct debit, to get a refund. They should know better not to ask people for bank details to send through emails and phone calls.  It is not safe to do so.

Phoned and phoned and phoned, didn't get anywhere and just told sorry can't help or its already been diened. The staff were very helpful I thanked them
They are at the highest level of responsibility.
Most departments are not actually in the same building. You have to call them. And then you need to go to a different location
you can't get in to make an appointment The telephone is ignored I am ashamed of this place It's a  really horrible place I have got ill with stress .  i feel as if they hate me  I won't go back 0
Very polite, phoned upstairs for assisstance ,discussion over the phone, I was in  the building, no contact with relevant staff, it was wierd.

I feel I need to share that I‚Äôm currently being harassed by Rentahome. I was 1 month behind on rent due to dealing with bereavement, when I got back I communicated the date when the 1-month rent arrears would be cleared and that I would continue to pay as normal to bring everything up to date. First, they started with the constant emails asking me to phone in the office. I have told them my mental health has been affected but they do not care. After many emails asking to phone the office, they decided to try to ask to inspect the property after their scare tactics did not work. It's like talking to a wall!  I hope the landlords who are trusting this agency to manage their tenants are aware of how they are treating people. Disgusting. Keep in mind only 1 month behind rent! I have offered to clear the arrears and pay the current month‚Äôs rent. This agency does NOT follow the law of allowing tenants to have quiet enjoyment. Any inspections must be agreed upon by both parties but they think their scare tactics will get you to agree to being harrassed and unreasonable inspection requests after I just told them I am struggling with mental health after bereavement. They do not care!
Quick and efficient the only draw back I will say is u need to check your flat when u rent cause there might be discrepancies with the cleanliness issues.

Helped me move through lockdown into one of the nicest flats I could have wished for! Fantastic quality home, amazing customer service and support! Any issues they get back straight away and they have a list of helpful numbers for out of hours work! Would recommend as the best agency in Paisley I've experience so far! Thank you Rentahome!

Returned keys for a woman I met outside after they told her to return keys by 12:00 on a Saturday. They were closed so I offered to return the keys as she lived an hour's drive away.
When I returned the key on Monday morning they refused to give me a receipt for receiving the keys. Unprofessional, both for not being open when they told the woman they would be open and unprofessional for not just scribbling a receipt.

I feel compelled to share the full extent of their unprofessionalism and disregard for tenants. Not only did they make baseless claims to charge me for redecoration expenses related to an upstair neighbor's water leak stain on the ceiling, but they also attempted to charge me for overall repainting and cleaning. When confronted with evidence proving that the stain was caused by the neighbor's property and not my responsibility, they changed their narrative, accusing me of unauthorized painting using non-neutral colors.

To further illustrate their incompetence, they even used a walk-in inventory report from a completely different property with a different address, wrongly claiming it as evidence against me. Fortunately, I had the original walk-in report of the correct property, complete with pictures taken by Rentahome themselves, showing no changes whatsoever. It's astonishing that Rentahome would go to such lengths to fabricate claims, hoping that a favor adjustment would work in their favor through My Deposit Scotland. My Deposit Scotland ruled in my favor, recognizing the agency's unjust attempts to withhold my deposit. It was a relief to have an impartial third party acknowledge Rentahome's wrongdoing and validate my claims.

What makes this situation even more infuriating is the fact that I had gone above and beyond as a tenant by finding a new tenant to take over the apartment, without charging any fees to Rentahome. Instead of appreciating my efforts and ensuring a fair return of my deposit, they attempted to exploit the situation and make unwarranted deductions.

My experience with Rentahome has been nothing short of a nightmare. Their dishonesty, lack of integrity, and disregard for tenants' rights is absolutely appalling. I strongly caution anyone considering renting from Rentahome to think twice and look elsewhere for a reputable property management company that values their tenants and conducts business ethically.

Response to the reply: There is nothing to discuss about it. It‚Äôs still shameful that not even an apology hasn‚Äôt been given.

Dealing with PropOp was a wonderful experience! It was undoubtedly the best property I've ever lived in and PropOp maintained everything so amazingly well. A big thanks to you all and wish you all the luck in future.

My business partner, Rob Moore, and I have been working with Andrew Hutton and PropOp for about 16 months now. We were genuinely delighted by how easy it was to transfer our properties to PropOp‚Äôs care and how quickly Andrew and his team got up to speed. It was really a seamless transition because PropOp had ensured all the ducks were lined up prior to the transfer.

PropOps ongoing management has provided us with a ‚Äòhands-off‚Äô experience because they‚Äôre proactive and highlight the smaller issues before they have a chance to snowball into something serious. PropOps reporting is comprehensive, but not over-the-top‚Ä¶ ‚Äòjust right‚Äô covers it.

PropOps website states that ‚Äúwe will provide you with the options, show you the opportunities and optimise your results‚Äù‚Ä¶ refreshingly, this is not marketing hyperbole, but accurately reflects PropOp‚Äôs service.

We could not be happier with Andrew and PropOp - we‚Äôd not hesitate to recommend them to anyone looking for a steady hand to manage their property investment.

- Bruce Thompson & Rob Moore

Living with PropOp has been a fantastic experience. All my requests and maintenance issues were addressed promptly and professionally. They were always helpful and prioritised my well-being. In particular, I would like to express my heartfelt gratitude to Dionne, whose kindness, patience, and unwavering support throughout my tenancy have meant so much to me. Wishing PropOp continued success and all the very best for the future!

Just finished up a 1.5 year tenancy with PropOp and they were incredible. The whole process from first viewing the property to finalising the return of the bond was very smooth and easy. They were very responsive to any requests for the property throughout the tenancy and always applied fixes very quickly. They were also always available and provided quick responses to any questions we had throughout. I would highly recommend any properties managed by them particularly in Edinburgh where some of the larger companies are notoriously difficult to work with. We would definitely rate any properties managed by them at the top of the list in future!

I am very pleased with the excellent service provided by Pure Property Management. They made the process of securing accommodation smooth, professional, and stress-free. The team is reliable, responsive, and genuinely committed to helping clients find the right place. I truly appreciate their dedication and the high standard of service they render. Highly recommended!

As a tenant of Pure Property Management i am very pleased with their service. In the few cases of needing their help they have been responsive and communicative meaning things are resolved quickly and I am kept informed. Most recently Sebastian Carrasco was superb in helping resolve an issue quickly. Landlords need good tenants so this counts. Thanks PPM

Really positive experience with Pure Property Management thus far. The move-in was smooth and hassle-free. There was an issue with the bed frame and mattress, but within 24 hours James from maintenance had arranged a brand-new replacement. They‚Äôve been very responsive to communication, with great service and quick resolution of concerns ‚Äî highly recommend!

I want to express my sincere gratitude to Pure Property Management Ltd for their exceptional support in helping me find and rent a good property. The process was smooth and efficient, and their professionalism and attention to detail made all the difference. I'm extremely pleased with my new flat and highly recommend their services to anyone looking for a reliable and dedicated property management team.
I also wanted to update my review. I had a great experience with Pure Property Ltd during my time living in Edinburgh last year (August 2024-July 2025). From the beginning, the team was incredibly supportive and professional. Any maintenance issues that came up were dealt with promptly and effectively, and even my smallest queries were always answered quickly and clearly.
What really stood out was their efficiency and professionalism when we decided to move out. The entire process was smooth and stress-free thanks to their proactive approach and attention to detail.
I truly appreciated their support throughout my tenancy, and I highly recommend Pure Property Ltd to anyone looking for a reliable and responsive letting agent in Edinburgh. Thank you again for all your help!

We've been renting with PPM and honestly couldn't be happier with their service. The entire team is attentive, responsive, and genuinely kind. Peter, Sebastian, and Kristin have been nothing short of exceptional, they've made the whole renting experience smooth and stress-free. It's clear they care about their tenants and go above and beyond to help. Highly recommend!

Our house caught fire 4 months ago, we lost everything. After 4 months in a hotel Rentolease relentlessly searched and notified us of avaliable properties. We eventually got agreement from our insurers and Rentolease were on it and secured the perfect property for my family. We are now all together in a place that feels very much like home allowing us to continue with our lives. We cannot thank Rentolease enough for the relentless sterling service, we feel Craig and the team truly cared about our circumstances and did all they could to find us a home. Grateful beyond words, the light in a very dark journey, thankyou.

Great experience and communication from the initial enquiry to us moving into our home.  Any difficulties experienced were dealt with swiftly and with importance.  A very different journey to other rental companies. Would highly recommend.

Using rentolease was a great experience from viewing to moving in. We were relocating from Hampshire to Troon, and they were really helpful in making space in their appointments to get a viewing that worked well with the flights we booked.
Any questions we had were answered promptly and the agents local knowledge was invaluable in helping us choose schools for our children and settling in the community.
We also received a welcome pack on the first day we moved in, which was a classy touch, and it had essentials to help us on day 1.
Dont keep landlords up to date with tenants requests for repairs .and over six months since leaving they are still sending me annoying emails .

I needed an accommodation urgently around my work place because journeying to work every single day from Glasgow to Kilmarnock by bus or train was a nightmare. I spent almost two hours on the road after work. I was glad meeting with Rentolease because they had saved me from that whole stress by providing me with a very nice accommodation and it‚Äôs like 12mins by bus or 9 mins drive to my workplace. They are so organised and reliable. Keep the good work.

I rent with Rentolease (3 yrs now) and over time, I've come to appreciate them more and more. I'm happy in my flat - they've been fast to fix the real emergencies (boiler issues, etc.) and have dragged their feet on others - nobody is perfect. But here's why I appreciate them: Currently other agencies in the area are requiring prospective tenants to pay a deposit simply to make an application on a vacant unit. This is illegal and exploitative. Rentolease never, ever made me do anything shady like this. I didn't appreciate it at the time, took their operating above board for granted, but I appreciate it now. Also, they have provided me with immediate service when I've needed to get things like statements of accounts and more than one set of spare keys, lol. They are a class outfit, and I'm grateful that they seem to actually care about my livelihood and that, as a tenant, is rare. I'd rent with them again and use them as a landlord too, if I ever have the opportunity.
friendly staff and any problems are sorted for you straight away...

Utterly useless. Except when you leave a box outside your door, at which point their porter guy shows up within moments. I am actually considering using this approach to contact them as it's more reliable than anything else.

Our 25 flat building door has been broken for a month. Reported multiple times by multiple people. Nothing.

Outside the front door there are thrown eggs and whatnot, asked for cleaning, did half a job and left.

The building is barely cleaned once every 3 months or so.

Been trying to setup Hyperoptic for our building for 4 years now. Everyone in the neighbourhood has it, except ours. I can guess why. Given how bad their intercoms are and their ability to get stuff done. The rest are just robotic humans who follow a script and can't actually do anything to really help.

Apparently they can't ask their colleagues to give me a call back when a specific person I need to talk to is available either. I need to phone at the right moment to speak to them since emails apparently take a week to be picked up.

Terrible customer service. Phoned about a leak in my home, which was ignored. Phoned multiple times, always told I would get a call back to help - never did. Emailed multiple times and copied in Julie Bruce the estate manager, ignored every time.

5 months of a leaking roof and still nothing, going to have to find a lawyer just to get them to do the thing they're being paid for

Edit: still leaking, had to wait for RMG to hire a new building manager because apparently they have no interim system in place. New manager made some good progress getting stuff done for a bit, but now I'm a month since their last email telling me that the roofers would be in touch next week.

I had the misfortune to buy a flat in a building they managed. Utterly awful. From bloated invoices, and charges for inspections that never resulted in fixed, to staff that are rude, ignore emails and are utterly inept, these guys are actually criminally incompetent. I sent a video about water running through my ceiling onto my boiler and was told this wasn't their fault as it was probably coming FROM my boiler. Despite, you know, gravity.
They would charge out building for works that happened in other buildings on the same street. They'd send an engineer to look at legally required stair well lighting and never repair it. And then charge you again to look again.
But the worst is that we found out they didn't have adequate building insurance for our building. Leaving the owners with a potential bill of 10s of thousands of pounds!

Absolutely terrible service. They overcharge at any possible moment (¬£500 pounds to move a metal planter) that they put in! That was I'm a bad spot and a car hit it. Best part is a week later, happened again. Literally happens with everything from common garden maintenance, lifts, etc

They are refusing to fix lighting in the area and avoiding all email.

Every possible moment of dealing with them is Terrible. Avoid this company

Ritchie Leasing are a terrible company to have to deal with. Their priority appears solely to be for the Landlord and not the tenant.

Essential repairs and maintenance can take months to be handled. The staff are abrupt. rude and unhelpful.

An emergency contact number was provided. However, calls were ignored and voicemails left unanswered.

The only thing they appear to be good at, is taking your money.

If you wish to lease somewhere, I would advise exhausting every available option before turning to Ritchie Leasing

Ritchie leasing was an absolute pleasure to deal with. I feel as though, Hannah went "above and beyond" her call of duty to help us try to secure a rental home. Moving overseas from Canada to Scotland is a stressful, overwhelming ordeal and I felt as though Hannah was GENUINELY trying to help out our family. She took the time to walk me through techno-challenges I was haveing. My emails were always responded to in a timely fashion which is difficult when dealing with someone in a different time zone, on a different continent, from the other side of the pond. Once we had secured the rental, Hannah even went on to offer further help providing other information to help with our move. We had such a great experience with Ritchie Leasing, particularly with our representative. I tip my hat to you Hannah and I would recommend Ritchie Leasing, without hesitation, to anyone who needs help renting a home. Thanks again Hannah!!

Poor quality of service and very unprofessional. Invoicing and landlord payment poorly managed. Keys were not securely managed by agent. Property maintenance was poor despite fully managed service. Still no Check-Out report 8-weeks after tenancy ceased, therefore no deposit return to tenant. Distinct lack of communication and action in making payments to landlord for agency incurred costs.  Never again with this agency.

Nightmare company to go through with a massive conflict of interest with the golf club as this is where their true loyalties lie. Exclusively female, bordering on passive aggressive. Sometimes things will get done but don‚Äôt expect it with any grace as it‚Äôs all about the golf club not wanting to part with a penny more than it needs to.

If you are unfortunate to get the bungalow adjoining the golf club, do bear in mind they are literally just a few feet apart. So, if you enjoy noisy socials with loud music pulsating through your property until midnight, a complete lack of respect or privacy from visitors, and seriously compromised water pressure that's shared with them, then go ahead and sign up. After all, this is what you signed up to, so other than the great views and walks, ‚Äúput up and shut up‚Äù.

I'm completely satisfied with Ritchie Leasing. The process of renting a place was really easy and fast. Communication is always promt and kind. Whenever there was anything that needed to be repaired it was arranged quickly and the quality of work was always outstanding. I highly recommend this letting agency.

Absolutely shocking service for many many folk in the area. Ok, they inherited some dismal stock from years ago. However, basic things aren't being done here. Coms, accountability and basic standards are beyond them.

This place is rude as hell, Got spoken to like rubbish by one of there so call admin person Megan, because they can't do a repair right I've had them out 4 time to fix fences all they do few new nails then after a few weeks wood starts to come out again!! Megan is rude

If you don't mind waiting over a year for basic repairs then RiverClyde  Homes are the way to go...for at least some of your housing needs.

Having rent increased whilst also having complaints ignored, repairs in purgatory and enquiries forgotten are just some of the highlights of a RCH tenancy.

As a bonus, they will also hand deliver slightly veiled threatening letters through your letterbox for issues unrelated to you...you know, just to keep your anxiety peaked while living in a nightmare slum.

AVOID THESE FACTORS!! Currently a year on battling with riverclyde homes to fix the damage from the flat roof which is ruining my home with water damage. They do not stick to their own policies in regards to getting back to you and lie constantly about repair men being out. Staff are clueless & your individual notes are not accurate or up to date. I am just off yet another call for a member of factoring to say there isn't many notes/asking me what the issue is despite calling/emailing 3 times a week for the past YEAR about water damage and a hole in my roof that goes through to the loft due to this. They finally put scaffolding up & after the builders telling me & my family the chimney is the issue/not safe RCH are not only refusing to remove it.. They are saying if I don't get 5 out of 6 yes VOTES (Took speaking to 4!! staff members for someone to even be able to explain to me their voting scheme or how many yes votes I would need!!!) they won't be doing the full repair to even fully stop the water issue. I was also told I had to go explain to the rest of the building myself the issues needing repaired to the full extent and to convince them to vote yes as 'they don't have the time and it isn't important to them' if the issue is fixed or not. This is honestly just a small insight to the hell they have caused me the past year.

Left without heating or hot water for a pieried of 22 days and I would like to clarify that in my bedroom I have to wait for them to either fix or replace with a new heater and I have been told by the plumber that I would more inlikely get a hole entirely new
Heating system frewout my full house dependent upon river clyde homes paying for it and would also like to state that the heating system I'm living with was the only system that my house has had since been built and has never been changed either and could not believe what they were seeing

Robert Smith Contractors laid the concrete slab for our build. Achieved a completely level surface over three separate areas of the build in a morning. Fast, efficient, helpful and cheerful team. Definitely recommend.

Had nothing but great experiences over the 8 properties that we've sold through Mike Smith Properties.  Due to Christine's extensive knowledge of the local housing market, the advice we received was  spot-on.  The marketing of the flats was very professional, with the prices achieved more than anticipated.

We used Mike Smith Properties for our recent house move and can't recommend them enough. Christine was a fantastic help with lots of useful suggestions to make the most of marketing and selling our property. I think this has been the least stressful house move we've had, and if we move again I will definitely be using them. Thank you!

Excellent small estate agent and conveyancing service. Mike and Christine manage a small portfolio of properties for sale so can give a much more personalised service than bigger agents. The company handled our property sale and purchase and we couldn't be happier with their service. Great "old school" legal service where the conveyancer really looks out for their client and thinks beyond the paperwork - flagging up risks and suggesting solutions. Really felt like they had our best interests at heart.

MS Properties handled the sale of a house in Torrance. They were very helpful with all the queries and details, advertised the house successfully, and hosted all the property visits. They drew in a number of offers leading to a closing date. They advised on the result and the process through to completion. They provide a professional and friendly service. I would use them again.

Mike Smith Properties, recommended by very dear friends, proved to be  an exceptional choice during the process of selling our house. Given the circumstances, we        experienced a less stressful situation because of Christine's kind, caring and supportive manner throughout. Her advice was very much appreciated and her attention to detail helped to present the house in the best light possible in a relatively short space of time. I'll always be grateful for her understanding of our newly bereaved situation and her calmness  when things threatened to overwhelm. Sincere thanks Christine.

Totally Unprofessional, the managers tell you anything to placate you especially older owners/tenants our development under their stewardship has deteriorated dramatically, They recently recommended we should change our gardeners and although they were more expensive the service is now a joke! They are not proactive regarding maintenance and for the money they charge it's a second rate service they provide.
They have well over ¬£27,000
In a contingency fund that they seem reluctant to spend on the common good of our properties and don't ask them about the interest on the cash they just fob us off with a pile of guff!
