Jamie Elder from Redpath Bruce has gone further than he has needed when he has been factoring our block of flats over the past several years. He has helped me at all times when needed and tried his best to find solutions for me.  Thanks Jamie for all of your help over the years, it was very much appreciated.

This is the worst property management company it has been my misfortune to deal with.  They don't answer emails if you complain they just blank you. They changed ¬£1200 to repair a fence. The fence was 25 years old 8 post were put in and the 25year fence was nailed to the posts. Total rip off if you complain they tell you no one else has complained.üëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëéüëé

I have been dealing with Ryan Jordan at Redpath Bruce and I cannot recommend him highly enough. He is a real asset to the company, having dealt with a number of factors in the past I confirm he is attentive, communicative, and  competent, all values which any owner would hope to find in their factor. Excellent.

The lettings department at Redpath Bruce are fantastic!
I rented a property from them for almost three years and had a great experience. The whole team are reliable, efficient and professional.
My main point of contact within the team was Brenda, she was fantastic and extremely supportive, it‚Äôs rare that you find a lettings team that are genuinely on your side and really care about their tenants.
10/10 service, cannot recommend enough!

Excellent communication. Very friendly. No problems with getting the whole deposit back.

I have rented a house with them for 3.5 years. I recommend Robertson Property Management!

An overall decent letting agency severely let down by attempts to scam us and other tenants out of deposits.

We rented with RPM for two years, and throughout that had no real issues. Most issues we brought up got passed straight to the landlord who solved them promptly, and the letting agency were fast to respond and easy to communicate with.

When we decided to move out we were warned by a friend who had rented with them recently that they would try to come for our deposit on baseless grounds - in my friends case they initially tried to take his whole deposit before backing down to a still absurd ¬£80 each when they challenged their claims.

Sure enough, shortly after moving out we were hit with a huge list of claims relating to cleaning, repairs and even removal of items that previous tenants had left in the flat. After we challenged the claims and demanded proof, we received a set of photos covering two of the flat's four rooms and about a third of the points they raised. We again challenged them, and eventually received the photos taken in the inspection before we moved in, which were of a laughable quality and completely confirmed every point we had been making about the state of the flat when we moved in. At this point they gave up.

The degree of incompetence and either apathy or malignance that the agency handles the inspection process with is frankly astonishing. I don't have enough evidence to confidently say that they have a pattern of preying on students but it seems likely. It's regrettable that this spoiled an otherwise decent letting experience.

I've had an incredible experience with this landlord and could not recommend Robertson Property enough!
I was put into an unfortunate circumstance some years ago and Robertson Property done everything they could to find me a property within my budget and support me during a very stressful time.
They responded quickly to any queries or issues I had and have been fantastic and friendly throughout the 7 years I have rented with them.

Having transferred from a poor letting agency, I feel qualified and confident to recommend Robertson Property Management, as a highly efficient and reliable company with a good knowledge of property and the market both generally and locally. The staff are friendly and approachable while skilled and business-like. Basically they get the job done.
Well done and thank you.

Excellent experience, application process was very fast. No issues whatsoever. I was always informed of any work going on several days in advance via email and they were more than fair when it came to the return of my deposit. Would absolutely let from them again and would recommend them to anyone.

Rented a property form this company from 20th December last year on a 12 month contract when I received my contract that had been signed as a 12 month I noticed it was only 8 months when I contacted them they told me it was only a 8 month I singed. I had to get the boiler fan replaced myself with in a few days of me being in the property as they told me no one was available and to buy a portable heater had to pay for the boiler fan to be replaced myself until the office was open to request a refund. Reported a few issues to be told the landlord wasnt sending anyone to look at this. They tried to charge me full council tax for the property which I had to seek legal advice to get resolved. When I moved out they tried to charge me for damages to the bedroom I had took photos and the room was in good condition I am now wanting to hear form the courts on a decision on whether I can get my full deposit back the company has created more issues and problems for me and the other person that was living there in the 8 months from moving in to moving out. I would never rent from this company or recommend anyone in the north east area as they are based in Dundee and have no one in the area to maintain their properties. Im still waiting for ¬£200 of my deposit to be refunded to me. My move out date was 19th August nearly 2 months later and still waiting. Just an update i still have not received my full deposit back as they are still trying to charge me i have requested proof of this or i will proceed with legal action to have this resolved. Please please avoid this company.

DO NOT GO NEAR ROCKFORD PROPERTIES, NO MATTER YOUR CIRCUMSTANCE.

This is probably the first time I have as if I HAD to leave a review in my entire life.

Was with rockford properties for just over a year and I wish I never was. We were spoken to like second class people, we almost had to beg for responses and they did not fix things that were broken and reported from day 1 (That they have now tried to charge US for). At the start they were speedy, which I initially liked but we then realised they just want to trap you.

They will 100% take an outrageous amount from your deposit and I understand people are working a job but Hazel and Georgina in particular are the ones who were constantly rude and at time threatening to us.

Adding to this, they wanted me to travel to Dundee to collect keys to a property in Edinburgh. This review should be taken seriously by everyone, but especially students, they look down on you and take advantage of you financially at any given opportunity.

I have found Rockford Properties to be consistently professional and supportive when it comes to dealing with tenants and fellow landlords. From provision of references, vetting tenants, arranging communal repairs and fostering professional relationships, they have always endeavoured to do their best for both the client and the tenant.

I rented with Rockford for about 3 years and can say with absolute certainty that landlord or tenant you should stay as far away as possible from this business. The staff at Rockford that we‚Äôve had the displeasure of dealing with in our time as tenants must have absolutely no shame in providing such horrendous customer service and property management.

The only thing they are on top of is anything regarding getting money from you, otherwise it takes weeks to respond to any attempt at communication. We had contractors turning up at our door with no prior notification, repeated requests for our windows - which were permanently open - to be fixed either ignored or dismissed and any minor maintenance promised either never came to fruition or was completed to such a poor quality that it needed doing again almost immediately (think kitchen ceiling lightbulbs falling out just after a contractor ‚Äòfixed‚Äô them).

This lack of attention and care culminated in a situation where we were unable to get in contact with Rockford out of hours after a live cable burnt out as the emergency number provided on their website only led to an answering machine telling us to get back in contact with them in the morning.

No matter how desirable the property may seem, it is just not worth it - especially if you run into an actual serious issue like we did. Be warned that Rockford do not care one lick about caring for their properties or tenants. If it doesn‚Äôt involve money for them, they will do their level best to avoid doing anything at all.

Rockford have been excellent landlords in the time I have been with them. Extremely  helpful and quick to act any time I have an enquiry. They were also very understanding when I needed help due to changes in my circumstances. Would highly recommend this company to anyone looking to rent a home.

I would like to leave a review for the Welfare Officer, Parmjit.

Parmjit has helped both me and my wife on numerous occasions with any difficulties we‚Äôve encountered with our benefits and welfare rights.

On one occasion I had to appear before a tribunal. Parmjit not only helped me she actually assisted me travelling with me to the tribunal. She then brought me safely home again as I had just got home after being in hospital.

I and my wife have been very grateful for her support and encouragement in dealing with very difficult documents to complete and her assistance has been very professional and very supportive.

We both thank her very much for all her help and we are grateful she‚Äôs doing such a wonderful job at Rosehill.

Many thanks Parmjit.
Mr Young

Attended Rosehill today for meeting with Parma (benefits advisor) she was extremely hellful with my UC application. Helped me with completing the form as well as setting my expectations to what should happen onwards. This did not take a long time, very professional and friendly manner. Totally recommend anyone with any uncertainty to pop in or call to make appointment. Has given me such peace of mind & stopped me having to second quests everything. Thank you much appreciated.
Once again cant praise Parmjit, Welfare Officer enough for helping me. Ive asked for her help and advice before and she really does her very best and always gets results.
I would like to give a big thanks to the welfare rights officer panjeet she was extremely helpful and saved me a lot of stress

my name is john watson 275 peat rd   2years ago i lost my  son to covis   and now recently  i have  lost my   wife after 60 years   i was helped  by parmjit   purewals your welfare officer  i dont mind telling you that i was in a very dark place until i spoke with her  she helped  me get what i was due breathing life back into me  and helping me to move forward with my life   i will be forever in her debt i can now  can see a light at the end of the tunnel  and can open the door and  see the flowers growing again thank you

Great Team & Superb Live Chat >
Recently had a conversation with the Repairs team on LiveChat for some advice. Were very helpful and responsive!
Overall, excellent service and highly recommend..forever going above beyond.

review_text: Disgraceful housing association. Moved into a flat 2 month ago and I have had many repairs that required carried out from gas uncapped to flooding. Trying to get a repair is difficult and they expect you to take time off work to suit them. They only provide full day time slots and do not work around working class people. It takes you 30 mins to get through to report any repairs. The housing officer is also a liar as he knew about issues with my roof but when I had asked him before signing for the house he advised there was no issues even though I noticed the scaffolding. I found out by the roofing contractor that the roof repair had been in for weeks before I moved in so housing officer was well aware. They only care about getting rent money from tenants and do not care about there tenants at all.

I have already reviewed Sanctuary Housing but I have to submit another review. Recently I signed the tenancy agreement after my brother's death in November 2024. Since I have taken the tenancy over I have been getting letters saying that I am in arrears of my payments for my rent. The service provided has been consistently outstanding, making the rental process stress-free. I highly recommend Rent Locally to anyone looking for a reliable and professional letting agent.

Disgrace of an agency cause nothing but uneeded stress during an unbelievably hard time. Slow to fix repairs, tried to blame us for marks etc on Walls some which we were already there and some caused by their Soddy repair work. communication is key but not with this company

First time landlords and went through Rent Locally, Nikki, was brilliant with us and explained how they work and what management services they offer which was ideal.  Everything was very smooth and got our tenants in within the week.! Fantastic! Looking for our next property now to grow our portfolio.! 5‚≠êÔ∏è service from Rent Locally..
The repairs team are a joke. The also like to lie to our MP about their failures. Management don't have a clue at all. Only good at lying and making excuses.

I have had to deal with the staff on a regular basis at the Council HQ and cannot fault them because they have shown me nothing but patience courtesy and I find them very helpful. Given they are the first point of contact they're likely to be the ones who get the brunt of the anger and frustrations from others but personally I have never had an issue and they must deal with many hundreds of phonecalls in a day. Thank you everyone....from Inverness with love and a whole lot of appreciation üíó

Bin not collected and tagged despite being valid contents. Then discovered we now have to pay for simple garden waste uplift via burgundy bin. Even grass which is normally lifted. ¬£45. Er no. I simply won't recycle now. Already pay an increased council tax. Where is that going? Into the pockets of incompetent staff. You screwed up again council. We weren't born yesterday

Total joke of a council. Worst website I've seen, no option to pay building standards warrant and need to call. Just waited for 35 minutes to be told they have a system error and calls can't be answered

Absolutely disgusting. Talk about rinsing people of their hard earned money, 2 days in a row I have had a packing ticket for parking at my work, I watched the parking attendant walk the full length of glenburn road placing tickets on every single car parked in the industrial estate. My second ticket is an absolute joke. They said I was parked on the pavement which I wasn't, said that it was obstructing a walk way. No if I was to post a picture of this walk way you certainly be walking it as it's overgrown with bushes covering the pavement. I'm well aware of the new law been passed about parking on pavements, I don't necessarily agree with it, but the council rinsing people is not on. Not to mention the lack of everything they do in east kilbride for everyone. I'd be embarrassed to be working for them if this is how they behave.
I appealed this ticket and got a template response. Absolutely no care in world for the matter from the council. And if I'm honest they just providing bullshit excuses to why they are handing them out. If your going to single yellow line the whole industrial estate then provide parking, if you dont have the funds for it maybe cut funds that are going to your workers that sit in their vans all day or all the unnecessary postions I can imagine the council have.  Don't even get me started on the state of the roads and roadworks in the area. Becoming the laughing stock of east kilbride is the council. Embarrassing. Disgusting. Criminal.

Firstly, please ignore the average rating of 3.3 stars. That is because some reviewers have entered in error. Any meaningful review is 1 star.

Our absolutely shambolic journey with Southside Housing Association (SHA) began in December 2021. We had a leak into our bedroom - a ground floor flat. This was brought to the attention of SHA immediately, 27/12/21. They promised that someone would come out.

Fast-forward to February 2022, and following numerous phone-calls and several (unreplied) emails, they sent out a maintenance officer to survey the damage. They mistakenly sent a second maintenance officer approximately 30 minutes after the previous staff member attended. This poor communication was to remain a theme of SHA's service.

There then remained zero reparative action or communication over the summer, despite more phone calls to SHA. On many phone calls, the staff member to whom I was speaking to confessed that there seemed to be little record of the matter being raised, or of the visits by the repair officers. Again, lack of decent record keeping remained a theme.

Fortunately, during the summer, we enjoyed reduced water ingress, as rainfall was obviously less.

However by winter 2022, the water ingress returned. And it worsened significantly. Again, multiple phone calls to repairs coordinators but unfortunately no actual reparative action took place.

Then, over the Christmas holidays, we experienced ongoing, worsening water ingress to our bedroom. This time, water marks began to appear on our ceiling, and spread over 72 hours. Eventually, our ceiling burst, causing a torrent of water from our ceiling onto our carpet. This resulted in a metre long crack through our ceiling, destruction of our carpet and window blinds.

You're probably asking, why didn't you seek repairs when this was happening? Oh, we did. SHA were closed for 2 weeks over the Christmas holidays, with zero emergency cover. So we were directed to City Building (CB), whom SHA use as their go-to builders. Daily phone calls (multiple) and we were told that there was "nothing they could do" as the water ingress worsened. However, once the ceiling cracked they were able to send out someone (who was admittedly very helpful).

During this time we submitted a formal complaint, laid out very simply with numbered bullet points of answers which we were looking for. The water ingress to our bedroom had been raised 12 months ago. It had not been adequately resolved. There was significant damage (> ¬£7000) to our bedroom. This was on the 28th December 2022 that we raised the complaint.

Once SHA returned from their Christmas holidays (5th January 2023) we chased up our complaint and were assured that we would receive a response by 1st February, in-keeping with their policy of 20 working days. This, again, required multiple phone calls and emails, to get an acknowledgement of our complaint.

On the 1st February we were looking forward to getting our response - but were told that the complaints co-ordinator (who themself set the 1st Feb deadline) was on annual leave! And amazingly they then called to notify us that they required an extension by two weeks - and would provide an update each Friday. Furthermore a depute director stated that they would be "personally involved" in ensuring satisfactory resolution to this complaint.

Today is Friday 17/2/23. The second self-imposed deadline is today. Amazingly, the complaints co-ordinator (who set the deadline) is on annual leave again!

The issue is simple: SHA were notified of water ingress to our property in December 2021 with multiple further reminders throughout 2022. Clearly this was going to worsen without adequate resolution. Damage to property was foreseeable and preventable. Moreover, by not taking the necessary action in a timely manner, the potential for greater damage to properties was increased.

We are massively inconvenienced by the inaction of SHA. There is a significant financial loss (when we did everything we could) and our bedroom has been unliveable since our ceiling cracked in December.

All the staff are lovely except moona she‚Äôs so rude she things that she better then everyone and she‚Äôs not she needs a humbling she‚Äôs the worst don‚Äôt ever go to her my mum got a call from her and she hunged up because my mum told her that she can talk a bit politely to her and she didt  listen and hunged up on her very unprofessional very upsetting

I have losts my keys and they are very unhelpful and they dont even care when you talk to theam staff very rude on the phone and now I am waiting to get a hold of theam and I have to wait 3 hours before they answer the phone .
Avoid at all costs - dealt with multiple factors in the Southside and SHA are by far the worst I have experienced.

Been let down time and time again ! Reported several faults several times only for them to send incompetent tradesmen who only stick a plaster over the it rather than fix the problem properly!!! Avoid if this factor is you can because they'll let you down again and again üò§üëé

Hi again,I have upgraded to 3 star's as I was in recently in to report faults again and they were very efficient this time, IB  construction LTD and js floors and son where out the following week and rapidly fixed the faults I had so al credit to these guys as they did an excellent job and I would highly recommend them to anyone üëåüëç Now I'm waiting for the plumber to come and fix the other problems I have,I'll upgrade the star ratings if this is done in a timely fashion like the tradesmen did  who were in my flat on Tuesday ! üòèüëè

The Southside team was truly professional in helping me secure a perfect flat. The application process was incredibly efficient, and I was always impressed by how promptly the staff responded to my queries. The thoughtful welcome bag on move-in day was also a lovely, unexpected touch!

Their professionalism continued throughout my tenancy and even after I had moved out.I would like to give a special thanks to  Rob McDonald, who was my main point of contact throughout my time with Southside. Most recently, Rob went above and beyond when an Amazon parcel was accidentally delivered to my old address. He stepped in to coordinate communication between myself and the new tenant to find a solution, which took a huge weight off my mind. It is rare to find such dedicated support after a lease has ended. Highly recommended!

I lived in a Southside Property for over 8 years. Throughout that time I have had exceptional service and support. Repairs are easily reported and fixed, visits are well communicated and regular. My property manager was available and quick to respond to any query. With property in Edinburgh being in high demand, Southside are a  trusted brand I would be confident in telling anyone to use.

So far so great! Recently moved into a new place thanks to Southside and they have been great. Gotten a very cute welcome package (never received one with any other housing agent!!), and responses to any problems were solved or communicated quickly! Ione has been a stellar property manager and really appreciate Southside for checking in on us even after our move! (shoutout to Scott!). Great experience.

I've been a tenant in a Southside property for 4 months. Ione has taken care of my account and is absolutely the best! She responds quickly to any inquiry I have and has been so helpful. Would definitely recommend going with Southside. Their professionalism and quick response times make it such a good experience to live in one of their properties.

I had cause to use their Welfare Team.  Kevin was incredibly pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful.

I own a property in that is factored by Speirs Gumley and they are most likely the the property managers from hell.

They are quick to invoice for for work that is never done and insist on carrying out unnecessary maintenance but they will not fix the roof that has several leaks for the past fourteen years.

My lounge flooring has gad to be replaced several times due to the water Ingress.

Their communication is non existent
And nothing ever seems to get done.

I have used their letting section in the past and they are even more useless at that, my property was totally trashed even these guys where charging me for a full management fee for my property, in the end l was left several thousands of pounds out of pocket and no comeback.

If you have these guys as your factors please double check your factors bill as they always over charge or add extras on to the bill I the hope that you would be none of the wiser.

My advice is to avoid these guys at all costs as they will rob you blind, modern day robbery.

Aside from the issues my estate has with what we're charged for work that's not approved, the website for payment is just rubbish. It's not user friendly, it never works and you always need to go the long way in which you then forget to do because you don't have time. I'd get fewer reminders if they'd just sort it out and let us pay quickly!

I'd prefer one star. An appalling company.

Read its values on its website.  They'll make you chuckle.
An absolute riot of lie after lie after lie.

It‚Äôs now taking to review-washing.  It had to happen.  I mean it couldn‚Äôt allow all those REAL reviews to get in the way of its fantasy: only saints work at Speirs and Gumley.  That is, if saints worked for the Stasi?

It's a bullying company that constantly put obstacles in the way of providing accurate accounting and acquiring information.  It makes 'policy claims' that aren't policy. It holds communities to ransom.

It‚Äôs directors, well.  Enough said.

The only thing this company is interested in is making money for itself at all costs and residents pay the price.

While it speaks to Speirs Gumley‚Äôs Machiavellian practice to work behind the scenes, I‚Äôm pleased they‚Äôve gone down the route of factor-washing reviews.  It shows them up for exactly what they are, a shallow, deceitful, no morals lie of a company.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

It would be zero stars if that was an option!

The service and attitude from Speirs Gumley is nothing short of atrocious!
They were notified of a water leak in the building and acknowledged the email stating it would be investigated,  several months with emails and phone calls to get nowhere and then 6 months after being told about the leak which was now just water pouring from the ceiling they send an email acting like they have just been made aware of the leak which by this point had caused severe damage to the ceiling, wall and carpet and the water was also dripping into the equipment cabinet.  They then appointment a company to carry out an investigation and get a cherry picker to access inside the roof and found someone had slit the water sealing membrane with a blade and they provided photos of this but speirs stated the repair would be at the cost of the residents.  The residents disputed the charges as this was done by someone who was a subcontractor for the developer/speirs
We were told the manager Craig Phillips would look into the matter but Craig cut all contact and ignored emails and didnt return calls and the only time we heard from them was to inform us Craig had left the position. After chasing it up again we then get told that the residents are still liable for the repair and also the repairs needed to rectify the internal damage that was made worse by speirs just ignoring the issue for 6 months

All in all Speirs Gumley are an abysmal company to deal with who lie, dont take blame for their actions and constantly talk down to their customers,  if you are unlucky enough to have them as your factors then you may best look to vote them out and appoint one you can trust

I reported a roof leak December 31. It was end of March before it was handled and the flat could be reinstated. Problem is that it's still not fully handled. They fixed half of the roof and never investigated the other half despite their own expert leak investigator stating that it was necessary. Speirs instead sent a letter to all the owners stating that the investigator said it was fixed, when this is the opposite of what he said.

What I don't understand is why lie? I tried calling the exec director and emailing the CEO and neither returned my message. My property manager has written that she will not be calling the leak investigator. The senior leadership refuse to call me back and address the fact that a lie was knowingly sent to all the owners (it was in an email to me weeks before it was formally sent to the owners, and I promptly replied to correct it. Instead of correcting the information, they included it in the letter proving that they are spreading false information intentionally) so again, why? What is Speirs afraid of? Is this an ego thing? Do they financially benefit from denying repairs?

I've been fully available to address this, but no one has even come to the roof or met with the contractors and me! The Speirs office is 10 meters from my building yet I let the contractors in and met with them all and Speirs has been absent from the job site. Something isn't right here. It makes no sense. It's like they want to be authoritarian to the point of inaccurate yet pass the responsibility for the day-to-day to me.

Speirs, if you are reading this, something is deeply broken with your internal processes, and I am calling on you to fix this. It would start with taking an interest in my experience as your client.

Response to owner's reply: Your response did not seem tailored to the specifics of my review. I'm not talking about the contractors or the length of time, which also concerns me but less so than the communication issues. As for the "let's take this offline" and the management email you provided...I sent all of this to that email 24 days ago so where are you? I don't make claims unless I can back them up, and I can back up every statement in my review.
Best Housing I ever live with. Very kind and helpful housing officer. The G map services amazing.

Been on to them to get windows fixed for over 2 years and still nothing! livingroom is flooded or soaked everytime it rains loads of my kids stuff ruined, Yet they are quick enough to want kids stuff removed from
a close full of kids though Shambles!!
The housing officer was very helpful.
Local housing office, usually very helpful and deal with your problem quickly, staff are very friendly
Great bunch of people. Very helpful
Used to be the best HA, seems staff have changed. Its a nightmare trying to get anything done. They tell you lies & have you running in circles. Worst HA ever.
Excellent thanks
I it's good
Great association. Great houses
Overcharge rent
Thank you for leaving this space unlocked. My 1yr old really needed a good run around away from the perpetually bad weather we've experienced.

The place Is very nice. Makes you feel home. Like a family.
The context is unique. I would say poetic.
As Italian I would say that the cappuccino was fantastic and the cake was delicious too.
If I were to return to Skye it is definitely one of the place I would stay
Delicious and Very Good Cakes in a cafe hidden away in a charming room with wild flowers on the tables. It‚Äôs behind the utilitarian looking shop in the community hall. Well worth a visit.
Good honest food at good honest prices in the middle of some spectacular scenery. Also part of a unique twinning, see the attached photograph.
Nice caf√© with homemade cakes

I lived in an Inchdairnie property from 2018-2021, and my experience was fantastic. The property was well maintained, safe, and properly secure. The estate agents were always kind, friendly, and prompt with responding to requests. Occasionally, an appliance would need replacing, and Inchdairnie were always accommodating and dealt with our needs quickly. I had peace of mind, knowing that the property was looked after and that my flatmate and I were likewise treated with respect and care. I highly recommend them for anyone needing to rent in St Andrews.

I have used Inchdairnie Properties to let property to tenants for over 10 years.
Over this extended period of time,I have built up a considerable amount of trust in Gillian Stephen and her staff.
I have been most impressed by their professionalism and have grown to value the helpful and considerate nature of the staff.
I have had reason to ask for help and advice on a number of occasions over the years and have always been given good common sense advice.
I would highlight Inchdairnie's careful vetting of tenants as a key factor in their success.
I am looking for good quality tenants who are regular payers and I am delighted to say that Inchdairnie have never let me down.
I highly recommend this firm to both tenant and landlord alike as respective interests will be well looked after by a very capable staff.

The team at Inchdairnie Properties is spectacular! I have been fortunate to rent one of their beautiful student properties this year. The flat was very clean and modern, and the letting agency was a pleasure to work with. Inchdairnie was always prompt and helpful when addressing any of my concerns. I would highly recommend Inchdairnie Properties to anyone, especially St. Andrews students!

I was a tenant with Inchdairnie Properties for about 2 years and they were fantastic from start to finish. The whole team are so friendly and willing to help with anything. We hardly had any issues but if we had a query or concern they were very quick to respond and come up with solutions efficiently and with real expertise. I would recommend them to any prospective tenants or landlords without a doubt. It's just a shame that I moved away from the area and couldn't continue as a tenant with them.

The wonderful people at Inchdairnie Properties have helped us have a wonderful two years in their beautiful homes.
They have been prompt to solve any issues we faced over the course of the tenancy, have been very communicative, and also provide some of the most honest and straightforward letting practices in town. They also manage some of the best student flats and homes in town and maintain them to a very high standard. You cannot go wrong letting from Inchdairnie and we will miss being in St Andrews and letting with them very much!

Moved into a flat after seeing it had a good factor in place. After moving in Taylor and Martin were unable to arrange quotes for works required on the communal areas and after a complaint from a fellow owner they decided to terminate us as clients and provided no help in handing over utilities or details on communal areas. Happy to take your money but will drop you in a second when you ask for decent service. Still waiting on our floats being returned after 2 months and no response except a bill!

We moved to Taylor and Martin in March 2024 for the factoring of our 8-block tenement flat in Hyndland. I have been very happy with the service and support we have received as a whole from the company. Our account manager (Rachel Melville) has continually impressed me with her proactive and thorough support. Taylor and Martin have been a huge improvement from our last factor and I would highly recommend. The biggest plus for us has been having one point of contact for the last 18 months rather than the constant changing we experienced previously - when dealing with the maintenance of old buildings, continuity  of account managers is very beneficial.

Our experience with T&M in our estate in Beith has been decent. I'm giving them 5 stars, however, because
Of our Property Manager Rachel Melville. Since she's taken over things have been much smoother and we feel any issues we've had have been quickly resolved. Thanks Rachel!

We lived in a property factored by Taylor & Martin for six years. We found the company to be professional and proactive. Our property manager Rachel Melville is extremely knowledgeable of tenements and the nuances of conservation area buildings, and is passionate about keeping these old properties in running order, while preserving historical character. Our property required some work and Rachel was very kind and understanding about the impact sudden costs were on the owners, ensuring everyone was up-to-date via regular homeowners meetings and frequent email correspondence. When we came to sell our flat, the positive home report was a reflection on the upkeep of the entire property, which is testament to Rachel and her dynamic approach. Rachel is a genuine, determined and articulate person who we valued having as our property manager.

We changed to Taylor&Martin earlier this year, having become very dissatisfied with our Factor of several years. The service we‚Äôve received from our Property Manager Sam, has been excellent. He responds quickly and effectively, is extremely professional and personable. They seem to be above board when it comes to costs and such transparency is much appreciated, given our previous experiences with Factors. Most of us in this tenement are very grateful to have appointed Taylor&Martin
Josh has been very pro active with our estate and attends all the meetings plus site visits.  Matters are attended to quickly. Would recommend to anyone looking for Factors.
Incredible customer service levels from Josh. Had a nightmare with our old factors and it's such a breath of fresh air speaking to someone who actually cares.
Excellent customer service from Matt M in accounts.  Patient, helpful and polite.   Thank you.
This company provides a fantastic, efficient, quality service. Unreservedly recommended.
Quick to respond to my enquiries . I recommend their services to anyone in need of reliable and expedient assistance.

Beautiful place. Very friendly and open minded people. Driven and enthusiastic about everything ecological. It seems a very dynamic community with lots of events from conferences, yoga classes to classical music concerts.

Go there. Experience it for yourself, the calm, the quietness, the forest, the dunes leading to the beach, the beach and sea üôèüèΩbut do go to the village too and enjoy the little organic shop there The BakeHouse, by the post office. üíö Great products and friendly people üôèüèΩ
Friendly and helpful team. We stayed in one of the pods, fine for a short stay. Magical sunset across the bay!

Truly a Shangri La! The eco village demonstrates both individual creativity and collective responsibility. A village in harmony with the natural ecology, rather than being a slave to the car. A village where work, rest and play can be peaceful.

Very quiet place to visit, good foods at the coffee shop.
A place where we will come back again.

This was my second visit to Edinburgh. It's quite a nice city with some ornate historical buildings, but I must admit it's getting a little tatty looking in in some places, this is only minor though, Edinburgh is still a very nice city! Something that REALLY needs sorting though is some of the roads into the city centre. They had so many pot holes, cracks and very worn out surfaces that I felt I was driving OFF ROAD!!! In fact Edinburgh has the worst roads I have seen in the UK. The council seriously need more funds to sort this.

The local buses are good, their app is also recommended to anyone visiting Edinburgh. Buses have MANY stops so a journey can take a while. Buses fill up rapidly too, so getting a seat my be difficult.

I must point out that Edinburgh has a lot of steep hills and cobbled streets, so its VERY difficult to walk around if you have a leg disability or get tired quickly. Free road trains like they have at the seafront would be good here, as they could drop people off at difficult to get to areas, like the castle entrance. Trams don't really help much in backstreets.

If you want to go into the castle you MUST book online first as you cannot buy tickets at the entrance. This is a bit silly really as not all people have the ability to use the internet. Collection points were available for tickets purchased online though.

Edinburgh has a lot to offer if you are physically fit, and want a short city break. With attractions like the Edinburgh Museum, Castle, Galleries, and the Royal Britannia Yacht, you will always find something to do in any weather.

Not an option for 0 stars.  Visited Edinburgh as tourists.  According to their council it's our responsibility to know whether they are a ulez before we go! Have appealed the ulez fine to the independent tribunal now as the signage of ulez is extremely poor! Have signs on the outskirts of Edinburgh telling tourists they are a ulez zone.  Poor experience.  Streets badly littered with dog poo üí© too!
Got a charge in the post for driving into the clean air zone. I wouldn't visit Edinburgh again. Signage is rubbish, no way to pay before a penalty charge, not even a warning.

Really awful experience. Non existent customer service. Emergency repair reported weeks ago, no response from council. Council plumber then turned up without any notice and waited 5 MINUTES before cancelling job. Council should at least advise on day plumber coming so as to wait in. Do they expect me not to leave the house for weeks until they send out plumber without any notice? Really shocking service however very quick to collect council tax and parking fines!

They gave me a parking ticket even though I paid using Ringo. While they refunded the ticket, they did not admit they were at fault.

For them to continue issuing tickets without conducting any reviews of the area, location codes, and current signage is incompetent and unacceptable.

The City of Edinburgh Council need to reclaim our pavements for pedestrians.

I don‚Äôt want to come over as being against caf√©s, bars and restaurants having outside tables it‚Äôs the exact opposite I am in favour of this.
However there are so many restaurants etc that seem to take the pavements over to the detriment of pedestrians. What this means is pedestrians have to basically join a queue with tourists to shuffle along the pavements outside these establishments.

There doesn‚Äôt appear to be any policing by the council or action taken to prevent this so areas like Morningside, Bruntsfield and the city centre suffer from pavements congested with tables, chairs, advertising boards and planters.

La Locanda Italian Restaurant in Cockburn Street had taken up so much pavement space yesterday it was difficult to walk by without having to walk on the road .

Please , please can Edinburgh Council sort this issue.

These people do everything possible to ignore the people they are supposed to serve. The extent to which they will humiliate themselves in order to ignore you truly defies belief. What makes it possible, together with the fact that they are ALL complicit in this, from the very top to the very bottom, and no matter what they do they there will be no consequences for their behaviour. Sickening.

They don't deserve one star . I have contacted Edinburgh city council several times with regards to our broken underground bucket chute that there employees broke I have video evidence of what happened but I've heard absolutely nothing from them and this has been ongoing since the 5/6/2024 when this incident occurred . I won't be deleting this evidence until Edinburgh city council do the right thing and fix our underground bucket chute at waterfront avenue Edinburgh eh51jd that there careless employees broke . I will not let this go untill they fix the underground bucket chute there employees broke. I've offered to meet up with them so that they can see the video but I've still not heard from them . This is what we council tax for them to sit on there backsides doing nothing. Disgusting service all round.

One of the worst council services I have experienced. Several issues, one being the horrific roads in Edinburgh, it's embarrassing how awful it is and I am sure so many car tyres wrecked! Litter in the city is atrocious especially on the outer regions, people tipping in the beautiful countryside. The amount of ROAD WORKS are shocking, road closures, diversions, I have never seen the like and the roads still look awful and rubbish to drive on!
Feels like a council does not exist or the wrong people are in charge of the city. It's all about tourism and money, not about the people of the city. The extortionate prices we pay on council tax, where does it go?!
I called the council regarding housing, I have been waiting 5 weeks for a reply, managed to get a man on the line after 40 mins waiting, his tone, unfriendly, rude and not professional at all. Spoke over me too. Just horrendous level of service. I could go on and on but things will probably only get worse as the years go on.

If you want to give them money or pay something they are the best council in the world. Otherwise the are useless. The roads are a disgrace, the litter and bin collections are disgusting they are closing ALL the public toilets and they do not maintain the green spaces adequately. They have been accused of corruption and caught on the fiddle.

Went in here the staff are well sort of approachable, I got a answer to my question that's all I really wanted anyway then I got up and said thank you kind sir for assisting me with my question and left the building and gave him a cheery wave - not really.

author_name: ALTAR OF TESTIMONIES PRAYER HOUSE GOD PRESENCE (JESUS WITH US)
review_text: Thank u to the Fhs team what a wonderful people

This place totally sucks, the staff say that they always extremely busy but busy doing nothing, they only sitting and waiting for the good money by the end of the month, that's all they do, they treating members of the public like garbage...

No hot water for 4 days call for repairs to come out I‚Äôm disabled but I also work as how else am I supposed to pay the bills especially the rent, so I ask if they can come out after 5pm as I‚Äôll be home after that the next two days I got a stark NO and a snotty comment that my shower should be hot ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.. it‚Äôs all Flipping cold I don‚Äôt know if I was accidentally speaking Chinese at one point and this was what confused him? I said this at the start of the call It‚Äôs All Cold kitchen and bathroom nothing is even lukewarm it‚Äôs freezing cold ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è it‚Äôs too much to expect the council to do anything this is why I rarely report any issues but I‚Äôd quite like a hot shower after working all day!!!!

Poor poor show. Offer of housing with no safety checks done. Waited over 2 weeks for this to be completed. Told I‚Äôd be phoned back on a specific date with updates, no updates at all. Absolutely disgraceful the way they treat people

I write this review as I want to highlight how dangerous George IV Bridge has become for pedestrians with all the additional parking of buses and taxis especially during the recent Edinburgh Festival.
During the festival this road was used as a car park for buses and taxis and there did not seem to be any control over how many vehicles were there or where they parked. Taxis especially were parked on double yellow lines, in bus stops, beside the scaffolding at the hotel and all down Victoria Street, places where they should not be.
The roads were so busy it is a miracle no one was seriously injured as to cross the road meant taking your life in your hands.

This problem has not gone away despite the festival being over, there are now numerous single decker tour buses, Edinburgh tour buses and mini buses using it as a car park.
It is difficult to cross the road as some buses park where you should cross and also park in LRT bus stops. On Monday our bus had to double park because of tour buses and there was barely enough room to walk single file between buses to reach the pavement. An elderly lady with a Zimmer frame struggled to reach the bus and there was no room to help anyone with children and buggies.
Not only do buses park where they shouldn‚Äôt but they sit with their engines running and can also be there all day as they are just advertising for their evening excursions.
Please, please can something be done to make this street safe again for Edinburgh folk and tourists alike as this cannot go on safely long term.

I'm absolutely shocked! I care for someone who got a sanction so we phoned a welfare fund on Wednesday the 5th of November - received a call from a Josh Campbell on the 6th and he needed more info which we couldn't provide due to having no access to said info ... He said  it was fine, he would call the DWP and request it from them and phone back in the morning of the 7th - no phone came! We called repeatedly to be told by 3:30 the phone call would come!!
Again we called at the time above to be told nothing can be done until the DWP get back to them but Josh will give you a call in next 5 mins ( this was 7 mins before they closed ) They now are shut for weekend and the person in Care I has no electricity or Food! - How Does Josh from the welfare Team Live with himself?

Do your flipping Job!

I‚Äôm probably leaving this comment on the wrong website, sorry if that‚Äôs the case.
A road sweeper came into our street this morning around 10am to clear the gutters of weeds etc, I‚Äôve seen this being done before but never as thorough as this, the driver was exceptional and transformed our road.
Although I still think each house should be clearing their own gutter outside.
The guy was called Alex and it was Glendevon Road
Amazing job thank you.
üëç

Got a parking fine because I paid for my parking ticket in the wrong ticket machine on the same street within 50m distance. Price would be the same, just different bay in front of botanical garden in Edinburgh. Very well played to get some money of tourists.

These people do not even understand what running a public office means. Evidence that a planning application contained false information was presented to them multiple times. They did not even reply. The level of corruption is truly shocking.

I've just moved house to Northview Court and it's not that good,The council decanted me until this time next year to make way for Inchmickery Court to get overhauled and done up,My t v doesn't work in Northview Court because the ariel is broken and the council van wouldn't take my oven to Northview because it was attached to the wall,They have given me a 2 bedroom house which is way to big for me,this should be for a family not just for one 55 year old who doesn't like it,I just hope they fix my Ariel but I'm not holding my breath as they ignore you even when I phoned them to get in touch they just don't and it's bloody ridiculous.

Office has its doors closed to public. Need press buzzer for staff to help with what u need. Mine was picking up edindx form. Staff who answered me , she was polite and got what I asked for. The park close by as gone. And a new one build in its place. Really good space, fields and local shops. If u have children in the high rise flats. The space and park too and with open fields too. Ur child will have the space they need to run around. Only down fall is , teenagers only feel safe in area when with friends or family. And about 6wks ago walking through the area to crewe road. A bunch of lads on bikes all set about 1 man. And , yes, even I actually was scared. These lads are ruthless and I have seen them down at crewe road north at shops and causing trouble with anyone. Taxi drivers to came under attack by these lads... not good ! So more cameras. More security , driving around or on foot. So beware of groups of lads , some on cycle bikes and others on foot. Be safe people
Very good expirience and helpful people!!!

Been on housing list for over 7 years, had no help or advice from this sercice have been officially homeless for over 6 years and sleeping on couches don't help... Maybe if I didn't work I would maybe get help
Professional team with good communication skills. Great factoring service
Really good estate agents, straightforward, pragmatic, realistic and clear simple and timely communication. Can't recommend enough üôè

I have no reason to visit the office as I don't own rural property or Wellington boots. While I do own a gun and a dog, that gun is certainly not a side by side and would be used to defend pheasants from massacre (if its ballistic output were not Nerf foam Darts). I digress though. Office seems lovely and was certainly redolent of the type of set that I imagine segways in to a good subplot for a new storyline on The Archers.  On a serious note the company's office is the nicest in Oban and possibly the nicest office you will find between the town and Scotland's capital Edinburgh.
Very helpful and professional

Rented a small flat in Inverness for over a year. Landlord was nice and really personable during viewing and conversations prior to moving in. Letting agency were ok until the tenancy came to an end and the process was tedious and completely unreasonable. Charged nearly ¬£200 deducted from our security deposit for a ‚Äúsparkle clean‚Äù. Basically took a photo of a tiny mark on bedside table and single dust particle as evidence. If it property doesn‚Äôt look shinier than when you moved in, don‚Äôt expect your deposit back. Not happy. There were also items on our inventory that we‚Äôre never in the property. You‚Äôll notice most positive reviews are landlords and not tenants.üí∞

We used Scottish Highland Property to sell a building-plot in our garden.
Throughout our dealings with SHP, Ewen and his Team always provided a professional, knowledgeable, supportive, helpful and friendly service which was excellent value for money.
SHP is a first-class organisation which we would recommend to others without reservation.
Bill and Anne Anderson
Helped us through the process of changing fron Holiday lets to Long term lets. They are allways there with good advice if problems occur,in a professional and friendly manner.
I have used SHP a both a tenant and a landlord and the management service is excellent.

Can't thank Margaret enough for all the help she gave from initial enquiry to finalising the purchase of my 1st home, she kept me updated all the way and was always there if I needed advice. Margaret definitely takes pride in her work and really invests in her clients which puts you totally at ease in what is normally a stressful time. Thanks Margaret your a üåü

Margaret at Highland Residential was fantastic. I was not sure what to expect and Margaret explained everything to me.  I felt that Margaret read my application and found a place that was well suited to me. Thank you so much for this, I would highly recommend them.

the worst company I've ever dealt with. If I knew that such incompetent people worked there I wouldn't have bought a house from them. They have a mess in the company and paperwork, telephone contact is almost impossible!
Very good experience, Margaret was a fantastic help and kept me informed throughout. Couldn't have asked for better help and support when purchasing my first home
Selling our flat was made very easy by Margaret as she was amazing throughout the whole process and she kept us up to date with everything.
Website is buggy, very slow, properties often don't load as page gets stuck on 'loading more properties' - tried edge, chrome, FF, all up to date, same problem occurs consistently.

Looking at the website it would imply that there is a slowdown in house sales. The majority listed are either sold or under offer. HSPC appears to be struggling whilst others have much more activity. Perhaps the organisation need a refresh
My wife loves browsing your website even  tho we can't afford most properties
The best place for properties in the Highlands. Excellent website.
Outdated software for there platform, unable to view any house on any smart TV

An absolute joke when it comes to the facotoring side. We pay a huge some of money every month which is unjustifiable for level of services we get in return. Repairs are mot done in time to the close and when done they are not to good standards.
Staff are not being helpful and its just appalling they always are on top of things when they want to charge us extra for close electricity bill
Honestly i am really disappointed and hoping this might help to chose their factors with better knowledge unlike us

I have been an owner in Ibrox for 36 years , building gone through a major repair programme at a Cost of ¬£300, 000. The Association obtaining most of the properties and becoming the Factor,  Owners have no chance with this Association, especially if you are flooded by one of their, properties, they wash their hands of the situation I have now experienced it on 3 occasions having to pay insurance excess fees,  of ¬£450,  they aren‚Äôt interested in offering any gesture of good will in any manner!

Recently painted our entrance door and their fence attached to their ground floor flat added lights , and planters looks great , asked for them to pay a share, again not interested! ,

My experience of them over the years is , they can not cope! They have obtained to many properties, factoring to many properties, they can‚Äôt even put in place a back court maintenance program.  They rather the courts be full of rubbish, abandoned furniture, etc.

Not however how they report their progress in their News Update Magazine.

It‚Äôs about time they got the finger out in so many areas, and provide a service they are being paid large amounts of money to do so!

I only interact with the Govan Housing Association in regards to my factoring so cannot comment on anything else. I have to majorly compliment Allan in the factoring department though. I‚Äôve phoned a few times about various things (bins not being emptied, payments etc) and he has always been very patient and helpful. I appreciate all the help!

Just adding another update,  been waiting on results of the meeting
I'm not very impress with this . Also been waiting  on an a letter to received off this  nothing has been sent, this as been a near month,when I sent an email she told of me the points I've received an will send another letter  out this as not happen as I haven't received  anything  I'm not very impress with them.  If they have no let's to  lease say so I rather not be time waste...I'm n full time employment an been  offered a relocation to this area hence why I went here first wish I didn't.   Waste of space 2bh

Don't ever trust them!. They want just you to sign the agreement documents with big Smile . After that they don't care about you anymore. The repairs take years. Be ware of dampness and single glazed during winter. I wonder why some people gave them 5 stars, may be it was ages ago they used to be good. Hehe hehehe!! ü§ê

They haven't taken out the trash for a month, the containers are full to the top, there's nowhere to put the trash. Rats have appeared that jump out of the containers onto people who come to throw out the trash.
Incompetent, unprofessional, they don't inform about arrears, wait as long as possible, and then send payment reminders. They act to the detriment of tenants. Mice and rats run around the buildings.

Dont know where to start - appalling housing association. Moved in to my current property almost 4 years, kitchen already had integrated hob & oven fitted for the previous tenant , on opening the oven to use after i had moved in i realised there was no shelves to be able to cook anything in it ü•¥, ordered and paid for them myself , then discovered the actual oven didnt work properly , keep turning on and off and beeping. Called repairs was told not their responsibility as the warranty had ran out , but the appliance wasnt installed for me and wasnt my warranty either , was then told the oven and hob were "a gift" from the housing. Not much use when i cant use it. They said tenant responsibility to get it fixed at my own expense. After speaking with neighbour re previous tenant it was noted the oven had never worked properly and housing had also gave an old age pensioner that lived here before me an INDUCTION hob that requirer more costly pots and pans to be bought. Also - utility room has never been finished properly as kitchens re fitted during covid but when queried i was told previous tenant liked it the way it was ü´£. This also not true. Rents gone up another ¬£40 a month yet trying to get repairs done isnt great. Rung on 3rd april to report a couple of repairs, never heard anything since. Ordered a new oven from this months rent money as i do not believe it is my responsibility to have an appliance that was installed for the previous tenant fixed at my own cost and i meed a working oven to cook food. They can take me to court for it . Also had a joiner a few years ago from Mears tell me that he was instructed by the repairs team
Not to enter into any discussion with me as im a serial complainer , the guy was shocked as i was offering him a tea or a coffee and chatting away and he said he felt really bad as he was told not to talk to me. Too many other things to list.
Worse housing assocition in Scotland and worse housing offecers i have ever dealt with so glad i dont have a house with them

Only reason this even gets 1 star is because of Laura and John. I had a kitchen fitted after a year of complaining. For the last year me, my 2 girls (11 and 8 year old), my mum and dog have been unwell at times and been able to smell gas slightly. Clearly our sense of smell isn‚Äôt great as my partner popped in to check on my mum only to be hit with an all mighty smell of gas. I called SGN out and they found my gas connection to cooker was illegal. Not only had the gas engineer Thenue employed not put gas paste or gas tape on the threaded fitting, he put a fibre water washer in it and left hand tight (photo attached). The SGN engineer told me we are all lucky we aren‚Äôt dead!! I have attached report and as you can see there was a 12mb drop (you aren‚Äôt even allowed a 1mb drop). Safe to say I‚Äôll be going to a lawyer to seek legal advice tomorrow. Only saviour for Thenue is that both Laura and John dealt with this diligently and are very good at their job. To be continued‚Ä¶.
Helpful and lovely staff

factor_name: Thomson & Company Property Management Services Ltd
review_text: I used Thomson Residental to manage my rental property, and also recently for the sale of my property. I chose Thomson Residential because I wanted a local estate agents and wanted to avoid the bigger chains that can sometimes make you feel like a number rather than a client. Thomson's really exceeded my expectations - their communication was brilliant throughout. Being a small team you know who you're speaking to and get such a personable experience. They were exceptionally proactive and responsive for both my tenant and I. When it came to selling my property, the team did a fantastic job marketing and then closing the sale. I was delighted with the outcome and it truly was hassle free with the Thomson team doing all the work to get the best result. I'd highly recommend Thomson Residential, particularly if you want a more local and personal experience. Thank you to the team at Thomson Residential!

factor_name: Thomson & Company Property Management Services Ltd
review_text: I recently sold my flat through Thomson Residential and would not hesitate to recommend them. Jane was fantastic, she kept me updated on viewings and provided feedback. This is a local estate agent with great knowledge of the area. I felt I received an excellent service, any calls or emails were answered timeously and their fees were very competitive.  The initial offer on my flat fell through, due to extenuating circumstances, no one's fault. Jane and her team were brilliant.  She got my flat back up for sale that very same day, reassured me it would sell again very quickly. It did, going to a closing date the following week. Great result and I would definitely use their services again.

factor_name: Thomson & Company Property Management Services Ltd
review_text:
Highly recommend the guys at Thomsons.  I met Neil when viewing a property and was impressed with  how he handled the viewings so I knew I would instruct them when I came to sell my property.

I recieved good advice from Thomsons on offers/going to closing etc and their costs are very reasonable too. I would highly recommed using Thomsons over any of the larger estate agents. Felt like they really cared about getting the best result for me and not just "another job".

Thanks again to the team at Thomsons, first class service.

factor_name: Thomson & Company Property Management Services Ltd
review_text: Was in great hands. Started off as tenants and had incredible service from Thomson Residential. All issues with the apartment were fixed within 24-48 hours. We then asked if our landlords would be willing to sell the apartment. Once they accepted, Thomson made the sale and transition smooth and simple. Couldn't recommend more!

factor_name: Thomson & Company Property Management Services Ltd
review_text: I had such a positive experience with Thomson's from start to finish, they guided me through the selling process with patience, and genuine care. I was ovewhelemed at the thought of selling  but they made everything so much easier by keeping me informed and supported every step of the way. I‚Äôm so grateful for their expertise and would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a reliable, friendly, and dedicated estate agency.

review_text: It's a factor 's office. They are our factors and in the 6 years that we've lived here, they always listen to any issues and answer any questions that we have had.

review_text: Got my bathroom upgrade and love it. Professional job especially under these changed times. great bunch of lads too üëå
recommendable housing quick response to problems that arose in the apartment. people working there are very nice.

I really love this housing association. They are always straight on the ball with the repairs. I got offered a lovely new home that i am honestly over the moon about as I didn‚Äôt want to change housing association. Jennifer, James, Mehal, derek and Kelly keep up the good work you do for the association.

Staff are professional, curious and efficient. A y repairs are done at speed.  The HA go over and above to keep their properties in a good state of repair and carry out regular upgrades to kitchens etc. well deserved 5*

Absolutely usless, I moved temporarily to my family on Tollcross beacuse of unfortune events in my life, write an email to them seeking advice explaining my situation etc. Just seeking some "help" in hard time but didn't receive any reply for weeks, and then I got letter from council asking me if I still stay there, if yes pay us haha, so that's the service from Tollcross HA, clearly someone read it but instead of replying they "grass" this information to Council(they where already informed by me) so I think they should be ashamed of the service they provided in this situation, usless!
I Had a young girl help me so much in the one day, Caitlin helped me through. So much with advice and checking over forms, so I was handing in all the correct paperwork.

Beautiful walk from the car park stunning views surrounding cairngorm mountains dry hot day streams had dried up further up make sure take water for dog as well as your self at the view point which is just before the mast there is a bench you can sit and relax
Beautiful place with stunning scenery. EV type 2 charger in the carpark of the Tourist centre.
Worth a visit if you like nature wildlife the views in the area are amazing too
Great place to ride your bike on some smooth trails.
Beautiful in this weather

Toner and McCartney have managed the letting of our property for many years. We have always found them to be prompt to deal with matters that are part and parcel of letting properties. Should we consider re -entering the letting market in the future we would contact Toner and McCartney without hesitation.

I dealt with Toner and McCartney for many years as a tenant.
During my tenancy they always responded to any issues I had regardless as to how trivial they were, my mind was always put at rest and nothing was a hassle.
Sadly I lost my husband in 2020 and had to end my tenancy. The staff were very sympathetic and were amazing with the move out process. No pressure was put on me to speed up the process of me moving out.
The fact that the owners and staff are family orientated they are very approachable. You can call up and talk to anyone of them as they all know what is going on and when.
I am 100% positive that any landlord using Toner and McCartney will receive the same treatment as tenants - this being when you approach them you are all that matters at that point! Your satisfaction is their only concern.
I am currently in a rental with another company but hoping that Toner and McCartney get a suitable property for me on their books soon as I would rather deal with the team there.

As a landlord and client of many years Toner and McCartney consistently prove to be a highly experienced and trustworthy team.  They are quick to resolve any day to day issues that arise through property management with my best interests at the core of their service. Always a pleasure dealing with the girls in the office whether that is over the phone or face to face. They have consistently remained both courteous and professional throughout my time with them and wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend them.

I have only the highest praise for the ladies of Toner & McCartney. They were so very helpful and empathetic when I was suddenly made homeless after my house was involved in a gas explosion. They went the extra mile in ensuring that my move went smoothly, and they made themselves available to sort out initial minor problems. I highly recommend this company for their professionalism.

I've been using Toner and McCartney since they established their business a few years ago. The office has a detailed knowledge of the local area and I have been guided by their advice on many occasions. The management service they offer has always been professional and they have always responded to my questions quickly, resolving any issues with my property efficiently and smoothly. They use a range of reliable local tradesman and I've never had any reason to doubt their selection. I've been very happy with the Lynn, Julie and Wendy and can recommend them wholeheartedly.

I had a wonderful experience with Touchstone. Throughout my tenancy, they were always responsive and made sure my concerns were promptly addressed. The checkout process was smooth and hassle-free. I especially appreciate Karen‚Äôs professionalism and timely support whenever I needed assistance. I highly recommend Touchstone to anyone considering renting with them!

Tried renting a property with them recently, even went for viewing, when my wife's employer's reference was pending we spoke to the reference agent and provided them with necessary documents and even asked if they want HR to contact them directly, they said they now have all they needed, only to be turned down by the letting agent that my wife's employment reference was not successful, I immediately spoke to the referencing agent to ask why such a feedback if they themselves said they have all they needed, and they confirmed same and ask we tell the letting agent call them directly to discuss this, I came to the conclusion that there was more to this, because if the referencing agent is saying something else and the letting agent is saying the decision was based on the reference and insisting nothing can be done, then this is highly unfair. I even asked if they can review this again and if they need any information I would provide, but they said no, I even offered to get a guarantor but they said not for a mid rent, but on the initial form they asked if we can get a guarantor, at that point I knew there was more to this. I read feedbacks from others here during the application and had my doubts, but I can confirm same. I don't think there are any process that can't be reviewed most especially if customer considered it to be unfair, but insisting nothing can be done really shows there are more to it.

We were contacted by Touchstone to ask if we were still interested in a flat we'd enquired about a while ago. It looked really nice and was cheaper than our current flat so we decided to apply. However, we heard nothing back after sending the application, not even a confirmation that they'd received it. A week after applying, we emailed them to ask about the status of our application and again no reply. At this point I looked up the reviews for the agency and we immediately decided to withdraw our application. We've not received a reply to the email asking to withdraw, either. Me and my partner were so excited to move into our new property. However, on the week of moving in we were not given any information.
Until the day before of the provisional move in date, where I had to email to get an update on our move. This is where I was told that it was delayed because there was contractors in completing work.. At this point we were assured that we would get the keys the following week...
The next day, we was contacted, by email, to say that we was no longer able to move into this property due to 'unforeseen circumstances' Which later on they told us was due to not allowing pets at the property. However, this was NEVER stated in the ad, not mentioned whatsoever beforehand. In fact, we had the agreement that we would pay an extra ¬£20 a month for our dog. Which we was fine with.
Which is why, you can understand this came as a shock to us.
At this point, we had booked a removal service, booked time off work, handed our notice into our current property and booked cleaners for our current property.
We feel we have been misled to believe we would be getting this property. Since confirming we will not be moving. The 'letting experts'/touchstone has passed across all our personal details to bill companies and the council, so we are now getting contacted constantly asking for payments and when we moved into the property.
We were excited to move into this property originally, but unfortunately we have now been under extreme stress and pressure to organise things on our side, to ensure we do not become homeless.
We feel, this whole situation has been handled in an extremely unprofessional manner and would 100% NOT recommend this business to anyone that is wanting to have a successful and smooth moving process.
Currently on the 30/05/25, we are still being contacted by companies outwith this business regarding the move that we never got.

We rented with RPM for two years, and throughout that had no real issues. Most issues we brought up got passed straight to the landlord who solved them promptly, and the letting agency were fast to respond and easy to communicate with.

When we decided to move out we were warned by a friend who had rented with them recently that they would try to come for our deposit on baseless grounds - in my friends case they initially tried to take his whole deposit before backing down to a still absurd ¬£80 each when they challenged their claims.

Sure enough, shortly after moving out we were hit with a huge list of claims relating to cleaning, repairs and even removal of items that previous tenants had left in the flat. After we challenged the claims and demanded proof, we received a set of photos covering two of the flat's four rooms and about a third of the points they raised. We again challenged them, and eventually received the photos taken in the inspection before we moved in, which were of a laughable quality and completely confirmed every point we had been making about the state of the flat when we moved in. At this point they gave up.

The degree of incompetence and either apathy or malignance that the agency handles the inspection process with is frankly astonishing. I don't have enough evidence to confidently say that they have a pattern of preying on students but it seems likely. It's regrettable that this spoiled an otherwise decent letting experience.
