The whole process was flawless and I would highly recommend them for anyone looking to sell property in the Glasgow West End area. .

Seamless Selling and Buying Experience ‚Äì Highly Recommended!

We recently sold our house and bought our new home through Clyde Property West End, and the entire experience was absolutely outstanding from start to finish.

The team (Rachel and Jack to name a couple) was professional, responsive, and incredibly knowledgeable. They guided us through both transactions with clarity and confidence, making what could have been a stressful process feel smooth and well-managed. Their advice on pricing and marketing helped our property sell quickly and at a price we were happy with.

On the buying side, their communication was excellent throughout, and we always felt informed and supported at every stage.

We‚Äôre so grateful for their hard work, honesty, and dedication. We wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend Clyde Property West End to anyone looking to sell or buy a home. A true five-star service!

I would highly recommend Clyde Property West End! They have been absolutely fantastic in helping me sell my property. Millie was especially great ‚Äì always helpful and proactive. She guided me through the process and kept me regularly updated, which made the whole experience smooth and stress-free. I wouldn't hesitate to use Clyde Property again when it's time to sell my next home.
Services from Clyde were very reliable. The support from the entire team, especially from Rachel and Jack, was really helpful to make the process of selling a property smoothly.

Clyde property have been great in helping me find the flat of my dreams. Kept me up to date on all properties of interest followed up after each visit to answer any questions I might have had. Very helpful with excellent communication throughout! Isla K

had a poor experience where I‚Äôd booked a viewing, showed up, rung the doorbell and was unable to get into the property or reach the company by phone for around 20 minutes, at which point i gave up and left.

on the coming monday, i was told they were ‚Äúdefinitely in the property‚Äù and that the agents can‚Äôt be contacted because they are not given business phones, making them impossible to reach.
I didn‚Äôt receive any kind of apology from them for wasting my time, which was disrespectful.

We were a tenant with this organisation for 3 years - I‚Äôve always had private landlords and had heard of the issues that people have with lettings agents, I thought surely it can‚Äôt be that bad?

I was wrong.

Every single issue we had whilst living at our flat was always left a ridiculously long time (roof leaks, toilet leaks etc) or a mistake would happen from their side, over complicate everything and then it would be a big mess. It actually got so bad that we ended up dealing with our landlords directly.

When we handed in our notice, we just knew there would be issues as that‚Äôs how Clyde Property operate.

They tried to change our utilities provider one month before moving out - to which I had to spend an afternoon sorting out as we were infact leaving - which confused everyone. They sent a photographer to take photos of our flat the week before we had left, so someone was trying to get into our flat whilst still there. They messed up our inspection date and were told on multiple occasions the locks were changed during our tenancy, but of course they gave the old keys to the inspector which in turn meant our inspection was done one day later whilst our landlord had sorted someone to fit a new boiler. When we did get the half done inspection, our address was completely wrong. I was so nervous about dealing with this organisation after vacating because their attention to detail and lack of communication is honestly some of the worst experiences I‚Äôve ever had!

Fortunately, we had a very good relationship with our landlords directly and they were happy to release our deposit ASAP. Sounds like there would have been delays otherwise.

The departments lack of speaking to one another and the lack of attention to detail had been infuriating to say the least. More often than not, you‚Äôre speaking to someone who can‚Äôt be bothered to be polite enough and can‚Äôt accept their mistakes. We will never deal with this company on any capacity again, it was that bad. An absolute shambles at every possible step.

They were awful when they were selling our flat. Told us we had offers from people who hadn't even submitted notes of interest just to rush through the sale. The "offers" were just passing comments people made when asked what they thought the flat was worth.

When we challenged them on this they wouldn't even concede that what they had said could be misleading and were unbelievably patronising.

Bad management, no care for furnishings and no proper monitoring of condition of rental property.
I had rented out a furnished flat with Clyde Property in the West End of Glasgow. It was in prime location and was our family home.

I informed the letting agent before the rental in 2023 that I would be away for a year due to personal circumstances.

During the visit by the agent, I explained the sofa and bed had been purchased from Flexform and was expensive and explained it would need care especially as it was a coloured cream.

Clyde failed to convey the information to their regular client and he washed the sofa. It had not been dry cleaned and resulted in the fabric shrinking.

Furthermore it was then forced back on to the sofa and the ends of the fabric became torn. It also affected the shape of the sofa.

I had a management contract with Clyde and did not receive regular inventory reports. Even after highlighting the issue to them via email they failed to mention it in their inventory report.

For 3 months I have chased to get the tenant and Clyde to get the fabric replaced and sent quotations. I did not get anywhere.

Many further issues had occurred during the year where Clyde were quick to make decisions without informing myself the landlord.

I am now left with a massive repair bill on a sofa. Clyde Property's response at the moment is to make a claim on the deposit and take the client to court. In the meantime they have rented out another flat to him.

thanks Clyde Property.
Friendly, exceptionally professional, very supportive while keeping to an agreed timeframe. I am very grateful and highly recommend Clyde West End Letting Team.

Clyde manage various properties I have, and because of the size of the operation they have the bandwidth to deal with every aspect of managing and vetting new tenants to dealing with property issues which I can rectify of they can arrange professional tradesmen to rectify. Laws and regulations with respect to renting property changes frequently and Clyde ensure that I am on the right side of the law and supporting my tenants responsibly. Thanks to Judy who handles my property, and area director Craig who I have interacted with from day one, and takes a hands on interest in the business.
Great place for our course but not enough parking.
Friendly staff that are helpful

We viewed our dream property in July 2025 which was for sale through West Homes, Killearn. After viewing, Roscoe contacted us promptly to find out our opinion of it. We expressed our adoration for the property and from that moment, Roscoe worked his magic made our offer happen! After having our offer accepted, everything moved very quickly and Roscoe came over in the following days to carry out valuation on our current property and organised the media package for photographs to be taken for our advertisement. Roscoe is an expert of the market and provides excellent advise. Our current property became live on the market by the end of the week to which Roscoe and his team Hannah and Felicity worked hard and arranged back-to-back viewings. We accepted an offer which unfortunately fell through a few weeks before completion which put us in a very stressful situation however, Roscoe and his team provided reassurance and at our request put our current property back on the market again - same day and worked endlessly to re-contact previous viewers and new viewers as well as ensuring the sellers of our new property were aware of the situation and assuring them. After what could have been a very stressful few months if it had not been for Roscoe and his team we eventually completed on our sale and purchase in October 2025 and collected our keys which was an extremely happy day! Roscoe even gave us a bottle of prosecco on collection which was a lovely touch. Throughout the process Roscoe and his team provided a very personal and professional service. We would not hesitate in using this estate agents again and would highly recommend them for those who would like an outstanding and professional experience.

Excellent, personal service. Roscoe and his team, particularly Claudine in the Callander office, were outstanding in their care and attention to detail. We had an offer within two weeks and were kept up to date throughout.
Our purchaser lived overseas and the excellent communication initiated and maintained by the team formed an important and essential part of the the process. We could not be more satisfied than we are with our experience of working with West Homes and would highly recommend them.

West were excellent when we sold our house earlier this year. They gave us good advice on the local market and kept us sane when there was a delay further down the chain. West were very proactive in investigating & updating us when the various legal teams failed to do so. I would definitely recommend the team in their Killearn office!

We were very happy with the service we had from West Homes.  They were always eager to answer questions, and had a cheerful manner whenever we spoke to them.  It is good to have a local team who know the area well and can present the property to its best advantage.
West Homes were great from start to finish. Our house was sold quickly. The process was helped along by Roscoe and co with regular updates and advice. Would highly recommend

Excellent service from Roscoe and the team, the promotional video for our property was stunning. After 2 weeks of viewings and 4 offers we accepted a final offer.
Lastly big shout to Claudine who greased the wheels on several occasions during the legal process.
Nice Helpful and did weƒ∫l for me and my buyer

Joanne is the most wonderful person that will go above and beyond for you with finding the perfect place to live. I lost count with how many places she showed us in an area where it is hard to find a rental, but she was determined to get our little family settled. Not only did she find us the best place to live but also sorted out a little cosy house for granny too. Also, she has been so fast with any requests or issues we‚Äôve had while living in our home.
If you need to find a place to live and you need someone who is friendly, trustworthy and just generally a lovely human being then I couldn‚Äôt recommend Joanne highly enough.

I need to say a huge thank you to Joanne Bilton, who has been instrumental in helping myself, and my partner to find our beautiful new home in Fort William. I've seen many reviews of companies and their staff, but this review is heart-felt.

Joanne has from hundreds of miles away, helped me through every step of the letting process, and gone way above and beyond anythinƒù I could ever have expected or hoped for in regard to duty of care or level of service.

There were some hurdles that I needed to overcome to ensure a successful letting, but Joanne worked around the clock to ensure that I was well informed and up-to-date with everything that was going on, what I needed to do, and what I could expect from her.

as someone who has worked in customer focused roles for many years, I have been more than impressed by her knowledge, commitment, and level of care.

I can only say thank you so very much for everything she has done for myself and my family, and making my dream of living in Fort William a possibility.

5* service on every level. I hope this review makes it's way to the directors of the business, because Joanne deserves all the plaudits for her outstanding service. She really is an asset to West Property Lettings, and I feel in good hands going forward.

Thank you Joanne

üëèüëèüëè

This company was fully engaged with me selling my house from start to finish.
The communication was excellent at all times.
After the initial setting up of the sale with Nicola, I was effectively handed over to Annabelle, the negotiator who kept both me and the potential buyers fully informed - so that everyone knew what was happening.  She and I were in close touch over the evolving bids and  I felt that I was being really well looked after.

I was confident that West Properties would be professional at all times and they were.
As far as advice goes, West Properties understands the market for both buyers and sellers on Mull and ensured that I, as a client, understood the market too so that my expectations were managed realistically. On the other hand my input and ideas were listened to and acted on as well.
As someone who was not able to do the viewings of my house myself, it was a real benefit that West Properties had someone on the island who would do this,

All in all the sale of my house went really smoothly and I feel fortunate that I chose this young vibrant, switched on, team to do the job.  I highly recommend them!
Joanne going out of her way to ruin my renting expierence, rude and intrusive on my personal details to people without my permission.

I recently used West to purchase a property. From the start of the process Lucy was open, responsive and extremely helpful to me. Nothing was too much trouble. Even during the pandemic I felt I could communicate easily with the Team. I would thoroughly recommend West Property.

On this occassion I am giving wlc 5 stars, well for Jill Wisekal.
I really can't thank this housing officer enough.
Jill has went over and above to her tenant , being respectful and understanding.
In all honesty I have had nothing but bad experiences with the council.alot down to my adhd and autism.
Jill has also been soo patient with me and ensuring I understand things etc etc.
Honestly she is a very valuable asset to wlc and other employees could learn an awful lot from how she carries herself and her job performance.
Well done Jill and thankyou soo, soo much

Ignorant workers who come onto your property without permission, any work takes forever to be completed, idling lorries which sit with their engines running for hours outside people's homes. Bins overflowing and not collected despite leaving out for a week over the Christmas and New year period. Almost a year to repair a flooding storm drain. Rubbish everywhere in Broxburn and such dirty streets. A joke. I've lived in many different locations and WLC are by far the worst council.

The repairs are always done to a high standard and the staff are really good and professional. But trying to get through to the repairs team on the phone is really bad. The waiting times are getting longer and the website does not cover all eventualities, so sometimes you need to speak to someone. You can request a call back but if you miss it you have to go through the call process again as you don't get a second call. The staff are very helpful when you do eventually get through. After all, it's not their fault.

It's already a farce that we now have to pay extra for garden refuse uplift ( BTW  it was NEVER free so cut the crap saying it was )  but a reminder email for when it needs repayed would be handy, you know, like my neighbours got. But not me. Now I have a full brown bin for another 2 weeks. Thanks west lothian council.  For nowt

Disgusting and lazy people. Had bother in my area with people dumping stuff in our bins. So it was the councils bright idea to replace our bins with bigger bins which has made it worse. Then decided to cut the amount of times the bins were getting emptied to once a month. This has resulted in the bins been full and people dumping stuff in front of the bins. The bin men are now refusing to do a job that they are paid to do. I guess we should just refuse to pay any council tax for this bunch of lazy dossers.

I was very lucky to have been a tenant with ELPM for almost four years and highly recommend them. They are by far the best letting agency I‚Äôve been with in Edinburgh! Communication has always been clear, all works done quickly and just such a joy to deal with them.

ELPM do absolutely everything to an exceptionally high standard!  Time and time again they have gone above and beyond!  Renting a house from ELPM is like moving into a property that is being lived in for the very first time!  An all round wonderful experience!!  Highly recommend!!!

Dishonest, disorganised, and spiteful people. Talk to three people, get three different answers, all of which are unreliable. Long story short, verbal agreements were disregarded after move out, leading to a deposit dispute. They are purposely waiting until each deadline of the dispute resolution just to cause inconvenience.

Further, they changed the flat from furnished to unfurnished after we moved out and they're trying to recover their own removal cost from our deposit by claiming things of ours were the issue (literally, coats in the hall and food in the refrigerator, and again, previously discussed). By agreement, I left well over a thousand pounds worth of furniture for the landlord. They were happy to receive it, but want to nickel and dime me over nonsense.

If you're unlucky enough to get stuck with this agency, do not trust them at all. Get absolutely everything in writing. Demand it. Don't trust their smiles and their "Don't worry about it, it's fine." They will conveniently forget about it when it comes time to get your money back.

Very disappointing, agreed to rent a cottage long term, after living in it for a month more and more unsanitary and shoddy cover-ups became obvious. The director of the company handling the property came to take a look and was rude, loud and clearly annoyed that I had dared to point out the problems. I have never experienced such unpleasant behaviour from a letting agent before and can only warn prospective clients to be aware of this. Definitely not to be recommended.

We have recently rented a property with ELPM and can highly recommend! One of the best experiences we have had with a rental agency. From finding our rental property to moving in, we have found them to be extremely helpful and informative. Fantastic communication and quick to respond to any issues, we feel very well supported as tenants. Special thanks to Emma who has been amazing throughout the process.

Been a tenant with Lothian Homes for over 4 years. Any repairs are carried out quickly and any issues always resolved. The team are brilliant and so approachable. Inspections are carried out twice a year and gives tenants the chance to discuss any issues while giving the landlord peace of mind that the property is being maintained. All round great agents and I would recommend to anyone :)

I have been a tenant with Lothian Homes for almost 6 years now and my experience with them has been fantastic. They always go above and beyond expectations. All repairs are dealt with very quickly and the girls in the office are very professional and welcoming any time I've had to contact them. The property I let feels like home to me and that goes a long way. I would highly recommend this letting agency not only to tenants but to landlords also :-)

I was a tenant with Lothian Homes 4 Let for many years. The girls were all lovely and very approachable. Any repairs were dealt with quickly. Inspections were made every 3 months which would give the Landlords peace of mind.
I'd definitely recommend them and would still be with them if it wasn't for a change in my circumstances.

Lothian Homes 4 Let give very good service to both landlords and tenants. The staff are always friendly and attentive. They look after the property and make sure any tenant issues are dealt with as quickly and as fairly as possible. This approach has retained long term tenants and minimized unwanted void periods. I would definitely recommend them.

I am a tenant, and I have been a tenant with Lothian Homes for 2 years and half and it's a great agency
Always active to help about any concerns
Collette always does her best to assist us
Thanks to all the staff for being helpful and always available for any concerns

Keep doing your great job üåü

Having been with Letting Solutions for many years as a landlord I cant recommend them highly enough. They have professionally and efficiently handled all property matters in a prompt and friendly way. The property has been very well managed in terms of good tenants, maintenance, regulatory issues and monitoring. It is so reassuring to have this support knowing your property requirements are so well attended to. A very big thankyou to Brian and all the excellent team.

I have had a positive moments of truth with the Letting Solution since my very first call as a prospective customer and till date as tenant in this property for 3 years now! The team keeps very high professional and quality standards. Clear and timely communication - acts on any calls or emails swift and has an attitude (proactive follow-ups) to close any issues as fast they can. The team knows this business well and also know what needs to be done to keep customer happy. I would highly recommend Letting Solutions.

I have used Letting Solutions in past on a ‚Äòfind a tenant‚Äô basis. I decided that I wanted a full management of my property so contacted Letting Solutions. I worked with Rebecca to get the property in a position to market. Rebecca‚Äôs did an amazing job. She explained everything clearly and guided me through the process. The house has now been let with a good Tenant in place.

Rebecca was professional, pleasant and great to work with. I would not hesitate to recommend her to Landlords looking for a letting solution.

Having recently taken our property off the rental market after 8+ years i have to applaud Letting Solutions for the very professional service they provided. From the initial contact requesting advice on how to place the property on the Rental Market as first time landlords, to managing it while we lived abroad, to finally having it taken off the market and prepared for selling.
At every step of the way they were very responsive, and always prepared to go the extra mile, even providing advice outside their remit. The team at Letting Solutions made our rental experience a very stress free one from start to finish
Well done all and keep up the good work

I have recently started using Letting Solutions for the full management of my apartment , excellent service all round , I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend , in particular Rebecca helping me through very professional service.
Very quickly found me a tenant.

factor_name: West One Property Management & Factoring Ltd
review_text: I've had 4 different landlords whilst living in Dundee and West One are definitely the best landlords I've had so far. Any maintenance issues I've had have been resolved within 24 hours. They're very quick with emails. All the staff are lovely and always willing to help. I've lived in the studio flat for 2 years now and the location, access to shops, access to uni, facilities in the flat and rent price are great. Definitely would recommend West One for students.

factor_name: West One Property Management & Factoring Ltd
review_text: I could not recommend a Dundee-based rental agency more than WestOne - Angela is especially lovely and always made sure to inform us of any visits at least a week in advance, which was beneficial to my friend and I who were having a very busy year. WestOne also make sure to keep their properties at an excellent standard, which makes their places feel a little bit more like home. Best rental agency in Dundee!

factor_name: West One Property Management & Factoring Ltd
review_text: We've been staying in a West One Property for the past 3 years and couldn't even begin to say how happy we've been with our entire experience. From our initial inquiry into the property, any questions we had were answered quickly. The flat was fitted with up to date and stylish appliances. Any repairs that we needed were done immediately and to a high standard.  The staff is lovely and always willing to help. Couldn't recommend West One enough.

factor_name: West One Property Management & Factoring Ltd
review_text:
I have dealt with numerous landlords and letting agents in Dundee and truthfully can say West-one has been the best experience. We have personally been dealing with Angela who works tirelessly to make sure we are happy with our flat, and is willing to go above and beyond the line of duty. Our experience so far has been a pleasure.
Thanks guys
Jamie, Matt and Steve

factor_name: West One Property Management & Factoring Ltd
review_text:
I've been in multiple different properties and I can safely say that West One Properties stands above the rest for multitude of reasons.
These are some of the reasons why:-
‚Ä¢	Location ~ 3 min walk from University of Dundee and within good walking distance from Lidl and Tesco

‚Ä¢	Friendly management ~ Management come off as friendly and will happily go the extra mile for you.

‚Ä¢	Terrific technicians ~ Easy to talk to technicians that if you mention something that needs fixing, they will get it done within that day or the next.

‚Ä¢	Great price ~ The price range comparison to many flats that are close to University of Dundee.
Great service from Kenny and Jack. No job too small. They found me a great gas/electricity renewal deal for both my house and business.
they really just do great service Highly recommended.

Credit to Louise Wilson and Karen Shaw who are always kind and helpful. Unhappy with how I was treated by a member of staff which resulted in unnecessary stress for me. I will make a formal complaint against this person as they should not be talking to people in this manner or taking actions without clarifying first. Extremely unprofessional attitude and poor communication skills, using threatening language, causing me if withholding information (which I had always informed senior team about) and refusing to see the other side or inform themselves of arrangements and communications I had with the senior team. Their rash actions resulted in extra costs for me. i now avoid calling them in case this person (who shouted at me over the phone) picks up. Train staff to communicate better with clients- you never know how their words and actions could affect their life.

They keep their mutual exchange list (an Excel spreadsheet) online. I contacted them and expressed an interest in two properties. And then.... nothing. They never replied to tell me anything. A year on and they randomly email, asking me if I want to stay on the list? Why did no-one ever reply last time? I asked.

They tell me they they can't even identify the applicants that I identified on their spreadsheet .. because I gave the row number of their spreadsheet and not the ID # which is sitting right next to it and running concurrently, just like the row numbers. They're telling us that they literally can't look at the list & verify their own information. These idiot excuses really make you laugh out loud.

It's clear they don't know how to use Excel either, to drag their numbers down, and that's why their spreadsheet at time of writing has Row #s and ID #s both starting at 2, but finishing at 206 & 207, respectively. Incompetence sustained by gaslighting, just like every other HA in Scotland.
Houseing association not intrested about obiding about tenancy agreement to scared to face. Face over neighbour issues avoid west of Scotland houseing association at all costs wish I had done end off

I got new windows aprox 4 or 5 years ago  at 5 portland after 2 weeks the rain started leaking through my sills I recorded it they sent the subcontractor to survey his conclusion was yes there's water leaking but it's coming through the sills so not his problem then I reported again approximately 2 years ago the guys identified the problem said its a big job and past it on to repairs department now I'm sitting in my house with a flooded living room don't mean to sound like a complainer but cmon guys years and years  without repairs I thought west of scotland housing where better than that

When I moved into my house 3 years ago I was told the wet room would be upgraded. My floor is a disgrace I can't get it clean. Got an old avocado sink and toilet. The walls are tiled with hideous tiles. I have been at them for three years but they refuse to upgrade. Shocking!!

Moved from London to Glasgow, my property is lovely with brand new kitchen and bathroom.
I like the Scotstoun area I live in as well the people are friendly. it‚Äôs nice and peaceful in the night time.
Staff at the office are polite and Helpful.

As a Tennant of this association for over 20+ yrs I can say if you need important work done it's treated as not important & the icing is ask for the person responsible they are not in,on holiday or at a meeting, this is the normal response of this association, & I'm being polite  to them.

Made to feel welcome, only phoned last week and by return of post had the paperwork I had requested.
Handed it in , and the member of staff was very helpful.
Amongst many organisations the Church of Scotland hold their services on a Sunday morning in this building. Very suitable and functional.

I am currently a Tennant with this housing association and everything was fine until it came to a transfer. My flat is tiny so tiny when I initially viewed the property the housing officer said you can put in for a transfer to get a larger flat straight away cause we know how small it is. I learned to grow with it and never bothered as I didn't see the point. 2 years into my tenancy I am pregnant and need another property so I can actually fit my baby into the property let alone all the things a baby need and getting told I've to wait 2 years for a property when my baby is due next month .. I have letter from my doctor's and midwife stating my current property and location is having a negative affect on my health and my unborn childs which I have handed into them & they have no even looked into yet and won't be until another month apparently. I have no room to even store a pram my property is that flat and when I pointed out I only have an option to store it in the close I'm getting told I can't do that due to health and safety. My rent is completely over priced specially for the size and location (Henrietta Street) and they have a cheek to increase it every month. They don't let you know when they have arranged appointments on your behalf with city building and expect you to be in the house 24/7 despite the fact people work. I would avoid this housing at all cost you'd be better of living on the street and cheaper going private let considering I'm basically ¬£400 a month for a flat the size of a cupboard.

Our neighbour had to clean the bin area it was a absolute mess with people not using the other bins a she seen rat's round bin area something will have to get done put up signs for the bin area that her in the picture her name is Claire from 2/1
4 Brechin street
G37HW
That's the third time cleaning it up
A thought you had a guy coming round and checking the back area  the best person who came round quiet often was Karen
Your Marjorie donnelly from 5/3 has sent this complaint to you

I am very fortunate with property I have with gwha.
Although I have been in many other gwha properties and in many cases I have found the state of some properties to be appalling, even in some of the "renovated" blocks, how some of the works were signed off as complete/satisfactory is incredible.
After reading some of the other reviews, I can agree, from my own experiences, that you do feel your are dealing with a very unprofessional organisation.
When speaking with some senior staff you do get an impression that they are in their post because of time served rather than competency and I get the impression that it would be a very toxic work environment if working there.
The sense you have to "deal with a cartel" of arrogant liars does perfuse any interactions.
Although it must be said that I have also met some very professional, competent and friendly staff but they are few and far between.
But overall, I wouldn't rate this organisation highly. A lot of their properties are well located and poorly maintained, a lot of the staff are passed their sell by date and their is without a doubt a dishonesty and completely undeserved arrogance.
Toxic culture.
Great wee housing!if u want a city centre flat!all in all I give them 3 stars for OK...

I could say anything here, literally anything, so ‚ÄúTHAT‚Äù is what I‚Äôm not gonnie continue to do , I‚Äôve already said ‚ÄúTHAT‚Äù twice now, so what I‚Äôll do is say ‚ÄúEXACTLY HOW I FELL‚Äù and if I need to repeat myself I will ‚ÄúEXACTLY HOW I FEEL‚Äù so now I‚Äôve repeatedly said  ‚ÄúEXACTLY HOW I FEEL‚Äù I hope people understand

I was the one who gave vote to west housing association to own our buildings , but I regretted now the wrong decision I have ever made. They are not caring about their property, tenants there are too many problems which put the health of tenants at risk but who cares no one . They never  get back to you when you call them or raise an issue with them  they just ignore you .  I‚Äôm living in a overcrowded property with my disable brother who has no space in my house but they always ignore me.
The corridors are very dirty , stairs never cleaned once a year could be cleaned most bathrooms covered with mould leaking another issue in front doors the way which comes from bathroom.  kitchens are broken I couldn‚Äôt include all here too many things to say even they popped in my house took pictures they see the units, sink broken physically but gone never get fixed or get back.
Kind regards

We have unfortunately been in the same mouldy, windy, freezing run down old flat the block is 130 yrs old and hasn‚Äôt had much modernisation. They do the absolute minimum essentials and have very little training with constantly bad outcomes. Our toilet has been leaking for about 10yrs and nobody will fix it. The windows aren‚Äôt air tight and the cold wind blows up through our floorboards. When we moved in, black mould covered the bathroom walls and sitting room. I now have emphysema/COPD crossover as I‚Äôm the one who was on my hand any knees scrubbing the mold off. Slumlords of the worst kind - in suits.

From my personal experience ive enjoyed being a tenant with wheatly homes. Been a few hiccups since i moved in on September but they have always tried to help me out when i had problems so far. Some of the reviews are a little harsh if honest when booking repairs haven't took anywhere close to as long as it did back at my old home with the edinburgh council themselves.

Largest housing organisation in Scotland and must be the worst by far for customer service, my grandson's flat was flooded, repair took ages to do it - how do these people get away with it?! Carpet ruined, still no heating + cowboy contractor being used by wild West landlord, get  the Regulator on to this!

For the first time when requesting something I felt like I was getting the 3rd degree about why I needed a service I had requested and the man went on and on repeating the same story making my phone call so stressful . Total disgrace of a company and have never had a single good experience with Park Property Management in the 5 years living here.

This review is reluctantly posted after months of documented failures and a complete breakdown in trust between them and residents. Common areas and perimeter grounds have not been maintained to acceptable standards. They have applied questionable communal charges, which remain unresolved numerous months after being disputed. Repeatedly found to be Incapable of communicating within reasonable time, often taking several weeks or longer to respond to serious matters and only after being pursued for responses - ignoring or failing to respond to residents appears to be a common custom and practice. Meetings have been repeatedly promised that failed to materialise. After constantly over-promising and under delivering on all fronts, they‚Äôre abandoning the development while blaming residents for their own shortcomings (gaslighting) and charging each resident a ¬£50 exit fee in the process while simultaneously refusing to coordinate a handover to alternative factors. It‚Äôs hard to distinguish whether this company is incompetent or wilfully negligent. A disaster from start to finish. I expect an excuse-laden deflective response to follow below.

PPM took over the factor management of the new build estate a live on. We never got anything to set up a direct debit with them we then received an unnecessarily aggressive letter saying we had missed a payment and were being billed with a late fee. A bill of which we're yet to receive a original invoice of. We called it was paid and the late fee was waved but no less than 6 months we have another late payment letter without an original invoice?
Abysmal service

My property is managed by Park PM, unfortunately, Park PM have been extremely unresponsive and even when they do respond, it is not a full and complete reply.

I had emailed enquiries regarding the charges incurred since January 2025 and have been chasing the Finance team multiple times via email. Called them and said they will get back to me, 3 weeks later still zero response. Called them again this week and said staff on holiday (really ? since January ?)  and will reply the next day.

Surprise surprise, I didn't get any reply the next day. Incompetent, unprofessional. Paul McDermott, if you are reading this, get a grip. The owners have already had a video call with yourself in the past year and these same exact issues were communicated to yourself but nothing has changed since.

This has been the worst property management company I‚Äôve ever had to deal with. Unfortunately, I am not in control of the contract for the residential area where I live. It is deeply frustrating to pay them each month, knowing how poor their customer service is and how consistently they fail to address even the most basic issues in the communal areas they are responsible for. Truly disgraceful.

Don't give you bins... we have 4 blue , 4 green (which i argued for saying i wasnt being the only tenent going to the tip as not enough bins, so to watch it all pile up) between 9 flats! Still have old wiring in the property actually getting shocks from the sockets and light switches at times now... but of course they don't listen... told me my wiring was up to date... backdoor is in a mess but pay a charge monthly for something I NEVER USE apart from putting rubbish out. Close cleaning that's paid for is abysmal..  the bottom get a nice good clean us higher are a scraping of a mop... I actually tested and left a wrapper outside my door when it was close cleaning day... was still there and not even moved so they don't move the mats...  shower is a trickle as no electric showers... and 3 counters (the size of the one most people use for only their kettles) to prepare meals for 6 people... can't even plate up dinner without using the draining rack.
Streets are in a mess... rubbish dumped everywhere... glass all over the grounds aswell... OH and I don't have a bin in my street because some drunk guy decided to throw it around one night 4 yrs ago.... being right next to 2 schools... you can imagine the mess...
People are constantly punished for previous tenants, others mistakes....
Sooner I can get away from her the better!
Oh BTW... thanks very much for taking away the MAIN wall when installing GCH a radiator slap bang in the middle of the biggest wall of the living room... no wonder I'm using extension cables everywhere... there is only 4 single plugs in the entire living room... im pretty sure this isn't adhering to the Scottish Gov conditions but hey ho according to WHA they have done all the upgrades!

The housing associations were helpful, all of the staff were friendly specially Sam. Due to these difficult times during the lock down. The staff sorted out a few concerns with my sons repairs, within the communal garden area that, needed prompt addressing. Williamsburgh updated my son and myself with regards to the work that will be carried out. Keep up the good work.

Fabulous support offered to my disabled daughter. Who is required to self isolate.
Staff called her to ensure she was getting help with shopping and had someone to talk to. Brilliant  thank you so much ‚ù§Ô∏è
Great staff. Repairs are all done very quick . Helped me tremendously. Great association

They helped me to get a new house quickly & seemed great. As soon as I moved into the property they withdrew their support & take absolutely FOREVER to do, complete or even start repairs! I know of 3 other people who have the same issue with them! Think carefully before joining this housing association xXx Update= Chasing me for rent that I do not owe, but when I ask anything about my repairs, I get nothing, no response, no answer, not a word, nothing. The repairs have been waiting from last November so Covid-19 is no excuse! How badly do I wish I had not moved to here... miss my last place so much xXx

Our building moved to Factors Direct a little over a year ago. Storms and pre-existing issues have caused lots of roof problems, but they‚Äôve been a constant help in sorting out repairs and getting agreement among owners for work to be done - all the stuff you don‚Äôt want to have to deal with personally. Consistently good communication. Happy with the service I‚Äôve received.

I am so happy our tenement switched to Factors Direct! They are a vast improvement on our previous factors. Their service is personal and they are quick to respond to requests and emails. I am delighted with the sub contractors they use for the garden and close and all the costs are reasonable too.

Used to be with Ross and Liddell in our old property moved to new house where factors direct were factors and we can honestly say they have been brilliant one phone call and the problem is fix within a few days with top quality tradesmen, we do highly recommend Factors Direct they do what they say

Changing factors , I was told, isn't easy.  Wrong - it was way harder.
But we had to .
The research and feedback produced only 1 result - Factors Direct.  It took some months to get the transfer done but FD were discreetly there every step of the way.
Two months in now and things are starting to click;
Gardeners properly instructed and a 2 year contract agreed
Electricity tariff for communal areas in apartment blocks being assessed (previous factor let it lapse onto highest tariff)
Buildings insurance for same extensively researched
Sensible application for minor repairs (previously : 2 light bulb replacement = ¬£300 " it was in our authorised limit.")

But the main thing is communication.  Communication is key.
So far, so very good
Factors direct have been excellent so far, really glad we made the switch to them this year, they were so helpful during this process as well. Recommended!

My family have now been under the care of the housing for over a year. We've dealt with people from all different dept. Very polite staff. Get repairs dealt with very quickly.
Been a tennant for over 25 yrs. Never had issue with them, always prompt with help with repairs/queries when needed.

The workmanship of contractors are atrocious must be cheapest unskilled workmen , hence shoddy job , will be contacting housing this morning also Hi-flow over dent in new fridge  freezer ,definitely not happy with outcome of new kitchen

Cat McKenzie has been very helpful and supportive since onset of Covid 19 pandemic. She is an asset to the team at YHA and I'm very happy to be a member of her group of tenants.
Customer service is amazing..my brother had lost the keys to his flat..a joiner was promptly phoned and arrived within the hour..understanding and excellent staff
